loans.name: Live & Laugh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng is 34 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She has had a retail business selling phonecard for two years.
Hằng lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this business is not high enough to cover the life cost and save money.
The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing more phonecard to resell.
This is Hằng first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard.
She is the group leader of "Live & Laugh", which consists of six members.
In the future, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing more phonecard to resell.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz está estudiando el profesorado en educación bilingüe, está en el tercer curso de la carrera, y comenta que para poder cubrir mis gastos de facultad esta recibiendo la ayuda de sus padres.
Su meta es estudiar más para así poder tener un buen trabajo y generar un buen ingreso para ayudar a su familia y darles un buen futuro.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
Liz is studying to become a bilingual education teacher. She is in her third year of her degree. Liz says that in order to cover her school expenses, she receives help from her parents.

Her goal is to study more so that she can have a good job and generate a good income in order to help her family and provide them a good future.

Liz is requesting this loan in order to pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a 39 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of five school aged children. She doesn't work, she is only focusing on her family and her husband represents the main source of income for the family. Due to the hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s study fees. Her purpose is to ensure her children to achieve high educational levels to be competitive with others.

loans.use: to pay her children’s study fees

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is running a convenience store in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is assisted by Paglaum MPC on her loan availments. She is making good sales today that she wants to expand her business and to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, confectioneries, condiments and others. She asks for a loan from the cooperative to finance her expansion.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, confectioneries, condiments and others

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 42 years old, married and has five children. Four of whom are in school.

Mercy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mercy has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Chhern's Group

texts.en: Chhern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chhern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is , mother of two children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She herself owns a nursery farm business for the last eight years, where She sells different kinds of plants. Mostly she focuses on flower plants, fruit plants, and some export quality plants to sell to her customers.she prefers quality instead of quantity from her nursery farming business.She has been feeding her family through the generated income from this nursery farm business. Nowadays, the needs of her family suddenly increased and she does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So she decided to expand her current business.  Therefore, MUSARAT requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy more plants for sale. MUSARAT thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her business of plants and flowers.

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.es:
Rosalino es comerciante de la ciudad de Pilar, está acompañado, y tiene un hijo por quien se esfuerza para darle una mejor calidad de vida. Posee un Kiosco en su barrio donde vende comidas y a toda hora del día.
Rosalino  es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con buenas referencias, que se esfuerza por su familia y por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, aceite, fideo, bebidas y otros, de manera a poder hacer las comidas que vende en su kiosco. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosalino is a retailer living in the town of Pilar. He has a life partner and has a child, and he makes efforts to provide him with a better standard of living. He owns a kiosk, located in his neighborhood, where he sells meals all day long.

Rosalino is a very hardworking and determined person, he has good references and he works hard for his family and for the people he loves.

He is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of flour, oil, noodles, soft drinks and other products in order to prepare the meals he sells in hi kiosk. He is grateful for the change he is being given to grow and progress.

loans.use: buy flour, oil, noodles, soft drinks and other products to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 32 years old and with her parents she lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Narine already 5 years works as a hairdresser. She rents a space for her work and she furnished and made it very comfortably, modern and attractive for her customers among whom she has a lot of regular customers who likes her style and the quality of her work. She works very quickly and cutely and in a short period of time she manages to end her work with very good results.

She is happy to each customer and manages her work very skillfully. Narine says that she likes her work and she does her best to satisfy each customer in order that she will lose none of them. Now with this loan Narine plans to buy a special hair washing and also hair drying equipment for her salon to work quickly and with comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a special hair washing and also hair drying equipment for her salon to work quickly and with comfort for her customers

loans.name: Alex Dario

texts.es:
Alex  de 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres a quien les ayuda económicamente. El es un hombre que trabaja en la agricultura, sin horario alguno, el se dedica a este trabajo muy duro que requiere de mucha dedicación y esfuerzo hace 2 años atrás. El dinero que genera esta actividad es su único ingreso.
Alex solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, así sus sembríos no se dañaran y podrá sacarlos al mercado.
texts.en:
Alex is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents in order to help them financially. He works in agriculture without a set schedule. Alex works very hard at his job since it requires much dedication and effort. He has been doing this for two years. The money that he generates from this work is his only income.

Alex is requesting a loan in order to buy compost so that his crops do not suffer damage and become unsellable at the market.

loans.use: to buy compost for his crops.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like umbrella, shoes, blouses, etc. to sell for her selling dry goods business.

Teodora has been in this business for 10 years. Teodora earns more income from raising chickens.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods like umbrella, shoes, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa continua con sus estudios en administración de empresas, pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder conseguir sus anhelos de ser una excelente profesional y por medio de sus conocimientos poder ayudar a las demás personas. Comenta que con su anterior préstamo pago sus cuotas, lo que le permitió poder seguir estudiando.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las matriculas de su carrera, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ninfa continues her studies in Business Administration. She is giving her best effort so that she can continue her dream of becoming a successful professional. With her knowledge, she wants to be able to help other people. Ninfa says that her previous loan was used to pay her fees, which allowed her to continue studying.

She is requesting a new loan in order to pay the registration fees for her degree. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her registration fees.

loans.name: Alfredo Rafael

texts.es: Alfredo es un emprendedor que reside en una urbanización de Cartagena de Indias en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos y con su negocio de pasabocas típicos ha logrado sostenerlos y ofrecerles bienestar.  Esta idea de negocio surgió después de contraer nupcias, puesto que anteriormente era agricultor, sin embargo un familiar de su cónyuge con gran experiencia en elaboración de pasabocas le recomendó iniciarse en el negocio y le permitió aprender su elaboración y demás aspectos relevantes para su buen funcionamiento.  Una vez había adquirido toda la indumentaria necesaria inició en la terraza de su vivienda con excelentes resultados, muestra de su compromiso y dedicación, puesto que diariamente empieza a trabajar a las 3 a.m. y termina de comercializar a las 12:30 del medio día. Los residentes del sector están muy felices de poder comprar empanadas, carimañolas, deditos, patacones, arepas de huevo y jugos naturales, alimentos con los que pueden desayunar para dirigirse a sus labores o aquellos que deseen merendar simplemente.  Alfredo está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en un molino y una estufa de dos puestos para independizar su negocio de los enseres de su vivienda y poder dispones de más tiempo en la elaboración de los pasabocas sin cruzar sus horarios con la preparación de los alimentos de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo is an entrepreneur who lives in a community in Cartagena de Indias with his wife and children. With his business selling typical snack foods he has been able to support his family and offer them well-being.

The idea for the business came about after he was married, as before he worked in agriculture. One of his wife's relatives had much experience in making snack foods and he suggested Alfredo start a business. This way he was able to learn how to make the foods and about other relevant aspects of the business. Once he had acquired all the necessary supplies he started his activity on the terrace of his house and achieved excellent results. He shows his commitment and dedication by starting his day at 3:00 a.m. and finishing at 12:30 noon.

The local residents are very happy to be able to buy meat pies, turnovers, nuggets, fritters, egg pancackes and natural juices which they can enjoy for breakfast before going off to work or for an afternoon snack.

Alfredo is applying for a CrediKiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy a grinder and a two-burner stove so he does not have to use the home appliances for his business activity. This will give him more time to make the snack foods without running into conflicting schedules regarding meals for the family.

loans.use: to buy a grinder and two-burner stove to separate business and home activity.

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 60  años de edad,  tiene  un hijo que depende de él y de su esposa, vive con su hijo y su esposa en su casa propia, en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 11 años  al negocio de la venta de de abarrotería como ser productos de la canasta familiar.
Don Santos sus clientes son vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan, también vende a pulperías en las cuales tiene que caminar kilómetros porque ahí no entran carros a dejar productos los cuales acarrea en el lomo y en caballo el producto y así de esa manera atiende a sus clientes en su pequeño negocio.
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como pan, frescos, churros, jugos, maíz, azúcar, arroz, etc. con el apoyo del crédito el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida tiene en proyecto para este año mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Santos, 60, lives with his wife and dependent son in their own house in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For 11 years he has been selling groceries, especially every day products.

Santos sells mainly to neighbors and friends who visit him daily. He also sells to other stores that are kilometers away, having to walk there because vehicles do not have access so he must either carry the goods on his back or on horseback. This is how he attends to customers in his small business.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy goods such as bread, fresh produce, doughnuts, juices, corn, sugar, rice, etc. With the help of the loan he can improve his income and quality of life. This year he wants to renovate his house.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, fresh produce, doughnuts, juices, corn, sugar, rice, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Tomasa Requilda

texts.es:
Tomasa Requilda con 64 años de edad,de estado civil casada,vive junto a su esposo,en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Tomasa Requilda se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, pavos, patos, cerdos, etc,con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Solicita préstamo para arreglos de infraestructura de corral, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Tomasa Requilda es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido cuatro créditos de S/.1000,00; S/.1000,00; S/.2000,00 y S/.1500,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Tomasa Requiida, 64, is married and lives with her husband in the district of Oyotun, province of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque, in Peru. The locals here work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Tomasa Requilda raises and sells animals such as roosters, chickens, hens, turkeys, ducks, pigs, etc. and has over 15 years experience. Her work is set up at home. She is requesting a loan to fix up the farmyard so she can have more animal variety and productivity which will have a great influence on the business. This way she can increase her stock and meet the different demands and needs of customers in her area.

Tomasa Requilda is a returning customer of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had four loans in the amounts of 1,000 PEN; 1,000 PEN; 2,000 PEN and 1,500 PEN which she has paid back on time.

loans.use: to fix up her farmyard.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es:
El señor Paulo de 49  años de edad,  tiene  dos hijos que depende de él y de su esposa que también le ayuda en sus gastos,  vive con sus hijos y su esposa en su casa propia, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Don Paulo sus clientes son los amigos y personas que visitan su casa es un hombre trabajador que cría también cerdos para venderlos para destazo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos comestibles para su negocio compra de pan, frescos, churros, jugos, sopas, maíz, azúcar, arroz, etc. también quiere comprar dos cerdos para cría y venderlos en el mes de diciembre.
Don Paulo con el apoyo del crédito el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida tiene en proyecto para este año mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Paulo is 49-years old. He has two children that depend on him and his wife who also helps him with the expenses. He lives with his children and his wife in their own house. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. His customers are the friends and people that visit his house. He is a hard-working person that also raises pigs to sell for butchering. He is asking for a loan to buy grocery products for his business such as bread, soft drinks, churros, juices, soups, corn, sugar, rice, etc. He also wants to buy two pigs to raise and sell in December. With the help from the loan, Paulo wants to improve his income and quality of life. He has a project this year to improve his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, churros, juices, soups, corn, sugar, rice, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
La señora  Brenda  de  29 años de edad, es casada   vive con su esposo tiene dos hijos que depende de ella, vive en San Lorenzo, al  sur de Honduras  en casa propia  y se dedica desde hace varios años  a la venta de tortillas, sus clientes son los pobladores de la comunidad, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 
La señora Brenda está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, leña, cal que es  la materia prima  para elaborar sus tortillas  ya que viene la época de navidad y desea tener suficiente materia prima para no comprar caro el grano, está muy alegre del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar.

Su sueño es pode darles una buena vida a su familia.

San Lorenzo, honduras -  Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Brenda, 29, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and two dependent children in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For several years she has been selling tortillas to her customers who are the people in the community. She is a hard worker with a desire to get ahead.

Brenda is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, the raw materials to make tortillas since the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to have enough supplies on hand to avoid paying higher prices for the grain. She is very happy to receive the support Prisma is offering her.

Her dream is to give her family a good lifestyle.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, etc.

loans.name: Wendy Sabrina

texts.es: Wendy de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, su esposo y su hermana, ella posee un negocio de venta de pupusas y antojitos desde hace 3 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que resive logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz, chicharron, quesillos, verduras, entre otros ingredientes para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Wendy is 35-years old and lives in her own home with her daughter, her husband and her sister. She has owned a business selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and snacks for 3 years. Her business is located in her home and with the earnings that she gets, she manages to resolve some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, pork rinds, fresh cheeses, vegetables and other ingredients to continue with her sales and thus have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork rinds, fresh cheeses, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es:
Ana Marleny con 45 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su esposo e hijos,en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ana Marleny se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos,pollos,pavos,etc, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años en el negocio. Adiiconalmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chupetes en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para terminar de construir su baño. De esta manera le facilitará vivir en mejores condiciones junto a su familia.

Ana Marleny es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. .
texts.en:
Ana Marleny, 45, lives with her common-law husband and children in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque in Peru. The local people here work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Ana Marleny raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, etc. and has over ten years' experience in the sector. She also makes and sells popsicles. She is requesting a loan to finish building a bathroom which will improve the living conditions of her family.

Ana Marleny is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

.

loans.use: to finish building a bathroom.

loans.name: Rossy Shirley

texts.es:
Rossy es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia enfermería. 
Ella es inteligente, alegre y muy optimista. Sus estudios los realiza en un instituto superior de estudios médicos, situado en la zona ‘ceja del alto’ caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas y donde se agrupan la mayor parte de oficinas públicas y privadas.
Rossy es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la realiza en casa propiedad de sus padres que trabajan, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella se dedica a estudiar enfermería, cuenta con un gran compromiso social, es solidaria, respeta la vida humana y sobretodo su vocación es de servicio, “la profesión que estudio es mi vocación porque tengo paciencia, soy muy comunicativa y me gusta el trabajo en equipo…” comenta. La ventaja de su profesión es que estudia en un instituto reconocido, la desventaja es la larga distancia desde su casa hasta su instituto. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y trabajar en un centro médico ayudando a los pacientes, ella desea pagar los gastos de matriculación y comprar material de estudio como, libros y textos necesarios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a estudiar enfermería.
Es por esos motivos que Rossy solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de matriculación y comprar material de estudio.
texts.en:
Rossy is a 26-year old woman. She is single, with no children and is studying nursing. She is intelligent, happy and very optimistic. She does her studies in a higher institute of medical studies, located in the "Ceja del Alto" area, characterized for its business in all areas and is where most of the public and private offices are located.

Rossy is dark-skinned, with long black hair and a thin physique. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives in a house owned by her working parents, built of brick and which has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system.

She studies nursing and has a great social commitment, is supportive, respects human life and above everything her calling is in service. "The profession that I study is my calling because I have patience, I am very communicative and I like to work in a team..." she says.

The advantage of her profession is that she studies in a recognized institute. The disadvantage is the long distance from her house to the institute. Her dream is to finish studying and work in a medical center helping the patients. She wants to pay her school fees and buy school materials such as books and necessary texts.

This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the 2 years that she has been studying nursing. For those reasons, Rossy is requesting a loan to pay her school fees and buy school materials.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy school materials.

loans.name: Paulino Ismael

texts.es: Paulino de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la elaboracion de mani y dulce de coco artesanal desde hace 14 años inicio gracias a que su padre le enseño esa actividad, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de coco, mani, azucar entre otros ingredientes para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Paulino is 35-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has worked making homemade peanut and coconut caramel for 14 years. He started this thanks to his Dad who taught him how. He sells his products in the different markets that can be found close to his home. He is requesting a loan to buy coconut, peanuts, sugar and other ingredients to continue with his job that gets him good earnings.

loans.use: to buy coconut, peanuts, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 46  años  de edad, tiene dos hijos que dependen de él, vive en casa de su madre, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo en la parte sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 18 años a la fabricación de balcones, puertas, ventanas, techos, etc. el es una persona trabajadora con deseos salir adelante.
Don Oscar está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de una maquina de soldar, con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su negocio.
Su sueño es tener un buen taller de soldadura bien equipado.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Oscar, 46 yeas old, has two children who are dependent on him. He lives in his mother's house, living in the city of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. He has worked for 18 years making balconies, doors, windows, roofs, etc., he is a hard-working person with the desire to get ahead.

Oscar is asking for the loan to purchase a welding machine, with the support of this loan, he plans to improve his income and also his business.

His dream is to have a good, well-equiped welding shop.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine for his business.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito con 50 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge,en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Benito cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Benito se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales de corral como son gallinas,cuyes,pavos,patos,etc, cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el negocio. Adicionalmnente se dedica a la agricultura en temporadas sembrando productos de pan llevar. Así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola en su caserío. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales de corral, para engorde y posterior venta. De esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Benito es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Benito, 50 years old and partnered, lives with his partner in San Felipe district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. Benito has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The people in this place work primarily in agriculture, trade, and raising animals.

Benito works raising and selling barnyard animals such as hens, guinea pigs, turkeys, ducks, etc. He has more than 8 years of experience in the business. In addition, he works in agriculture seasonally, planting food products. He also works as a farm laborer in his village. He asks for the loan to purchase barnyard animals, to fatten and later sell. In this way, he will be able to get an acceptable profit to improve his quality of life.

Benito is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase barnyard animals to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es: Carlos es un microempresario habitante en un municipio en el departamento de Cundinamarca llamado Sopó, allí reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos. Él es un experimentado tapicero de muebles que se ha dedicado durante 30 años a esta labor, la cual aprendió de un hermano a quien le servía de ayudante en su taller de tapicería.  Sus trabajos son reconocidos en el sector y cuenta con una amplia clientela a quienes está dispuesto a recibir en su local, todos los días de la semana a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adquirir una máquina remachadora y un compresor pequeño, con lo que garantizará una mejor efectividad en su trabajo. Carlos desea a largo plazo adquirir su propio taller para dejar de pagar arriendo y contar con mejores ingresos en pro de la economía de su hogar.
texts.en: Carlos is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in a municipality in the department of Cundinamarca, called Sopó. He lives there in the company of his spouse and children. He is an experienced furniture upholsterer who has worked in this field for 30 years, which he learned from a brother who he served as an assistant in his upholstery shop. His work is well-known in the area and he has a broad customer base who he is ready to serve in his shop every day from 8 am to 9 pm. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to get a riveting machine and a small compressor, which will guarantee more efficiency in his work. Carlos wants, in the long term, to get his own shop to stop paying rent and have more income to support his household economy.

loans.use: to get a riveting machine and a small compressor.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is a farmer who has mastered corn growing in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is financed by Paglaum MPC, where she is a member in good standing, as evidenced by her payments without default. Recently, she has requested a loan to purchase high quality corn seed and bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality corn seed and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 49 years old and married, and she has eight children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Evangeline has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goats to raise.

Evangeline has been raising goats for 2 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to raise

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en: Deogracia is 44 and married to a driver, and they are blessed with 5 children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 1 year, and she earns a net income of 6,000 PHP a month. She would like to borrow a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, beverages, biscuits, candies, and noodles to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, beverages, biscuits, candies, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Myraluna

texts.en:
Myraluna is 42 years old, married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store, like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Myraluna has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from direct selling. Myraluna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store, like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Ka's Group

texts.en: Ka’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ka makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren is 28 years old and single with one child. Loren works very hard to provide for her family.

Loren runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks, etc. Loren has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Loren would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and drinks

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 45 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school.

Florencia is in the agricultural business (pig fattening) in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Florencia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 37 years old and married. Ellen works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks, etc.

Ellen has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from a manicure and pedicure service.

Ellen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and drinks

loans.name: Diona

texts.en:
Diona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

Diona has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Diona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Furaha Majohe Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a genge and clothing sales, for ten years now. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to earn a very good profit per month.

This will be Mwanaidi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes and to restock the out-of-stock fruits and vegetables to meet customers' request and needs. She dreams of expanding her business and taking her kids to a good school.

Mwanaidi will share this loan with her loan group, FURAHA MAJOHE, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes and to restock fruits and vegetables to meet customer demand

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita lives in Ormoc City, Leyte. She is into raising hogs and chickens to earn for her family. Since 2012, she barely earns PHP 1,000 per month. She is asking for a loan to buy another piglet and more feed for her pigs and chickens. Nenita believes in perseverance and the possibility of expanding her business with the help of the loan. Any income generated from this business will keep her three children in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and married with 13 children. With four children in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. Elvira has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nyesi

texts.en: Nyesi is married with two children. She does tailoring in a local market. It’s the only source of income. By doing this, she is able to provide for her family and above all pay school fees for her children. She desires  to expand her business but she is limited by capital alongside high taxes. At the moment Nyesi would love to buy more materials for sewing and selling. The challenge is that the money she has is not enough. She is requesting for a loan to buy such items.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, milk, coffee, etc. Editha has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Ita, who is 45 years old and married with three sons. Ita has been selling and crediting electronics and her husband is an employee for two years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to install sanitation at their home to improve their access to sanitation and provide clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Ita will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to sanitation and clean water at her home for her family.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials like nylon threads, wire, and shells for her handicraft business. Vicky has been in this business for two years. Vicky earns more income from selling ready-to-wear.

Vicky has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like nylon threads, wire, and shells for her business

loans.name: Delmis

texts.es:
La señora  Delmis de 32 años edad, vive con su esposo actual  tiene cuatro  hijos que dependen de ellos, tiene  casa  propia se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina y fresco natural, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que transitan todos los días por su negocio  es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir delante.

La señora Delmis está solicitando el préstamo para poder ampliar su negocio y quiere comprar materiales como ser: cemento, graba, arenilla, varilla, etc., es un cliente que solicita su segundo crédito, está muy contenta con el apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar

Su sueño es terminar su casa y poder tener una mejor vida junto a su familia 

San Lorenzo, Honduras- de Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Delmis is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her new husband. They have four children who depend on them. For two years, she has been earning a living by making and selling flour tortillas and fresh fruit drinks. Her customers are the friends and people who pass by her business every day. She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.

Delmis is requesting a loan to be able to expand her business, and she wants to buy building materials such as cement, gravel, coarse sand, rods, etc. She is a client who is asking for her second loan. She is very happy with the support that Prisma has provided to her.

Her dream is to finish her house and to be able to have a better life with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015.

loans.use: to be able to expand her business and to buy building materials such as cement, gravel, coarse sand, rods, etc.

loans.name: Huệ's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. Huệ lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Huệ been working in agriculture raising fish for five years. Theincome from this is unstable because when the fish get some disease they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell. And she would be in financial trouble.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby fish to raise and sell in the future.

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the leader of a three-member group.

In the future, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby fish to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old and married. She has three adult children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

She is a retailer of basic consumable goods in their place and is making good sales from it. She is grateful to Paglaum MPC for giving her the opportunity to engage in business by providing her with the needed capital.

Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.use: to restock the store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 50 years old and is a poultry farmer. She has been in this business for one year now. She is a single mother of three children.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this loan to buy chicks and poultry feeds, which will enable her to have more stock of chicken and eggs for sell to support her family. She will use the generated profits to buy more poultry feeds and repay the loan.

In the future, she hopes to have a successful poultry business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Verginia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Verginia has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Delma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Delma has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sugar, biscuits, sanitary pads, toothpaste, canned goods, beer, etc. to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, biscuits, sanitary pads, toopaste, canned goods, beer, etc.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sugar, biscuits, sanitary pads, toothpaste, canned goods, beer, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aliveta

texts.en:
Aliveta is 47 years old and married. She has two children.

Aliveta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aliveta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Aliveta has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aliveta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 51, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anita has a selling ornamental plants business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Anita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol is a 22-year-old nursing student who is pursuing an associate’s degree at university in the city. She is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia.

Kol's family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

Now, Kol is lacking the finances to pay her university fees from the second to the third year, so she would like to apply for a loan.

She will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully with this loan.

Kol wants to open her own clinic and to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the second to the third year

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Bernardino is 65 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC. He is a widower who operates a hog-raising business in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena.

He has been doing well in doing this type of business, making him able to support the needs of his family. He has helped also his children in providing for the needs of their respective families.

Recently, he asked for a loan from the cooperative to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

He is looking forward for more successful years of partnership with the cooperative in alleviating poverty in their area of operation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is 42 years old, married and has six children.

She had been in the retail business for about two years now and patiently generates income for her family's daily needs. She also sells vegetables for additional income.

She wants to increase her sales, and that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, cabbages, tomatoes and eggplants to sell. This will help increase her sales and earn more profits as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Flordecita

texts.en:
Flordecita works hard to support her family. Flordecita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Flordecita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Flordecita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Flordecita would like to save enough to provide a secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 42, is a married woman with five children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janet has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more chorizo to sell to her customers.

Janet has been in this business for five years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chorizo to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 45 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Eulalia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Eulalia has been in this business for 15 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sreyloun's Group

texts.en:
Age 26 years, Sreyloun is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of one daughter who is too young for school.

Sreyloun earns a living through farming rice, which she has been doing for 7 years to help support the family while her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, she and her husband can earn about 50,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from the current business and are able to save about 30,000 each day for the future.

This is the first loan for Sreyloun with VisionFund. She and her group member, who live in the same village, are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Sreyloun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreynik

texts.en:
Sreynik, 20, was an outstanding student when she was in high school. Currently, she is studying at university to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Khmer literature. Sreynik is from Pursat Province in Cambodia. Her mother is a widow.

Sreynik does not have sufficient finances to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year, so she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to go through her fourth year at the university successfully and improve her knowledge.

When she finishes her bachelor degree, Sreynik wants to find work with reasonable salary to improve her living. She also wants to build a new house for her family, and if she has children, she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if she can support it.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is 28 years old and has a retail shop. He is married and blessed with two children. He has been in this business for four years, and it has been profitable.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he successfully repaid his previous loans. He will be using the loan to buy more stock of sugar, tea leaves, milk, loaves of bread and soap to sell, which he hopes will enable him to get more income to educate his children.

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and add more stock in his shop. In the future he hopes to expand his retail shop, make more income and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, tea leaves, milk, loaves of bread and soap to sell, which he hopes will enable him to get more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita, 46, is a married woman with eight children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juanita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods like tempura, fish balls, etc. for her business.

Juanita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods like tempura, fish balls, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 51 years old and married with one child. Emy works very hard to provide for her family.

Emy runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Emy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

In the future Emy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 30 years old and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is married.

Maricris is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Maricris has been raising chickens for 2 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Angellica

texts.en:
Angellica is a married hard working woman who deals in selling used shoes in Hoima, Uganda. For extra income Angellica does farming, mainly growing cassava and gnuts.

Upon realizing the need for her to generate enough earnings, she ventured into business in 2013 to generate more income. Her business is exposed to bad debts and in adequate capital, yet she desires to have a well-stocked business in town that will increase her capital base.

Angellica is seeking a loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dieu is a hardworking woman, and is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house without a hygienic latrine.

This loan will help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from farming and her husband’s salary. With more than 15 years experience and with support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 30 years old and married. There are six people in her family. She works hard to support her family.

She needs loan to build a sanitary latrine to improve the health of her family members and also for environmental protection.

Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Sim is aged 51 years and married with six children, four daughters and three sons; and only one of whom is still in school. For more than 30 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of family’s income to make a living. Sometimes they work as a laborer for a fee. Together, they can earn about 60,000KHR per day and manage to save about KHR30,000 each day for future needs.

Sim has never been with VisionFund before; this is her first cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan.

Sim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for supporting her farmland.

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
4 years ago Artur had his first Kiva loan which was very great and helpful for his business and now he hopes for one more profitable partnership with Kiva but this time with another plan.

Artur lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region with his daughter. His wife now temporally lives and works in the Russian Federation. Artur still has his business and simultaneously does farming which provides also his family with fresh products such as milk, meat and eggs. He also sells these products from his farm to his neighbors and also to his regular customers.

Artur made some savings during many years and now he decided to make some repairs with them. He was confused a little bit since he found out that his savings are not enough to finish all the work. Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams he Artur needs in order to finish the repair works of his house and he wants to have a clean and comfortable house near to the New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: to finish the repair works on his house and manage to have clean and comfortable house near to the New Year’s holidays.

loans.name: Grupo Flor De Cafe Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una señora de 52 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de 10 hijos de las edades entre 17 y 35 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Guineales.
Manuela (la segunda de derecha a izquierda de blusa blanca) para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica desde hace 10 años gracias a esta actividad a su familia ha sacado adelante. Manuela tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de paños típicos, ella comprara hilos de diferentes colores y estilos. Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 52-year old lady, she is married and she has a beautiful family composed of 10 children aged between 17 and 35. They live in a neighborhood of the hamlet of Guineales.

To earn a living, Manuela (the second from the right with a white blouse) engages in creating traditional clothes, and she has been working in this field for 10 years. Thanks to this activity, she has provided for her family. Manuela needs to ask for a loan to buy basic materials to create traditional clothes. She will buy threads in different colors and styles. Her biggest dream is to strengthen her activity and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy threads in different colors and styles.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 55 years old and has a tailoring business in Mombasa town. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She is a widow and supports three adults. 

This is her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid the previous loans. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine and hopes this will enable her to make more clothes for sell and generate more income to buy more tailoring materials. In future she hopes to open a big boutique and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and hopes this will enable her to make more clothes for sale

loans.name: Empin

texts.en:
Empin is a 42-year-old married with three sons. Empin is a wife and her husband is a breeder for twenty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 3.500,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Empin will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. .

loans.name: Shery

texts.en:
Shery is 35 years old and has three children. Shery is married and has three children are still in school.

Shery is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Shery requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shery has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shery would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan is a hardworking woman, 29 years old. She is married and has three children . Her family’s income is mainly from fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 36-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah city Gaza strip, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and one child in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Husam took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy an electrical generator for use it when electricity cut off from the family house. Palestinians are dependent on electricity in all walks of life, and the lack of electricity create a big problem and a generator has become the main alternative in every home.

loans.use: buy an electrical generator for use it when electricity is cut off from the family house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 39 years old. She lives with her family at Alcala. She is married and had four children. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She had been in her business over five years now. Vilma wanted to buy more goods to sell that is why she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy sardines, breads, softdrinks, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help her offer more goods and gain additional profits.

loans.use: to buy sardines, breads, softdrinks, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 26 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ailyn has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. Ailyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Ailyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to expand business .

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en:
Khoeun lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Tbaung Khmum province, Cambodia. She is 46 years old and married. To support her big family, she and her husband have been working as rice and cassava farmers for 28 years. Low crop yield has been a challenge for her business.

Khoeun has been with VisionFund for one cycle already, and this is her second cycled loan. The past loan helped her with sufficient foods for her family members. Now she is leading her group of four female members to apply for a loan.

Khoeun will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to plow land. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a living better and afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to plow land.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun, 32, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother with two children. For the last seventeen years, Sun has been working as a rice farmer to make a living. To earn additional income, she also works as a garment worker. She can manage to earn about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Sun has been with VisionFund for two cycles already. The past loans have helped her a lot with her rice farming business and also it has enabled her to renovate her old house. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice farming. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more crop product from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella works hard to support her family. Ma. Bella is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Bella requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.

Ma. Bella has been in this business for 12 years now.

Ma. Bella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Grisha

texts.en:
Grisha is 39 years old and he lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Grisha has higher pedagogical edutaion and already 15 years he works at the school as a teacher of military education. As he mentions he likes his work and he does his best to make his lessons interesting and through his lessons he also explains the role of patriotism in the life of each person. Grisha’s wife works as a baker and together they also manage to take care of their farm which brings income and also provides good products for their family.

Grisha asks this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also some professional literature these will be great opportunity for him for his self-development activities and with more information he will make his lessons more attractive for his pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also some professional literature these will be great opportunity for him for his self-development activities

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area in the Korng Pisey district of Kampong Spuer province, Sopheap is 36 years old and married. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school.

The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and pig raising. To better support the family, her husband also works as a policeman. Having been in this business for 18 years, Sopheap can earn about 15 USD per day and manages to save about 3 USD each day after expenses. The main challenges for her family’s business are the drop of rice’s price and unhealthy rice crops.

Sopheap has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already. This time, she is asking for a new loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee at university. She hopes this loan will allow her daughter to stay in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee at university

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine is a 44-year-old married mother of four. Four years ago, she opened a hardware shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is well-known among her region for her diversified products. She succeeded through these years in gaining her loyal customers. This shop helped in increasing her family's income, and she was able to move to a bigger house.

Yasmine is a hard working woman who is working hard to develop her business more, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to add carpentry and metalwork hardware to her merchandise.
Yasmine hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to add carpentry and metalwork hardware to her merchandise

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en: Evelinda owns and operates her home based variety store since 2014.She also plants and harvest cassava to her one point five hectare (1.5) of farm land and raised hogs.For now, she would like to focus herself into her variety store because it's where she gets her family daily necessities.To keep her variety store progressive and satisfy her customer demand, she is requesting for additional capital of PHP15,000 to be use in buying more stocks of grocery items such as soft drinks,detergent soap,oil,vinegar,sugar,coffee,breads,ingredients and eggs to sell.She would be thankful if her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to be use in buying soft drinks,detergent soap,oil,vinegar,sugar,coffee,breads,ingredients and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This solar heater will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a 31 year old livestock trader at Kongowea Nyali area in Kenya. He support seven children and has been in this business for the last four years earning a good income.

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase sheep and goats for resale and the anticipated profit to educate and feed his family. He hopes to have a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 38 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Maxima is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maxima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maxima has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maxima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is 43 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is an electrician by profession. Her husband has been providing his services to the people of his society as a good electrician for the last eighteen years. He has some basic electricity tools like cables,  switches, fan regulators, lights, etc. at home for resale. Some tools for his own work were required to him. So Khalida made contact to brac Pakistan for loan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan for purchasing electricity maintenance tools such as lights, cables, switches etc. Khalida is so much thankful to kiva and field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband with his cable work.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, 38, is a married living with her two children in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through growing tobacco, eggplant and chili pepper. She is also a vegetable seller. Kong has been in this business for 20 years, earning about KHR50,000 per day and is able to save about KHR25,000 each day after expenses for the future needs.

Kong has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable growing in order to get a good result. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business to respond to her customers’ needs on time and also hopes to earn a larger income to make her living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable growing in order to get a good result

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa is a 41-year-old mother of three children and earns a living through farming rice while her husband works as a construction worker to earn additional income. Two of their children are in school while another one is too young for school. Having been in this business for 23 years, they can earn about $10 per day, but they can manage to save about $3 each day after deducting expenses.

Channa is the fourth cycled client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s livings and business. She is now requesting a loan to pay for her nephew’s university tuition fee to study Banking and Finance. She hopes this loan will help her nephew to be a well-educated person and get a good job in the future

loans.use: to pay for her nephew’s university tuition fee to study Banking and Finance.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Lourdes is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like baking powder, butter, milk, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Ma. Lourdes has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like baking powder, butter, milk, sugar, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Donaldo Antonio

texts.es: Donaldo de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace 11 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas para continuar con su trabajo ya que le va bien en sus ventas.
texts.en: Donaldo is 37 years old and lives in his house with his wife their and three children.  For 11 years he has made his living cultivating corn, selling his products in the different markets that they find close to their home area.  This way he achieves sufficient sales to be able to pay some of the expenses that arise in his home.  Donaldo is again requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers, manure, and pest controls in order to continue his work, since he is doing well with his sales.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, manure, and pest controls.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Nurat runs a beauty salon to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. She works daily from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m., and reports that she is able to make a fair monthly profit. She is the single mother of one child, who attends school.

This will be Nurat's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan funds to increase her salon products, and has managed to repay both her previous loans successfully. She used her increased profits to pay her child's school fees and to cover her household expenses, as well as to repay her loan.

Nurat's business is doing great as a result of these loan investments, and Nurat appreciates the support she receives from her Kiva group, Parachichi, which has three members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

She will use her current loan funds to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements. Her goal is to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date products for her salon to meet customer demand

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, es una madre soltera que vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería y a la venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, ya que ella ha crecido en un entorno de personas luchadoras y que practican  diferentes actividades para subsistir, María tiene 34 años dedicándose a atender su negocio propio y con el cual ha podido sobrellevar la responsabilidad de sus hijos.
María solicita un crédito para  invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas, una novilla, así como también frutas y verduras, con esto ella pretende tener cosechas más abundantes e incrementar el número de ganado, considera que así atenderá a más clientes con lo que podrá obtener más ganancia.
El sueño de María es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, crecer con su negocio y convertirse en una microempresaria.
texts.en:
María is a single mother who lives with her two children. She makes her living in agriculture, livestock, and the sale of fruits and vegetables. She learned this business from her family, as she has grown up in an environment of resilient people, who work hard at different activities to survive. María has been dedicated to tending to her own business for 34 years, with which she has been able to bear the responsibility for her children.
