María is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies, a heifer, and fruits and vegetables. With this she intends to obtain higher yields and increase her number of cattle. She believes that in this way she may serve more customers and thus can earn more income.

María's dream is to be able to improve her life and that of her family, to grow her business and become a small business owner.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, a heifer, and fruits and vegetables; with this she intends to have more abundant harvests and to increase her number of cattle.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a food vendor, preparing and selling food items from her "mamalishe" (food stall) to earn her living. She has operated her business for 10 years, and she works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily. She reports that she is able to make a good monthly profit.

Hidaya is in her late thirties. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school.

This will be Hidaya's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase the stock she uses for her mamalishe, and she has paid back all three loans successfully. She is happy to have benefited from these loan investments. With her increased profits, she paid her children's school fees, bought additional cooking ingredients, and covered her household expenses, as well as repaying her loan.

Hidaya is a responsible person who will hold herself accountable for the repayment of her current loan. She will use her current loan funds to replenish the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe.

Her goal is to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to replenish essential out-of-stock items in her food stall business

loans.name: Guadalupe Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes desde hace 6 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Doña Guadalupe is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  For the past 6 years she has made a living by selling clothing and perfume from her house. She has plenty of customers and this provides an income to help meet the household expenses.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise wholesale and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume  wholesale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like electronic re-loading.

Thelma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and married.  

Emma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emma has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Latecia

texts.en:
Latecia is 67 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Latecia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future Latecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susan has a general store business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Susan has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Cherry

texts.en:
Ma. Cherry is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to resell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Cherry dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 48 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorelie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorelie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Lorelie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lorelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mrs. Than is a hardworking woman, 32 years old. She lives with her husband and three children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. She is a tailor and with support from her husband  she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en: Vith’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vith makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en: Keo’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Keo makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Grupo Patzaj 2 Group

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia generoso, amable y con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad del caserío Patzaj.
Miguel es representante del grupo Patzaj 2 gracias al liderazgo que posee, él para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la producción de café, con esta actividad tiene 10 años de realizarlo. Miguel está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para obtener al final del año una buena cosecha de café. Con el crédito el lograra brindarle a tiempo el mantenimiento a su cultivo por lo que el espera mejorar los ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a loving and generous father who has great ambitions for his life. He is 32 years old, and he lives with his wife in a neighborhood of the small village of Patzaj.

Being a natural leader, Miguel guides the Patzaj 2 Group. To earn a living and provide for his family, he has been engaging in growing coffee for the past 10 years. Miguel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for laborers in order to harvest good coffee at the end of the year. Thanks to the loan he will succeed in timely giving maintenance to his crop, and through this action he hopes to increase his earning.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en: Besnik previously got a loan to pay for his son's eye surgery and now he wants your help again:  this time to buy a dairy cow. "I haven't had a dairy cow or any other animals for very long time now. I couldn't afford to buy any animals. Once a week I would buy little raw milk for the children only and they've grown to lack dairy nutrients," said Besnik to the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 44-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a simple house. Salameh works as an employee in a local company, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Salameh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Salameh will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Salameh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna successfully completed her first Kiva loan and she hopes to have one more profitable deal with lenders. She lives with her husband in Kapan city of Syunik region. Their sons are married and they live with their families.

Susanna has vocational accountant education and for many years she worked as an accountant at different organizations. At this time, she is unemployed but fully engaged in agricultural works. She has very nice vegetable and fruits garden and from here she harvests apples, plums, strawberries, persimmon, and currants. She also raises potatoes, beans, tomatoes and cucumbers. All these she sells from her house to her number of regular customers. Susanna takes care of her garden very properly so it is one of the nicest in the district.

With her second partnership Susanna asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams for repairing the watering system of her garden and also to buy vegetable seedlings.

loans.use: to repair the watering system of her garden and also to buy vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
La señora  Deisy  de 27 años de edad,  no tiene   hijos,  vive  en  San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 06 años  al negocio de venta de tortillas,  su venta la realiza con los amigos y personas que transitan a diario por su casa es una persona con ganas de trabajar y lucha día con día para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

La señora está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materia prima, como ser: maíz, leña y cal, para elaborar las tortillas, está muy contenta de  poder trabajar con Prisma.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y tener una mejor vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- de Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Ms. Deisy is 27 years old, does not have children, and lives in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has earned a living in the tortilla selling business for 6 years. She carries out her sales with friends and people who travel by her house every day. She is a person who is happy to work and fights day by day in order to be able to have a better quality of life.

This woman is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials, such as: corn, firewood, and lime to produce the tortillas. She is very happy to be able to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to improve her business and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as: corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola es una joven microempresaria que reside en la capital del país y sus sueños están direccionados a tener una mejor calidad de vida, por eso para ella lo más importante es terminar sus estudios profesionales y estabilizarse en su negocio.  Ella aprovechó la oportunidad de comprar el restaurante donde laboró por seis meses y como el antiguo propietario decidió venderlo para irse a otro municipio, ella les planteó esta situación a sus padres quienes le ayudaron a adquirirlo. Fabiola cuenta con dos años de funcionamiento y con muy buenos resultados, puesto que es muy comprometida y dedicada, diariamente apertura su negocio a las 7 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 3 p.m. y ofrece desayunos y almuerzos, sin embargo la especialidad de la carta son los tamales tolimenses.  La capacidad de su negocio ya no es suficiente para la cantidad de clientes que está captando,  es por ello que aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adquirir mesa y sillas, así como víveres para la preparación de sus tamales.  Esta inversión es muy propicia y será de éxito.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a young small businesswoman who lives in the capital of the country. Her dreams are headed towards having a better quality of life. Therefore, the most important thing to her is finishing her professional education and establishing her business.

She took advantage of the opportunity to buy a restaurant where she worked for six months. The old owner decided to sell it in order to go to another municipality. She presented this situation to her parents, and they helped her to get it. Fabioloa has been running the business for two years with very good results. This is because she is very committed and dedicated. She opens her business at 7:00 a.m., and her work day continues until 3:00 p.m. She sells breakfast and lunch. However, the 'tamales tolimenses' [a tamal made with a yellow corn-based dough, chunks of carrots, corn, English peas, chicken, egg, and pork] are the house specialty.

There is not enough capacity at her business for the amount of customers that she is getting. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy a table and chairs and supplies to make her tamales. This investment is very opportune and will be a success.

loans.use: to get a table and chairs and supplies to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 23 years old, and married with one child. She lives in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe, where she has sold groceries from her home since 2010.

Getrude has established customer relationships, and often provides door to door delivery services. She used her first Kiva loan to increase stock. Getrude supports her family on the profits of her business.

With a second Kiva loan, Getrude intends to increase her sales during Christmas time, and to build her own shop.

Getrude volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local high school, facilitating life skills sessions, and will continue to repay the interest on her “social-interest” loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to increase her sales and build her own grocery store.

loans.name: Saroub's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Sangke district, Saroub is a 35-year-old mother of two children, one son and one daughter. One child is in school while the other one is too young for school.

She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. Having been in the business for 12 years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 43,000 KHR and is able to save about 17,000 KHR per day after expenses for the future needs.

This is the fourth loan for Saroub with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has used her past three loans to better support her family’s living conditions. Now she is forming a new group loan. As the leader, Saroub will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to expand her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 53-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a simple house. Sami works as an employee in a local company, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 41-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and 3 kids in a simple house. Ashraf works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Ashraf took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family home. By taking this loan, Ashraf will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.

Ashraf appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home.

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and deals in cocoa growing and selling to raise income to support his family. His clients are mainly cocoa companies. He gets additional income from his maize and banana plantations, but his main challenge is limited capital to maintain all his businesses.

He hopes to improve his cocoa business in the future, build a permanent house and also educate his six children. He has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children in primary and secondary levels.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has one child who is currently attending school. Fatuma lives in her own house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for domestic use.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the 10,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is a 25-year-old tailor, and lives in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe with her husband and child. Tendai sews uniforms and sells them to the local school.

She used her first Kiva loan to start a poultry business in addition to her tailoring. With the profits from her poultry business, Tendai repaired her sewing machine. Tendai supports her family with the success of her businesses and provides stationery for local students who do not have books.

Building on her success, Tendai seeks a second Kiva loan to expand her business and purchase more sewing materials.

Tendai hosts awareness campaigns in her community and volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local high school. She will continue to repay the interest on her “social-interest” loans through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to expand her sewing business by purchasing more sewing material.

loans.name: Yoti

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Yoti, who is a 50-year-old married woman with one daughter and two sons. Yoti is an employee is an employee whose trade is cooked dishes and her husband is an employee for five years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Yoti will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a housewife and looks after her family. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services at her own house for the people.

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the business, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and effectively. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mo'men

texts.en:
Mo'men is a 30-year-old single young man from Gaza city. His father works but he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Mo'men is a student in the local university where he studies press and media and he is an Intelligent student. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family. He dreams of becoming a famous journalist.

Mo'men took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the last semester. By taking this loan, Mo'men will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Mo'men appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the last  semester.

loans.name: Edith Yolanda

texts.es: Edith de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de productos de uso personal su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos como shampoo, acondicionadores, lociones, cremas, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her family.

For the past four years she has been selling personal products out of her house, and the money she earns allows her to cover some of her household expenses. She is applying for a loan so she can buy more products such as shampoo, conditioners, lotions, creams, etc. to continue with her sales and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products such as shampoo, conditioners, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is 21-year-old single man from Jabalia City.

Kamal was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war in Gaza his house was completely destroyed. Then he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Kamal took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Kamal to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

Kamal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: Dolice

texts.en:
Dolice is a 60-year-old married woman with seven children. She is living in Bundibugyo-Uganda.

She operates a retail shop that sells general merchandise. She started the business 8 years ago to get income to sustain her family and pay her children's school fees. Her business dream remains to expand her business though she is affected by inadequate capital, competition and the various taxes by local authorities.

She used the previous loan to buy general merchandise like cooking oil and rice to sell. She is requesting another loan to buy plastic cups, flasks, containers and plastic basins to sell.

loans.use: To buy  general merchandise  to sell.

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
Hadiya is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Nyaradzo

texts.en: Nyaradzo is a 31-year-old mother of four living in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She runs her own business selling grocery items, soap, stationery, and candles. Nyaradzo has expanded her business to become the major supplier of groceries in her community. She used her first Kiva loan to increase stock, and she reinvested her profits to further expand her business. She has also improved the quality of life for her family. Nyaradzo seeks a second Kiva loan to purchase more groceries and increase sales. Nyaradzo volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills at the local high school. She will continue to repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteering work.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and increase her sales.

loans.name: Baha'

texts.en:
Baha' is a 21-year-old single young man from Ramallah city. His mother works but she gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Baha' is a student in the local university and he is an Intelligent student. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the last semester. By taking this loan, he will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Baha' appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the last  semester.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Forty-nine-year old Beatrice lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of five children and two dependents as family members. Her business is cocoa farming and trading and selling food stuffs in markets to supplement her income. She got involved in business five years ago to raise income to support her family. She has a family dream of expanding her cocoa business despite the challenge of unpredictable weather, which affects her profits. She has requested a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old man from Jabalia City. He is married and the father of one small son.

Ahmad was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war in Gaza, his house was completely destroyed. Then he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently, Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Ahmad to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She has been successfully operating a poultry business for over two years and is proud of the growth she has achieved thus far.

Faith keeps broiler chickens, and breeds a batch every two weeks. She used her first Kiva loan to launch her poultry business. Faith is the main provider for her family. Faith seeks a second Kiva loan to make necessary improvements to her chicken coop for greater safety, as well as to purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines.

Faith intends to build a house for her family with the success of her business. Along with other Cama members, Faith donates stationery to disadvantaged school children. The interest on Faith’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students at the nearby high school.

loans.use: to improve her chicken coop for greater safety.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi sells fish to earn her living. She has operated her business for over two years, selling from her home to restaurant owners and other members of her community. She cites transportation as a major challenge to her business.

She and her husband have been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

With her Kshs 30,000 loan funds, Mwanaidi will purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale. She dreams of expanding her business, and plans to establish another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 21-year-old, single, young man from Jabalia City. Hassan is an intelligent student at the local university. He wants to get a BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family. His father works, but he gets a low and unstable income, which barely covers all the family's needs.  Hassan works in a salon in order to pay for his school fees. Hassan took a loan from FATEN to help pay the university fees for the last semester. By taking this loan, Hassan will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Hassan appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay his university fees for the last semester

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married father of three. He is a hard working Palestinian refugee, who seven years ago, opened his current car maintenance workshop.

Working as a mechanic since quitting school, at an early age during his intermediate school classes, has provided him with a wide experience in his domain. That is why he is recommended by most of his customers and neighbors.

Currently Ali is well known in his neighborhood and he is seeking wider development. His business income is good enough to cover his family's living needs, but any further development can't be established through his acquired income. That is why Ali decided to contact Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, who has decided to support him through his business development plans. Ali's dream of buying newly released updated mechanical tools, needed to further his business development, will now come true.

Al Majmoua's loan will help Ali buy his requested items and will contribute in making his dream of buying his own working place come true.

loans.use: to buy newly released updated mechanical tools to further his business development.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 33-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married father of two, who has been working in the house-painting business for eleven years to support his family and improve their living.

An ambitious, hard-working man, he plans to expand his working sector and dreams of a brighter future for his beloved family, who currently live in a Palestinian refugees camp which lacks most of the minimum required standards of living.

Mohamad's work is barely enough to cover his family's daily living needs. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which he will use to pay for his son's necessary surgery expenses.

Mohamad is seeking a better income for his family, to improve and develop both their social and financial situations.

loans.use: to pay for his son's necessary surgery expenses.

loans.name: Eva Yolanda

texts.es: Eva de 61 años, inició su negocio al pasar por una situación de desempleo que la obligó a emprender nuevos horizontes y alternativas que le generarían los recursos pertinentes para su sustento al estar separada y no contar con el apoyo de un cónyuge.  Ella  adecuó unos utensilios en la terraza de su vivienda en los que prepara y comercializa bebidas aromáticas, tinto, jugos, avenas, chocolate, pastelitos, sándwich y cigarrillos, aprovechando que se encuentra en una vía vehicular y sus principales clientes son taxistas y habitantes del sector. Esta valerosa mujer a pesar de su avanzada edad, cuenta con un dinamismo que le permite diariamente estar con una sonrisa en su rostro y dispuesta a atender a sus clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para consolidar unos pasivos y comprar materias primas para la preparación de sus comidas; café, hierbas aromáticas, azúcar, chocolate en barras, panes, carnes frías y leche.  Con esta inversión mejorará su flujo de efectivo y estará aprovisionada para la temporada de ventas más alta del año.
texts.en:
Eva, 61, started her business when she was unemployed and separated from her husband.  She wanted a steady income that would allow her to support herself without help from her former husband or anyone else.  She set up a stand on the front porch of her house where she sells drinks, snacks, cigarettes and other small items.  The stand is on a busy street and she draws her customers from cabbies and other passers-by.  Despite her years, Eva gets up every day, full of energy, and sets off for work with a smile on her face.  

Eva is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan, her first, that she will use to consolidate her debts and buy the supplies that she needs to carry on her business.  Specifically, she will buy coffee, spices, sugar, chocolate, bread and other basic ingredients for making the drinks and snacks she sells.  The investment will improve her cash flow and help her plan for the extra sales she expects during the coming holidays.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Grupo Quetzal Group

texts.es:
Regina es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de 2 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 4 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Xetulul.
Regina (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella lleva 1 año de realizarlo, gracias  a la  amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes a logrado obtener mucha clientela. Regina está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita invertir un poco más en su negocio ella comprara fajas, cortes y güipiles esto para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.  Sus aspiraciones en la vida son: fortalecer su negocio, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Regina is 25 years old, single, and has a beautiful family of two children who are between the ages of 1 and 4 years old. This humble family lives in a community in the hamlet of Xetulul.

In order to have some income and to raise her family, Regina (first on the left in the photo) buys and sells traditional clothing. She has been doing this for one year, and thanks to the friendliness with which she treats her customers, she has a loyal following.

Regina is applying for a loan because she needs to invest a little more in her business, and she will use the money to buy woven and embroidered sashes, skirts and tops so she can better meet the needs of her customers.

Her life goals are to strengthen her business, improve her family's quality of life, and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing such as woven and embroidered sashes, skirts and blouses/tunics.

loans.name: Gaminia

texts.en:
Gaminia owns a cosmetics and hair salon. She earned her hair styling certification and ‎has been managing her growing business. Gaminia is a quiet, determined professional. ‎She is dedicated to reaching her goals and making sure each step that she takes in her ‎business strengthens the business and her family. After doing an exhaustive survey of ‎costs and benefits, Gaminia has decided to invest in an important cosmetics machine.‎

Gaminia needed this loan to purchase the new cosmetics equipment. She is ‎investing her own funds and utilizing the loan for the balance. Gaminia decided to ‎acquire this piece of equipment specifically for its potential to increase profits, meet the needs of her customers, ‎and its potential to strengthen her salon.‎

In the future, Gaminia wants to develop her business into a bridal salon which also sells ‎accessories. For now, she is strengthening her business and providing excellent service ‎to her customers, taking each step on her path to reach her next goal.‎

loans.use: to purchase new cosmetics equipment.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee un chalet donde vende pupusas y platos de comida, esta ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz, pollos, carnes, verduras, quesillo, chicharron, entre otras cosas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 37 years old and is a single mom who lives in her own house with her three children. She sells pupusas (thick corn tortillas stuffed with meat, chicken, cheese, beans, or pork rind) and meals from a stand which is located not far from her house in an area with a lot of traffic. With what she earns from her sales she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is applying for a loan so she can buy corn, chicken, meat, vegetables, cheese, and pork rinds, among other things, which will help increase her income.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, meat, vegetables, cheese, pork rind, etc.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 35-year-old, married woman with three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

Oliver is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. With the proceeds, she has been able to expand her cocoa plantation and pay the school fees for her children. The seasonal nature of the business affects her income flows while her desire is to venture into the retail shop business.

Being the good mother that she is, she desires to see all her children attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Oliver used her previous loan to pay for her children's school fees.

Oliver is now requesting another loan to pay for labour to harvest cocoa from her garden.

loans.use: to pay for labour in her cocoa garden.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Xetulul Group

texts.es:
Regina es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de 2 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 4 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Xetulul.
Regina (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella lleva 1 año de realizarlo, gracias  a la  amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes a logrado obtener mucha clientela. Regina está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita invertir un poco más en su negocio ella comprara fajas, cortes y güipiles esto para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.  Sus aspiraciones en la vida son: fortalecer su negocio, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Regina, 25, is single and has two lovely children, 1- and 4-year(s) old, respectively.  (Regina is pictured on the left in the photo.)  She and her little family live in the small rural town of Xetulul.  She started a business buying and selling traditional clothing a year ago because she needed a means to support herself and her children.  She is a friendly woman who knows how to please her customers and the business has been a success.  

Regina wants to invest in her business and is applying for a loan that she will use to buy clothing that she will resell.  The investment will allow her to better meet demand from her customers.  We asked her what she aspires to and she told us that she wants to strengthen her business, improve her family's quality of life, and pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: María Modesta

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy amable, generosa y con grandes aspiraciones de superación, ella tiene 60 años de edad, es madre de 9 hijos de las edades entre 24 y 43 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Toquin.
Maria todos los días se esmera para generar sus ingresos  y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, ella trabaja vendiendo comida desde hace  8 años, afortunadamente cuenta con mucha clientela. 
Maria se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales tales como: cemento, block, arena y piedrín esto con el fin de remodelar su cocina y así poder contar con una cocina más digna.  Sus aspiraciones en la vida es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a very pleasant and generous woman with a strong desire for self improvement. She is 60 years old and the mother of nine children between the ages of 24 and 43. They live in a community in the village of Toquin.

Every day Maria works hard to generate income to meet her family's needs and has been selling meals for 8 years. Fortunately, she has many customers.

Maria sees the need to ask for a loan so she can buy materials such as cement, blocks, sand, and gravel to remodel her kitchen so it will be more suitable.

Her life goals are to continue to strengthen her business and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, sand, and gravel to remodel her house.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edd vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 25 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, y es gracias a su trabajo como puede salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and lives in a house she owns with her family group. For 25 years she has worked making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has many customers. Thanks to her work she is able to move forward with her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy corn in quintales [approximately 100 pounds] and lime, in order to be able to continue making tortillas. In this way she will be able to have greater income, to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in quintales [approximately 100 pounds] and lime.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.ru:
Фазлиддин 30 летный молодой активный парень. Он дехканин города Курган-Тюбе. Фазлиддин единственный сын в семье. Он раньше занимался мастером по ремонту домов. У него есть талант. Фазлиддин женат и отец двоих маленьких детишек. Он проживает вместе с отцом, матерью, женой и детьми. Старший сын ходит на первой классе. 
Фазлиддин занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Он выращивает растение. У него во дворе имеется большой земельный участок. В осеню, начинается сезон парника. В парнике выращивают зелень, огурцы и помидоры. Фазлиддин готовиться к посеву новый урожай. Ему нужно купить уголь для печки парника и минеральные удобрения для обработки землю. Фазлиддин нуждается помощи. Поддержите его  достичь своих целей и собрать богатый урожай.
texts.en:
Fazliddin is a 30-year-old active young man. He is a farmer from the city of Qurgan-Tube. Fazliddin is the only son in his family. He previously worked renovating houses. He is talented. Fazliddin is married and the father of two little children. He lives with his father, mother, wife and children. His eldest son is in first grade.

Fazliddin engages in agriculture. He grows crops. He has a large plot of land. In fall the greenhouse season begins. Greens, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown in greenhouses. Fazliddin is preparing to sew a new crop. He needs to buy coal for the greenhouse stove and mineral fertilizer to treat the soil. Fazliddin needs help. Please support him in achieving his goals and gathering a rich harvest.

loans.use: to buy coal and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente con 38 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Vicente se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 15 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y el pago de mano de obra en su cultivo de café. De esta manera obtendrá una mejor utilidad en su cosecha.

Vicente es socio reactivado en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Vicente, 38, and his partner have four children.  They live in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.  Farming and small commercial businesses are common sources of income for local people.

Vicente has a farm where he grows coffee.  He has operated the business for 15 years and is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for the labor and supplies he needs to carry on his business.  The investment will improve his chances of a good harvest.  

Vicente is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa and has a good record of repaying past loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hard-working farmer in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She endures the scourging heat of the sun in order to provide for the needs of her family, especially the education of her children.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to purchase bags of fertilizer and insecticides.

She is looking forward to a good harvest this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah sells grocery items to earn her living. She offers vegetables for sale from her stall at the market to town dwellers and members of her community. Her primary business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

She and her husband have three children, two of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rodah decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her Kshs 10,000 loan funds, she will purchase green vegetables, onions, and two crates of tomatoes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions, and two crates of tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Soloharisoa Zolihasina

texts.fr:
Soloharisoa a 21 ans. Elle est mariée,le mari a 22 ans. Le couple exerce ensemble l'activité génératrice de revenu objet de la demande de prêt. Il s'agit de la gestion d'un petit point d'appels téléphoniques appelé dans le pays "taxi-phone" et des livraisons des recharges chez des autres taxi-phones et d'autres  différents revendeurs. C'est une activité déjà pratiquée par sa mère et  c'est elle qui lui a appris le fonctionnement et le démarche à suivre. Elle a commencé l'activité, il y a maintenant deux ans.
Elle est mère d'un petit enfant de un an et demi. La famille habite dans une maison louée et le projet est de construire sa propre maison. L'objectif est d'être indépendante et autonome, avoir une vie meilleure et confortable.
texts.en:
Soloharisoa is 21 years old, and her husband is 22. The couple run a small "taxi-phone" together as their income-generating activity and the object of this loan; it's a booth where people come to make phone calls. The couple also supply recharge cards to other taxi-phones and other providers. Soloharisoa started this activity 2 years ago. She learned from her mother who does the same thing and taught her daughter how this business works.

Soloharisoa has an 18 month old child. The family lives in a rented house but they plan to build their own home at some point. They want to become independent and self-sufficient, and to have a better, more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Vilma Haidee

texts.es: Vilma de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 11 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijoles, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, Vilma está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar su terreno para poder continuar con sus siembras y asi tener mejores ganancias con sus ventas
texts.en:
Vilma is 32 years old has been working in agriculture for 11 years.  She plants corn and beans.  When her crops are ready she sells them at different markets that are close to her home.

She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her three children.

Vilma is again requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controllers, etc. and improve her land to continue with her crops and so to have better earnings from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controller, etc. and improve her land

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Prisca est une femme âgée de 22 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Prisca est une revendeuse des pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour ce fait, Prisca sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagne en vue de bien revendre et de gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à sa famille et pouvoir prendre en charges ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Single and without children, Prisca is a 22-year-old woman who lives in Adidogomé. Prisca is a retailer who buys "pagnes" [traditional West African fabrics] twice a month from a market and resells them in the surrounding neighborhoods. She is therefore requesting a loan so that she can order pieces of pagne, successfully resell them, and make a profit that will be used to help her family and pay for her everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of "pagne".

loans.name: Martha Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  el Grupo de Crédito Los Ángeles.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y una de 10 años de edad la cual estudia en una escuela de la localidad y es la única que aun vive con ella.
Doña Martha es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos para que no le falte lo necesario a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio vende ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes entre otra variedad de productos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale en sus ratos desocupados aunque más le gusta salir en las mañanas ya que es cuando su hija está en clases, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días,  lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida para ella y su hija.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos,  perfumes, carteras y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva dos años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the town of El Florin, in the city of Portoviejo, in the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the true tamarinds, the borrowing group Los Angeles gets together every 15 days. Martha lives here. She is 53 years old, and is a single mother of 5 children. Four of them are older, and one is 10 years old and goes to school in the area. She is the only one who lives with Martha.

Martha is a woman who has always liked to work, in order to have her own resources so that her children lack nothing. She works selling clothes, shoes, purses, and perfumes, among other products. Her mode of selling is door to door. She goes out in her free time, although she prefers to go out in the mornings when her daughter is in classes. She sells on credit, and collects payments every 8 days. She has more than 10 years at this job, with which she makes a living for her and her daughter. This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, purses, and everything else she sells. She has two years with the borrowing group, and she likes it for the support the loans offer. Her dream is to provide the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, purses, etc.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Nelly tiene 57 años de edad es conviviente con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace varios años. Ella expende sus menús en mayor cantidad  en las fiestas costumbristas de su localidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la renovación de sus utensilios de su negocio ollas vajillas y cubiertos. Para brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. El grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nelly es la cuenta persona parada del lado derecho viste chompa azulino a rayas.
texts.en:
Nelly is 57 years old, is married and has independent children. 

She has been selling food for several years. She sells her foods in greater amounts during traditional celebrations of the town. 

She will invest her loan on the renewal of her equipment for her business, like pans, tableware and cutlery, to provide better service to her customers. 

The "Santa Rosa de Lima" KIVA Group thanks lenders for the loan provided. 

Nelly is the account person standing on the right, she wears a side striped, blue sweater .

loans.use: to purchase new utensils.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, age 39, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. In her store, she sells grocery items like canned goods, cooking oil, cereals, and juice, as well as personal use goods like detergent soap and shampoo.

She and her husband have eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery and personal use items to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery and personal use items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano con 38 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos,en el distrito de Querecotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. Luciano cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Luciano se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el negocio desde hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y en la compra de abonos. De esta manera le ayudará a obtener mejores rendimientos en su cosecha, mayor ingreso económico, y así mejorara su chacra y su calidad de vida.

Luciano es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luciano, 38, and his partner have three children.  They live in Cajamarca, a rural "departamento" of Peru.  Farming and small commercial businesses are common sources of income for local people.

Luciano has operated a coffee-growing business for 10 years.  He has good references from his neighbors, both personal and work-related.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for the labor and supplies he needs to carry on his business.  The investment will help him to improve his yields and, in turn, his earnings.  

Luciano is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
La  joven Edis de  24 años de edad, es madre soltera  tiene un   hijo que depende de ella, vive en  San Lorenzo, al  sur de Honduras  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de comida ropa, zapatos, perfumes, sus clientes son los amigos y pobladores de la zona que llegan a comprar a su casa, es una persona muy trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
 La joven está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa para damas y caballeros  porque desea aprovechar esta época de navidad  para aumentar sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos, está muy contenta del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar.
Su sueño es poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.
San Lorenzo, honduras- de Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Edis, 24, is a young single mother.  She and her son live in San Lorenzo, a town in southern Honduras.  She has operated a retail business for several years, buying and selling groceries, clothing, footwear, toiletries, etc.  Her customers are friends and neighbors.  Edis works hard because she wants to get ahead in the world and she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with clothing for both men and women.  She wants to make the most of the extra sales she expects during the coming holiday season to increase her income.  She is grateful, she says, for the support that she has received from Prisma and hopes her business will allow her to provide her son with a good education.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Ernea

texts.en:
Ernea works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Ernea requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients, like margarine, sugar, yeast, and flour.

Ernea has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like margarine, sugar, yeast, and flour.

loans.name: Bagyiri Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA  est mariée et  mère de  05 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 16 ans  et  le moins  âgé a 03 ans.  04  enfants  vont   à l’école et  elle a 06 personnes en charges.
Mme pratique le maraîchage depuis 20 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  04 sacs d’engrais et 03 boîtes d’herbicides.
Elle veut  utiliser les bénéfices du prêt  pour soutenir sa famille en améliorant leur condition de vie. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité en produisant beaucoup plus et améliorer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is married and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. 4 of her children attend school and 6 people depend on her. 
Mrs. Aminata has been growing produce for the past 20 years. She buys the supplies she needs from the local markets. 
She plans to use the loan to purchase 4 bags of fertilizer and 3 boxes of herbicide. 
She wants to use the earnings to support her family and improve their quality of life. Her aim is to produce much more and grow her business, and to better her family's life.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of fertilizer and 3 boxes of herbicide.

loans.name: Benka Group

texts.fr:
SADIO   est  celui qui tient  la corde  du  bœuf  à côte  dans le groupes . C’est un éleveur  de bovin de nationalité Malienne âgée de 56 ans sise à Diallassagou. Il est  marié et père  de 6 enfants  qui fréquentent  l’école du village.
SADIO  est non scolarisé.  Il exerce cette activité plus de 10ans,  et fait ses  achats au marché local  pour élever l'animal pendant quelques mois  ; puis revend avec intérêt  au même marché .
Le prêt lui permettra d'agrandir son activité  en espérant  avoir des intérêts  pour assurer les besoins de sa la famille: les frais scolaire ,habillement de ses enfants et autres
texts.en:
Sadio is standing holding the rope of the steer next to the group. He is from Diallassagou, Mali, is 56 years old, and raises cattle. He is the married father of six children who go to the village school.

Sadio has no formal education. He has been raising cattle for over 10 years and makes his purchases at the local market to raise each animal for several months and then resell them, with interest, at the same market.

This loan will allow him to grow his business with the hopes of having profits to meet his family's needs: school expenses, his children's clothing, and other needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Pet Mae

texts.en:
Pet Mae is 25 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Pet Mae requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ceila Maldalita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Los Ángeles.
En este lugar vive la señora Ceila, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual ya es mayor  de edad e independiente.
Doña Ceila es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos para salir adelante, para esto ella desde hace mas de 10 años atrás surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa la misma que con el paso de los días pudo ir mejorando gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la institución, actualmente en su tienda vende de todo un poco, allí sus clientes encuentran granos, embutidos, legumbres, cosas de bazar, helados entre otros productos, ella pasa casi todo el día brindando la mejor atención a  sus clientes que a diario compran en su tienda.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar, colas, carnes y otros víveres para abastecer su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por las ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the residential community El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the “Los Angeles” community bank meets every fifteen days. 

In this place lives the lady Ceila, who is 50 years old. She is a single mother of a son who is already mature in age and independent. Mrs. Ceila is a woman who has always liked to work, and thus obtains her own resources to move forward. For this she has supplied a small store of provisions in her house since more than 10 years ago, the same house which with the passing of the days could improve thanks to the loans which she has received from the institution. Currently in her store she sells a little of everything; there her customers find grains, sausages, vegetables, stationery, ice cream amongst other products. She spends almost the entire day giving the best attention to her customers who daily purchase items in her store. 

She will use this credit to further supply her store. She will buy basic provisions, stationery, soft drinks, meat, and other provisions to supply her store. She has been in the “Los Angeles” community bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help she receives with the loans. Her dreams are to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, stationery, soft drinks, meat, and other provisions.

loans.name: María Valeria

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  el Grupo de Crédito Los Ángeles.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen una hija de tres meses de edad. Su esposo es mercaderista.
Doña María con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos para afrontar los gastos del hogar  se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi  todos los días a realizar sus recorridos y no tiene horario fijos para salir, aunque prefiere salir  en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas su mamá le cuida a su bebé, lleva 2 años con este negocio el cual le permite ayudarle a su marido ya que los gastos ahora con su bebé han aumentado. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar camisas, pantalones y  ropa de niños. Lleva  2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un local.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Ángeles meets every two weeks in the El Florón area of the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí. It has been known for many years as the "city of royal tamarinds."

This is where María lives. She is twenty years old, married, and has a three-month-old baby girl from this relationship. Her husband is a sales promoter. In order to make her own income and contribute toward household expenses, María sells clothing by catalog. She makes sales door to door and goes out on her route almost every day. She doesn't have a fixed schedule, but she prefers going out in the mornings because her mother can take care of the baby. She has been in business for two years and this has allowed her to help her husband, since their expenses have increased now that they have a baby.

She will use this loan to buy shirts, pants, and children's clothing. This is her second cycle with her communal bank and she likes it because the loans allow her to stock up on more merchandise. Her dream is to own a shop one day.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila con 49 años de edad,de estado civil viuda,vive en casa propia,junto a su madre en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Zoila cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Zoila se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche. con una experiencia en el rubro desde más de 01 año, en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hará crecer su negocio,obtendrá más ingresos y así mejorará su calidad de vida.

Zoila a tenido 05 préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, el último fué de S/ 1,000.00 a 12 meses el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Zoila is 49 years old and is a widow. She lives in her own house together with her mother in a rural area of the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, Perú, Zoila has good references both personal and for work from the people who live in the area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Zoila work raising cattle and selling milk. She has more than one year experience in this field and she works at her house. She is requesting a loan to buy animals and feed to raise the animals. In this way she will expand her business, obtain more profit and thus improve her quality of living.

Zoila has had 5 loans with Edpyme Alternativa, the last one was for S/ 1,000.00 over 12 months and was paid back punctually.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Dorika

texts.en:
Dorika a hardworking woman who runs a tailoring business. The business is not doing very well at the moment, because she has to wait for people to bring their materials for sewing. Dorika has an idea to buy attractive materials, so that customers can buy the materials from her shop. Then she will sew them as well to increase her income.

The challenge is that the capital on hand is not enough to buy the required materials. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing materials to sew and sell so that she can perform better.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to sew and sell.

loans.name: Cinthia Paola

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  el Grupo de Crédito Los Ángeles.
En este lugar vive la señora Cinthia, tiene 25 años de edad esta casad y de esta  relación tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Cinthia es una mujer muy trabajar para salir adelante, ella es maestra y trabaja en un colegio de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, ella vende  ropa de todo tipo, vende en el colegio que trabaja ya que allí cuenta con muy buena clientela,  deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Parte del crédito es para su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de mariscos, de esta forma ellos colaboran mutuamente para darles un hogar estable a sus hijos. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y mariscos para el marido. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
In the residential community of El Florón, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees", the Los Ángeles credit group meets every two weeks.

Cinthia, 25, lives here. She is married and has two children, 5 and 7, who are in school. Her husband is a businessman.

Cinthia is a very hard-working woman who wants to get ahead. She is a teacher at a local school and she also makes a living selling clothing. She sells at the school where she works as she has good clients there. She leaves items on credit and collects every week.

Part of the loan is for her husband who makes a living selling shellfish. Together, they work to give their children a stable home.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses and shellfish for her husband. They have spent two years in the credit group and they like it because they are getting ahead. They dream of giving the best to their children.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, blouses and shellfish.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is 38 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Leonisa has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell to her customers.

Leonisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa roofing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Grupo Mixto Patzite Group

texts.es: Josué es un joven de 23 años de edad, es casado vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad del caserío Patzite. Josué (es el segundo del lado izquierdo en la fotografía)  para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos de su región, con esta actividad el lleva 4 años de realizarlo. Josué por ser aún muy joven tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida, por esa razón es el líder del grupo Mixto Patzite, él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima y así seguir elaborando cortes típicos él comprara: hilos y tintes de diferentes colores. Con esta inversión Josué espera mejorar su servicio hacia los clientes y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Josue is 23 years old. He married and lives with his wife in a community in the village of Patzite.

In order to earn a living and move forward with his family, Josue (second on the left in the photo) works producing clothing items that are typical in his local region. He has been doing this work for four years.

Although still very young, Josue has great aspirations in life. He is, as a result, the leader of the Mixto Patzite group.

Josue is applying for a loan in order to buy materials and continue producing typical clothing items. He will use this loan to buy threads and dyes of different colours.

Josue hopes that, with this investment, he can improve customer service and continue strengthening her business.

loans.use: to buy threads and dyes of different colours.

loans.name: Ebah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Ebah, who is a 45-year-old married woman with one son. Ebah has a small shop, and her husband has been a driver for three years.

Ebah has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a sanitation system at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Ebah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a sanitation system at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew, who in his late 30s, is married and has one child, who is in school. He has been running two projects, a guest house and a barber shop. He has been in this business for seven years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mathew's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy new beds and start a barber shop and has been able to repay all of his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay his loan, and to take care of his family and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to renovate his guest reception area and to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' needs. He dreams of owning another guest house.

Mathew will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate his guest reception area and to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 66 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad que han sido su fortaleza para seguir adelante.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios recursos gracias a su esfuerzo, ella en las noches vende meriendas en una carreta en las afueras de su casa,  son muchas personas que todas las noches van hasta su local a servirse sus platos los mismos que ella prepara con mucho amor para sus clientes, además de lo delicioso de sus platos ella les brinda la mejor atención lo cual los incentiva a ir a comer siempre a su clientes, una hija le ayuda en su negocio, lleva más de 10 años con su  negocio el cual ha podido sacar adelante gracias a los créditos que recibe de la institución razón por la cual ella agradece a todos los que hacen posible que personas como ella puedan ganarse la vida.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres, colas y aguas que también vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Salud y Progreso" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its population make a living in agriculture and raising livestock as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Rosa lives here. She is 66 years old. Her husband died a number of years ago and she was left a widow. But she has five adult children from this relationship who have been her strength to carry on.

Rosa is a woman who likes to gain her own resources through her own efforts. In the evenings she sells meals from a cart outside her house. Many people come every night to her place to partake of her dishes that she prepares with much love for her clients. A daughter helps her with the business which she has run for more than ten years. Thanks to the loans she gets from the institution she can get ahead. For this reason she is grateful to all the people who make it possible for people like her to make a living.

She will use the loan to buy food, soft drinks and water. She has been in the communal bank for 6 years and she likes it as the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy food, soft drinks and water.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 4 hijos,  tres mayores de edad y la menor de 16 años la cual estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse la vida y para  darle lo necesario a su hija,  ella en sociedad con un amigo tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ellos venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también  legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, cosas de bazar y papelería, ellos cada vez van mejorando su tienda y esto mucho mas desde que recibe los créditos que le brinda la institución razón por lo cual ella agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de sacar adelante su negocio y lo más importante a su hija la cual es su adoración.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, legumbres, carnes y otros víveres para abastecer su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por las ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the "Salud y Progreso" loan group meets every fortnight. Tosagua is known for its dynamism; here the majority of locals work in farming and raising animals. The area has a lot vegetation.

And it is here that 55-year-old Maria lives. Her husband died a few years ago. She became a widow but has four children; three are now adults while the youngest is 16 years old and attends school. This youngest daughter still lives at home.

Maria likes to work to earn a living and to provide her daughter with everything that she needs. In partnership with a friend, Maria has a grocery shop in her house. There, the friends sell all sorts of staple goods, such as vegetables, legumes, fruits, meat, miscellany and stationery. The friends are always improving their shop, particularly since they started to receive loans.
