They are therefore grateful for the opportunity to move forward with their business, and to help Maria's daughter - whom Maria loves - move forward.

Maria will use this loan to stock up her shop. She will buy staple goods, such as vegetables, meats and other supplies. Maria has been with the loan group since its inception and likes it because of the help she receives through loans.

Maria's dreams are to give her daughter the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy staple goods, such as vegetables, meats and other supplies.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling Personal Collection products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Cindy requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

Cindy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with five children. She has nipa roof-making business in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her business.

Anabelle industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, such as fish vending.

Anabelle dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roof-making business.

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Marvelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marvelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Marvelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 47 years old and has two children. Melba is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Melba is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melba has been farming corn for six years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

Melba would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es una gran mujer de 37 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a su familia en una comunidad denominada  Chujulimul.
Tomasa para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de productos de lencería ella lleva 12 años de realizar esta labor, este negocio se ubica en una aldea lejana de su comunidad.
Tomasa está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más productos de lencería esto con el fin de satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes. Su gran anhelo es contar con un local propio para vender mejor,  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 37 years old and a great woman. She is single and lives next to her family in a community called Chujulimul.

In order to earn an income and support her family, Tomasa makes a living selling lingerie products. It has taken her 12 years to build up her business, which is located in a village far from her community.

Tomasa is asking for a loan to buy more lingerie products so she can better satisfy her customers’ needs. Her great desire is to have her own place so she can improve her sales and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lingerie products.

loans.name: Kubaro

texts.en:
Kubaro was born in 1963. She is divorced, and she has two adult children. Her children are 20 and 27 years old. Kubaro is a highly educated person.

Kubaro is a teacher. She has worked for more than 30 years in a local school. She loves her profession and she does her job with pleasure. Kubaro’s pupils like her lessons.

She has small salary which is not enough to buy medicines that she needs because she is ill. Kubaro is asking for a loan of 3,500 Tajikistan somoni to buy medicines. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Julieta has been in this business for 26 years now.

Julieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer de 33 años de edad, es casada vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de la Aldea Ladrillera.
Paula para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de su familia cuenta con un negocio de ferretería este negocio lo tiene desde hace tres años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la producción de café y banano. Paula con el afán de mejorar su servicio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la inversión en su ferretería pues gracias a su amabilidad cuenta con mucha clientela y su producto ya no se da abasto, ella comprara productos como hierro, cemento, láminas, clavos.
Su anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Paula is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband in a community in Aldea Ladrillera.

In order to meet her family's needs better, Paula runs a hardware store. She has been in business for three years, and in order to make extra income she also works growing coffee and bananas. Paula wants to improve her service, so she has decided to request a loan to invest in her hardware store. She is very helpful, so she has lots of customers and no longer has enough merchandise to meet their demand, so she will buy items like iron, cement, planks, and nails.

Her goal is to continue strengthening her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hardware store items like iron, cement, planks, and nails.

loans.name: Roxy

texts.en: Roxy is a 52-year-old woman who lives with her family in Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has five children; two adult and three-school-aged children. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Roxy is engaged in raising pigs business. Aside from this, she also operates a boarding house (house or rooms for rent).  Thus, she is asking to buy feed for her pigs. Part of this loan amount is to pay laborers to connect water system in their boarding house. In the future, Roxy wants to improve her business for their sustainability.

loans.use: to buy feed; to pay laborers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 25 years old and has two children. She is an ice cream vendor in Kilifi, Kenya, which she has been doing for five years.

Georgina requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase milk, sugar, food color as well as a deep freezer. She will use the anticipated profit to acquire more hand carts for vending ice cream. She hopes to own a big ice cream parlor in the future.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, food color, and a freezer.

loans.name: Atupele Group

texts.en:
Josophina is 26 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a hardware shop. She started the business to be self reliant and to support her husband by paying for household expenses and school fees for the children.

Josophina requested a loan, which she will use to buy more hardware items to stock up her shop. The profits from the business will help her pay for daily household needs like food. She plans to buy a plot of land and build a good house for her family. In the future, she plans to open another hardware shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware items for her store.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder con 36 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Wilder se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales de corral como son ganado caprino y porcino, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales para engorde y su posterior venta. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Wilder es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alterativa.
texts.en:
Wilder is 36 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and his young son in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Perú. He has good references, both personal and for work, from the people in his area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Wilder work raising and selling barnyard animals like goats and pigs. He has more than five years experience in the business. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of animals to fatten ans later sell. In this way he can acquire an acceptable profit to improve his quality of living.

Wilder is a new member of Edpyme Alterativa.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Seim's Group

texts.en: Seim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Sotheary is 20 years old, a single student. She is an office teller in a microfinance institution. She has been an office teller since 2014, earning approximately USD 7.33 each day. She resides in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia.

Due to the lack of financial support, so she would like to request a loan to pay for her fourth year tuition fees. With this loan, she will have enough finances and complete the year successfully. In the future, Sotheary wants to find a better job with a higher salary, so she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay for her fourth year tuition fees

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en: Victorino sells home-cooked dish like sauteed vegetables, noodles, soup, fruits, spices, eggs, firewood and coconut wine. He is asking a loan to buy more stocks of eggs, cooking oil, seasoning, noodles and coconut wine. The profit earned from this business will be spent on the school fees and food for the family and his two children aged twelve and eight.

loans.use: to  buy  eggs, cooking oil, seasoning, noodles and coconut wine

loans.name: Hazim

texts.en:
Hazim is a 29-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Hazim took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Yek's Group

texts.en:
Yek, 40, lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a single woman who has been worked very hard as a rice farmer for 22 years. She grows rice and cassava. She can earn about 40,000KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000KHR each day for the future. Low crop yield resulted from drought has been the main challenge for her business.

This is Yek’s fifth microloan with VisionFund. She has wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve family’s financial burden and afford to buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader, Yek is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania con 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 14 años de edad, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica al comercio,cuenta con una bodega,en su propio domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro de 04 años. Así mismo cuenta con un pequeño bar, ubicado en un costado de su domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de ganado caprino y vacuno. Solicita préstamo para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería para su bodega. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Epifania es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Epifania is 59 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives with her spouse and her 14 year old son in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Perú.

She works in commerce. She has a store at her home and has four years experience in the field. She has has a small bar located to the side of her house. She also works raising goats and cattle.
She is requesting a loan to invest in her business buying merchandise for her store. In this way she can gain an acceptable profit to improve her quality of living.

Epifania is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in her business buying merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dionizi

texts.en:
Dionizi lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 35 and married with four children; all attend school. He deals in produce, mostly buying and selling maize, beans and rice.

He ventured into a lucrative business of motorcycle riding while transporting people in order to supplement his income, as well as farming. He intends to grow and develop his business, as well as pay school fees for his children.

He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a responsible mother of four children and is 32 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family in Rawalpindi,Pakistan. She is well-trained in clothes making. She provides sewing services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult.

So Bushra is requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Bushra is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her clothes making business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a very hard working and dedicated woman,she is married to a mechanic with four children. She is an enterprising and active young woman. Naomi earns her living in working by distributing soaps at the locality of chockor in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She buys and distributes soaps to her customers. This business allows her to generate sufficient income so that she can sustain herself and children.

With the intent of strengthening her business and fulfilling her dream of expansion, Naomi is requesting support with this loan so that she can buy soaps in bulk. As a result, she will be able to offer her customers good service, as well as satisfy their needs and demands. With this loan she will notice an improvement in her income, which would allow her family to enjoy a better quality of life over time.

loans.use: strengthen her soap selling business and fulfill her dream of expansion.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old, single young man from Gaza City. His father works, but he gets a low and unstable income. Thus, the income barely covers all the family's needs.

Mohammad is a student in the local university. He is an intelligent student, but the economic situation is very bad so that he thought to postpone his studies. Mohammad decided to take a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees and also continue his studies for the last semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees and also continue his studies for the last semester.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 20-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Odai took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a resident of Ormoc City in Leyte.  Trinidad, Bohol. He is a father of two children aged 15 and 18. To make a living, he farms vegetable and rented out pool tables for an income. He would like to expand his vegetable farming business and buy fertilizer and seeds from his loan. Antonio dreamed of living an abundant life once his children can make it on their own. Antonio is 48 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 46 years old and married with four children, two of whom in school, Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, rice, soap, etc. to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Ruby would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, rice, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is aged 30 years married with 5 children and a resident of Hoima Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of providing them with all the basic needs and all attend school. He is a very hard working man who sells sugar, salt, cooking oil among other items on a retail basis and works 12 hours a day.

In order to supplement his incomes he practices farming, predominantly growing cassava and beans. He intends to educate his children and develop his business the more. Herbert is requesting a loan facility to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap for sell.

loans.name: Idaya

texts.en:
Idaya is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Idaya has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, Idaya wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret aged 59 years is a married lady of 8 children and only 5 attend school in Hoima Uganda. She operates a retail shop mainly selling of general merchandise, salt, sugar soap among other items. She also carries out farming mostly growing cassava in order to supplement her income.

She expects to grow and fulfill the increasing demands of her customers only to be limited by inadequacy of capital. She will use the loan facility to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a single woman, 20 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Bernadeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like banana, flour, sugar, cooking oil and etc for her food production business.

Bernadeth has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, flour, sugar, cooking oil and etc for her food production business

loans.name: Sahaara

texts.en:
Sahaara and her husband worked together to develop their business. After her husband ‎was disabled, Sahaara was determined they would not have to survive only on meager ‎disability insurance. She was determined to develop an income and ensure a secure ‎future for her family. Sahaara is a trained bookkeeper and understands financial ‎management. She and her husband decided to open a paper products and ‎house-cleaning supply store. In their city, the municipality invested in reinvigorating the ‎souk – open air market – giving incentives for businesses to open there. Sahaara did just ‎that and was able to develop a popular business. At first, she had no competition, but with ‎her success, rival stores also opened in the souk and nearby area. Sahaara knew she ‎needed to strengthen her business and diversify her products. One step she has taken is to ‎improve her stock and create a good niche, in demand with area customers. Sahaara ‎made an agreement with her suppliers in terms of stock: if she purchased in advance ‎with up front payments, she would be afforded a discount, thus increasing her products.‎

Sahaara took this loan for paper products and cleaning supply stocks. The ‎opportunity will increase her business income and afford her product exclusivity in the ‎market.‎

Sahaara wants to continue with her business, ensuring a decent income for her family ‎She and her husband are building a good future for their children and not letting setbacks ‎stall them, but instead taking advantage of opportunities.‎

loans.use: to purchase paper products and cleaning supply stock.

loans.name: Tuweni Group

texts.en:
Esnart is 37 and married. Her husband sells fish for a living. She has four children and four relatives that depend on her.

Esnart sells snacks and beans. She is going to buy more beans to sell using this loan. She has one employee and one family member that helps with the running of the business. She started her business to become self dependent and to support her husband by providing household necessities.

The profits from the business will help her feed her family every day and buy clothing for her children. She hopes to repair her house and replace the grass roofing with an iron sheet roofing. In years to come, she hopes to open a farmer's shop in her village.

loans.use: to buy more beans for her stall

loans.name: Fungai Beauty

texts.en:
Fungai is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She operates a poultry business that she started in 2013.

Fungai used her first loan to expand her business and purchase feed and vaccines in bulk. She also boosted a side business in market gardening. She used the profits from her businesses to pay school fees for her children and to support her family and her parents. She was also able to build a house with the success of her businesses.

Fungai requested her second loan, which she will use to purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines to increase production of her poultry business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines to increase production of her poultry business.

loans.name: Anjam

texts.en:
Anjam is 41 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Anjam has also been doing her business of clothes selling for past three years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Anjam needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

On this financial assistance Anjam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in clothes for selling by herself.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en: Pha’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Pha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Said is a a 30 year old green grocer at Mariakani Kenya. He is a father of two who has been in this business for the last two years doing great.

This is his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business, he will use the loan to  purchase tomatoes, cabbages, green bananas and onions and the anticipated profit to educate his children. He hopes to have a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cabbages, green bananas and onions

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras  (El Carmen) Group

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se reúne cada 15 días el Grupo de Crédito Las Triunfadoras, este grupo está formado por 10 socias que se dedican a diferentes actividades. El cantón posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Isabel,  tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3  hijos de 23, 20 y 15 años, dos son mayores e independientes, el otro estudia en el colegio y los dos menores aun viven con ella.
Doña Isabel es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le gusto trabajar y así con su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una tienda de víveres de en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas,  entre otros víveres de primera necesidad, su hija de 20 años es quien le ayuda cuando ella puede, pero por lo general es doña Isabel la que más pasa en su negocio brindando la mejor atención ya que así es como mas clientela gana. Tiene 18  años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida y la de sus hijos
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, gas  y otros productos de primera necesidad. Es socia fundadora y presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo, le gusta el apoyo a las socias por parte del promotor y de la fundación. Su sueño es comprar una moto para hacer las entregas a domicilio.
texts.en:
In the village of El Carmen meets, every 15 days, the loan Group Las Triunfadoras.  This group consists of 10 members who are engaged in different activities. 

The village has considerable wealth of flora and fauna.  One of the main sources of income is plantain growing of the Barraganete variety.

One member of this group is Isabel, who is 48 years old, single mother of 3 children who are 23, 20 and 15.  Two of them are older and independent,   one studies at school and the two youngest still live with her.

Isabel is a very feisty woman who has always liked to work.  Through her own effort she has managed to raise her children.

She has a grocery store in her home, where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, fruits, among other emergency supplies.  Her 20 year old daughter helps her when she can, but usually it is Isabel who runs her business by providing the best service possible, because that is how she gains more customer. 

She has been working in this activity for 18 years, which helps her make a living and that of their children.

This loan will be used to stock her store.  She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats, gas and other basic needs products. 

She is a founding member and president of the group and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group.  She likes the support for other members through the promoter and the foundation. 

Her dream is to purchase a motorbike to make home deliveries.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats, gas and other basic needs products.

loans.name: Ma. Leobeth

texts.en:
Ma. Leobeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Leobeth is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Leobeth has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Ma. Leobeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Leobeth has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ma. Leobeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri lives in Turen, Malang Regency on Java Island in Indonesia, one of the most populous places in the world.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Sri attended a meeting by Nazava's sales team about alternative houshold water treatment options. There she learnt about Nazava Water Filters. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity

Sri who is also a health worker took the opportunity and became the reseller of Nazava water filters in her community. This is the first time Sri has applied for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.

This loan will allow Sri to buy 10 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 50 people.

loans.use: to purchase 10 water purifiers to sell to her community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is 24 years old and he lives with his parents and sister in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Gegham graduated the Police Academy and since 2012 till today he works as a policeman at the city station. Gegham father is an electrician and his mother is a nurse. Gegham’s sister is also employed and she works as a teacher.

Gegham wants to repair their flat which has not been repaired for many years and with his savings he will not manage to do it. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams will be very helpful for him and with his savings he will finally have enough money to repair his flat.

loans.use: to repair his flat

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomè. Agée de 40 ans, Adjowa vit avec cinq enfants à charge. Adjowa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Adjowa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des petits et moyens sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowa, age 40, is a married woman who lives in Adidogomè with 5 dependent children. She is a charcoal vendor. She stocks up 3 times per month at the market and conducts her sales from her home.

Adjowa is seeking this loan to order small and medium-sized sacks of charcoal to bolster her sales and profits. This will help her to support her husband with household expenses and to provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 2 small and 5 medium-sized sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 46 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. He is married and lives with his wife (she works as a baker at the bread factory) and his son. He also has two daughters who are already married and they live with their families.

Arayik is a farmer and he never did any other work than farming. He has cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep and chickens in his farm and also great assortment of dairy-products for sale. He sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheeses, curd and butter also meat and eggs. Arayik is also good in potato cultivation for which he has his regular customers, re-sellers, who buy this vegetable right from his farm. Arayik already impatient to get ready for winter months by storing a lot of fodder for his cattle and this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 27 years old. She is married and lives in Batumi district with her husband. Laura is unemployed at the moment. She decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2100 USD.

With the received credit she will purchase all necessary tools and equipment for a small canteen and will start making a special meat dish that is very popular among local people. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders. Laura awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a small canteen and start making a special meat dish.

loans.name: Suyantono

texts.en:
Suyantono lives in Sitiarjo, Malang Regency on the Island of Java, the main island of Indonesia.
In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. For that reason, most inhabitants of Indonesia boil the water before they drink it, or, if they have the money, they buy bottled water. Suyantono attended a meeting by Nazava's sales team about alternative houshold water treatment options. There she learnt about Nazava Water Filters. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Suyantono who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the first time Suyantono has applied for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.

This loan will allow Suyantono to buy 40 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 200 people.

loans.use: to obtain 40 water filters to sell to her fellow villagers providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mario Pablo

texts.es: Mario es un hombre de 59 años que vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Pampacolca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en su alimentación, que está constituida sobre todo por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva, Mario además se dedica al cultivo de papa orgánica, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno donde planea cultivar dicha papa orgánica. En el futuro Mario desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mario is a 59 year old man. He lives together with his wife in the rural area of Pampacolca, which is located in Arequipa. He works raising organic cattle, paying much attention to their care and food which consists mainly of organic alfalfa that he grows himself. Mario also grows organic potatoes and he is requesting this micro-loan to be able to buy organic potato seeds and organic manure to prepare the earth where he will grow his organic potatoes. In the future Mario wants to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic potato seeds and manure to grow organic potatoes.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en: Khim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira was born in 1970 year. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a teacher. Nodira has own business and has been busy with animal husbandry more than 10 years. Nodira feeds cows in her house where she has a cowshed and she grows feeds for cattle in her own orchard.

She is asking for loan of 6000 Somoni to pay for the university. Her children are students and she dreams to see them as higher quality specialists. She awaits your help.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition .

loans.name: Excel Millennium School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Arnold. He is the bursar of Excel Millennium High School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kyengera, in Wakiso, with 200 students.

Excel Millennium School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term since the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Excel Millennium School will repay its loan from its school fees, which is collected each term. Ultimately, Arnold hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its students.

loans.name: Marumbu

texts.en: Marumbu is a married man with 4 children who operates a retail shop in Hoima-Uganda. He has a special character of serving others with joy given his receptive nature. For extra income he carries out farming of cassava. On realizing the need for setting up a stable income generating activity, he ventured into business in 2013. His business is exposed to high rental fees, yet he desires to have a well stocked business in town that will satisfy the demands of his customers. Marumbu is requesting for a loan facility to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and salt for sell

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and salt for selling

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has been a fruit vendor for almost ten years. She is making good sales from it so that she was able to build their new house.

Recently, she needed additional capital to buy more stock of fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: El Rinconcito Del Saber  (El Carmen) Group

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, en este lugar se reúnen el Grupo de Crédito El Rinconcito Del Saber, el cual está formado por 9 mujeres y 1 hombre que decidieron unirse y formar este grupo con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Mireya,  ella mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  5  hijos de 20, 16, 15, 13 y 5 años de edad, los 4 menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Mireya es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa ya que hasta allá llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en la compra y venta de ganado que es lo que a él se dedica.  Luchando juntos ellos pueden salir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ganado para que el marido venda. Lleva 4 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho tanto a ella como a sus compañeros del grupo. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen has a considerable wealth of flora and fauna; growing the Barraganete variety of banana is one of the primary sources of income. It is here that the Grupo de Crédito El Rinconcito Del Saber meet. The group comprises 9 women and 1 man who decided to get together and form this group in the hope of improving their business .

One of the members of the group is Mireya, she is in a common law marriage with 5 children aged 20, 16, 15, 13 and 5 , the youngest 4 go to school and college. Her husband is a trader.
Mireya is a housewife and in order to make a living and have an income of her own sells Yanbal and Avon cosmetics (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories ). She sells door to door, and when her customers turn up needing something, from her home. She intends to give part of the loan to her husband to buy and sell livestock, which is what he does to make a living . Working together they can get ahead and do the best for their children .

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and livestock for Mireya's husband to sell. This is her fourth loan cycle in the Grupo De Crédito, they like the group because the loans help her and her colleagues. Her dream is that her children complete their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and livestock.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Catherine is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Catherine has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a single woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 63 years old now.

Lilia has a buy-and-sell coconuts business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Elena is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en: Naboth of age 30 is married with 4 children and all attend school in Hoima Uganda. He deals in produce primarily buying and selling of maize, beans alongside farming of cassava to supplement his incomes. He started his business in order to raise incomes to support his family. He desires to develop and expand his business the more as well as educating his children whoever, in adequate capital and price fluctuation hinder his desires. He is seeking for credit facility to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is the age of 42; she is mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to purchase a new rickshaw it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore,Rukshana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rukhsana is so much thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Grupo Job Noj Group

texts.es: Dominga (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) es una mujer muy generosa y  con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, cuenta que gracias a su crédito pudo comprar más mercadería y a sus clientes pudo satisfacer mejor, afortunadamente esta inversión le dejo una buena ganancia  y las necesidades de su familia pudo cubrir. Dominga está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues la época de fin de año se está acercando y esto es de aprovechar, porque es la época donde la ropa tiende a tener mucha demanda. Ella guarda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito lo más pronto posible para realizar la inversión. Su gran sueño es construir una casa de block para su familia.
texts.en:
Dominga (the first on the left in the photograph) is a very generous woman with great aspirations in life.

Thanks to her previous loan she was able to buy more merchandise and better satisfy her customers. Fortunately, this investment left her with a good profit and she was able to cover her family’s needs.

With the end of the year approaching, Dominga is asking for a new loan. This is an advantageous time of year, because it is the time when clothing tends to be in great demand. She is hoping to have the loan as soon as possible in order to make the investment.

Her greatest dream is to construct a house made of blocks for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Sokern's Group

texts.en: Sokern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Tisabwerere Group

texts.en:
Martha is 18 years old and married. Her husband owns a grocery store. She has one relative that depends on her.

Martha runs a grocery store. She would like a loan to buy more groceries for her store. She started her store to be able to provide household necessities. She has a family member that helps with the daily activities of the business.

The profits from the business will help her build a house for her family. Her plan is to expand her business from a retail to a wholesale shop. She would also like to start selling livestock in years to come, such as cattle and goats.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for the store.

loans.name: St. Paul's Ibanda School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Namukasa. She is an administrator at St. Paul Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Ibanda with 570 students. St. Paul School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Paul School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Namukasa ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam is 33 years old, married and has two children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially for her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from farming and hired labour.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 25-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Bilal took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is young and hardworking man and was born in 1996 year. Jamshed is a student of the second course Pedagogical University of Penjikent. He is a student of the second course. Jamshed tries to study well. He is going to be a good specialist in future. That’s why he works hard.

Jamshed is asking for a loan because his parents have no money to pay for his university tuition. Jamshed awaits your kindness. This loan will help to get higher education to a young man from Tajikistan and realize his dream.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Luminada

texts.en:
Luminada is 38 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a mason and at the same time a welder, but both their income is not enough of their daily needs. Luminada decided to applied a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field to have a good harvest that will generate a better income for her family.

Luminada plans for the future to expand her business to sustain the educational needs of her only child.

loans.use: to purchase for fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 55 years old and widowed with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Edelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Edelina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Edelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Tulibamu Paacwa Group

texts.en:
Mary. operates a retail shop and a salon since the year 2012 as her major source of income. She is 21 years old and has three children two of whom are attending school. Mary. substitutes her income with farming by rearing goats.

Mary is a member of the group where members guarantee one another to access loans. She needs money to buy more cosmetic for her salon business. Her major challenge is the low turn-up of customers since the business is seasonal.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.name: Kinyavu

texts.en:
Kinyavu is a widowed mother of seven children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Abdulazizu

texts.en:
Abdulazizu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulazizu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdulazizu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abdulazizu will store the maize he harvests and delay selling it until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Abdulazizu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira has a women’s and girls’ clothing store and also sells house linens. Her store ‎caters to women in her town and the nearby city. Amira has gained customers due to the ‎styles she sells, her professional eye as well as delivery service she provides for her ‎customers. They appreciate the choices she offers and the convenience of having their ‎purchases delivered.‎

Amira needed this loan for remodeling expenses as well as for stock of linens, women and girls ‎clothing for the winter.‎

Amira is working to make sure her son finishes his education and establishes his own ‎home. By her personal example of drive and determination, her son knows what is ‎needed to succeed.‎

loans.use: for remodeling expenses, as well as for stock of linens, women and girls ‎clothing for the winter.‎.

loans.name: Solomé

texts.fr: Mère de huit enfants, Solomé est une femme mariée âgée de 56 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Solomé est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et du maïs qui travaille énormément pour gagner ses revenus. Solomé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Solomé demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et de maïs; ce qui lui permettra de mieux revendre et d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès le début de cette rentrée.
texts.en:
Solomé, age 56, is the married mother of 8 children and she lives in Adidogomé. She sells charcoal and maize, and she works very hard for her income. She stocks up twice a month at the market and conducts her sales from her home.

Solomé is seeking this loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and maize, which will bolster her sales and her profits. This will allow her to handle household expenses and to help her husband pay for their children's tuition as this is the beginning of the school year.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal and 7 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Zarkhana

texts.en:
Zarkhana is a 44-year-old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Zarkhana has been running her own business making mops for past 25 years. Zarkhana needs to purchase materials and other accessories for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these merchandises. To fulfill this need Zarkhana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will to buy these merchandises for her business purpose. That will be good for her to earn more income and this income will support her to fulfill her family's needs

Zarkhana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her mop business.

loans.name: Anyway P.

texts.en:
Anyway is 22 years old and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a small grocery shop for over two years, selling groceries, toiletries, and cell phone minutes. Anyway used her first Kiva loan to expand her business and now sells clothing as well. She was also able to purchase a refrigerator for her shop for perishable goods. She pays her younger sister’s school fees and contributes to her family’s needs.

Anyway seeks a second Kiva loan to further expand her business and increase her selection of goods. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide. Anyway offers training in life and leadership skills to students in her community.

loans.use: to further expand her business and increase her selection of goods.

loans.name: Tehisuma-Nakpayili Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 28-year-old, married woman living in Nakpayili in the Nanumba district of northern Ghana. She is a young mother of three children. She is the individual pictured squatting with a hand on a basin full of milled rice. Amina has been engaged in processing and selling rice for the past seven years.

Amina is a member of a rice-processing group called ‘Tehisuma – Nakpayili’ (good thoughts). The group had been trained by Grameen Ghana in the production and sale of local rice for the domestic markets. Amina currently has two people (trainees) helping in the processing. She is challenged with capital inadequacy and lack of processing equipment.

Amina and her group have therefore applied for a loan of GHC 4,300. Her share of the loan is GHC 700, which will help her to buy paddy rice from farmers for processing and to sell at the local markets. Amina aspires to have adequate capital, and become well equipped to process larger volumes and eventually become an employer in the industry. She currently wants to earn good income to pay off this loan and support her children in school. Amina is very happy with Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from farmers for processing to sell at the local markets.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married. She has two children. Mariya works in a hospital as a nurse. She is a hardworking and responsible person.

Mariya and her family live in a two-storey house. There was a house fire, and the second floor has been damaged a lot. Mariya and her husband built a new roof using their own savings.

Mariya is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to insulate the new roof. The loan will help Mariya's family to save money during the heating season in winter.

loans.use: to insulate new roof

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is 27 years old, single and he lives at his parents’ house. Juan is a farmer and he also sells flowers. He goes to many fairs to sell the flowers. Juan needs a loan to buy a cow for his farm. He would like to sell more milk the next year. He hopes you can help him because he supports his parents.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: Adriana is single and she lives with her parents. She has no children, but she works hard to support her parents at the family farm and she has learned very well. Adriana needs a loan to buy cattle for the farm. She hopes you can help her because she has good ideas, but she needs money and her parents can’t help her. Adriana is healthy and she works hard.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Shariani

texts.en:
Shariani is a woman in her early 30s. She is married to a loving and supporting husband. They both have 3 daughters, who are 3, 8 and 14 years old. They are all attending school. Moving their children ahead is among Sahriani's (and her husband's) biggest accomplishments.

Shariani loves spending time with her family and claims that her life wouldn't be the same without them. Shariani studied to be a psychologist, and she gives therapy to her patients in her house. She is a hard-working person and works every day of the week.

She has been adapting a room in her house to attend to her patients, but this room is still lacking minor details to be complete. Therefore, Shariani is applying for a Kiva 10,000.00 MXN loan through Kubo (Kiva's filed partner) to buy a new couch and finish the missing details of the room she uses for the therapies.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is a married woman. She has five children, all of whom attend school. Nduku owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nduku has operated a fuel-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.

With the KES 10,000 loan, Nduku wants to purchase fuel to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has been in business for three years. He is originally from Puerto Rico and owns a multi-service agency in Paterson that offers foreclosure prevention, homeowner assistance, Spanish/English document translations, public notary, and income tax preparation. Luis is married, and his wife helps him with bookkeeping for the business.

His agency began during the height of the financial crisis when many people in the community began reaching out to him for help handling foreclosures and filing taxes. Many of his customers were forced out of their homes when foreclosure rates in the Paterson area hit an all-time high. During this difficult financial period, Luis has been a pillar in his community by working hand in hand with those who desperately need his help to keep their homes and make sure they file their taxes correctly.

Demand for his services is very high, and last year he opened a larger office to meet the demand. Now, Luis is looking to expand again. He plans to open an office in Bergen County early next year, and he is applying for a loan to advertise his second location. Luis has found success with direct-mail and newspaper ads to spread the word about his small business services and will use the loan to pay for this type of marketing campaign.

loans.use: to pay for a direct-mail and newspaper marketing campaign.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 30 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, egg, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

Leonisa has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell livestock.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, egg, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro es un hombre de 53 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Pampacolca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; además, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de queso. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera elaborar mejores quesos que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio por ser hechos con leche orgánica. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 53-year-old man who lives with his partner in the rural town of Pampacolca, which is located in Arequipa. He works raising organic cattle, always giving a lot of attention to the care and feeding he gives them. Their feed is made up of organic alfalfa that he grows. He also works making and selling cheese.

He is asking for this micro-loan to be able to buy two organic cows. He hopes to make better cheese that can be sold at a better price because it is made with organic milk.

In the future he hopes to be able to give his family better living conditions. He also hopes to keep having good health, which is why he is betting on organic products.

loans.use: to buy two organic cows in order to use their milk in making better-quality, higher-priced cheese to increase his income.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio is a divorced man.  He is a mason and he lives with his two kids. He needs a loan to buy tools for his mason business.  Julio supports his family alone, because his wife left and he doesn’t know where she is. Julio is an optimistic man, and he hopes you can help him. Julio has no debts, so he is fine and he is healthy.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en: Sebastian works as a tailor and he has his own business. He is still in charge of two kids. Sebastian needs another loan to buy inner lining, lining, boxes of zippers, and boxes of buttons for his sewing business. Sebastian can’t be assisted by his family, because they don’t have the experience to be useful for him. He hopes you can trust him again.

loans.use: to buy inner lining, lining, boxes of zippers, and boxes of buttons for his sewing business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 38 years old. She lives at her own house and is the mother of four kids. She sells underwear, and she visits many fairs to sell her products. Amalia is married; her husband is a mason, but his pay is too low.

Amalia needs a loan to start repairs at her house. She hopes you can help her.

You can see her at her house in the picture. As you can see, the place needs a lot of work.

loans.use: to start repairs at her house.

loans.name: Junalita

texts.en:
Junalita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients, like soap, milk, and noodles.

Junalita has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like soap, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Thuhly Group

texts.en:
Maseeng is a 68-year-old mother of seven children and grandmother of five, aged between 16 and 6 years. She lives with her husband, aged 72, her three youngest children, and two youngest grandchildren. All seven of them live in a single-room traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter.

She and her children work long hours to ensure there is enough food for everyone on a daily basis, and only get help on Saturdays and Sundays in their fields from her grandchildren. She, together with the eldest of her children, wakes up very early, between 4:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m., during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house for everyone, and their day begins.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold, and often Maseeng has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which, when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time, can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and in the worst case, to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Maseeng has been very difficult.

Maseeng has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase a clean cookstove. These provide her, and eight other people from her village who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families and that does not require a lot of fuel, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery, which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones, and a mini LED lamp. This is a life-improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their families, saves energy, eliminates the elements of toxic inhalation and house-burning, and has given them the freedom to have a better-lit home to see better in the evening while cooking, and enables children to do their homework.

For stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com.

loans.use: to pay for the ACE cookstove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru: Вот эту девушку Бог наградил талантом. Ее зовут Ганчина. Ей 20 лет. Она начинающий кондитер. Ганчина дома выпекает вкусные кексы и песочные печения и сдает в магазины. Постепенно поклонники ее вкусностей растет. Она начитает выпекать больше товара. Для выпечки ей потребуется средства, чтобы купить продукты для кексов и печений. Она верит, что благодаря кредиту ее проблема решится и в будущем она станет большим кондитером и мастером своего дела.
texts.en: This young woman is called Ganjina. She is 20 and God gave her a talent. She is beginning her career as a pastry chef. She baked delicious cakes and baked goods from her home and sells them to stores. Gradually, more and more people are becoming fans of her tasty creations, and she is starting to increase the quantity of goods she bakes. She needs resources to do her baking, so she can buy ingredients for cakes and other baked goods. She believes that with the help of a loan, her problem will be solved and in the future she will become a well-known pastry chef and an expert in her trade.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake cakes and other baked goods

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 55 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She is in the agricultural business, raising crops on her farm.

Trinidad requested a loan, which she will use to buy organic fertilizer for the improvement of her banana farm. In the future, she would like to save enough money for the family to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for the improvement of her banana farm.

loans.name: Edguardo Lopes

texts.es: Edguardo es un hombre trabajador de 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en la localidad rural de Cahuana, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero múltiple y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva, Edguardo además se dedica al cultivo de cereales andinos orgánicos, especialmente quinua y kiwicha; así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de quinua y de kiwicha y abonos orgánicos para preparar el terreno donde planea sembrar dichos cultivos. En el futuro Edguardo desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y ofrecerles estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Edguardo is a 47 years old working man, he lives with his wife and their four children in the rural village of Cahuana, located in Arequipa. He makes a living as a labourer for multiple employers, and he also keeps livestock. He devotes a lot of attention in the care and food that he gives them, which is made up by the organic alfalfa he grows.

Moreover, Eduardo grows organic Andean cereals, specially quinoa and amaranth. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to be able to buy organic quinoa and amaranth seeds, and organic fertilisers to prepare the fields where he plans to sow those crops. In the future, Eduardo wishes to improve the life of his family and offer them economic stability.

loans.use: to buy organic quinoa and amaranth seeds and organic fertilisers to sow quinoa and amaranth.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is married and she works hard to support her family.  For the past fifteen years, she has operated a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Maria Fe has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell. In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 35 years, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. Prima has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Chanthou Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is a 38-year-old, widowed grocer with a dependent child in her care. She resides in a village in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Chanthou (pictured first from the right) has been operating her business for over ten years, earning around USD 2 per day. Her only child attends school.

As leader of this four-member group, Chanthou would like to request a loan, and will use her portion to buy groceries to sell and to improve her family’s income. In the future, Chanthou will expand her business, build a new proper house and support her only child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is married with one child; he runs a general store to make a living. He has been doing this business for four years, earning well for his family.

He joined Gata Daku MPC recently and is requesting a new loan to be used for the renovation of his sari-sari store to become more convenient for his costumers.

He plans to expand his business to earn more for a better living for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to renovate his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Quimlie

texts.en:
Quimlie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like buying and selling livestock.

Quimlie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
