Rebecca is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57 years old and she is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Thelma has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Tomotea

texts.en:
Tomotea is 48 years old and has five children. Tomotea is married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Tomotea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, seedlings and other farm supplies.

Tomotea has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard aged 31 is a very hard working married man charged with the task of taking care of 4 children who all attend school in Hoima Uganda. He ventured into produce chiefly buying and selling of maize, beans among other items. This is supplemented by incomes from farming mainly growing cassava and beans. He desires to expand and develop his business however price fluctuation and in adequate capital poses a strong threat to his business. He is seeking for credit to buy more maize and beans for sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Kyamasongi Twemanyiire Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 33 year old married lady with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She has a business of selling second hand shoes for both children, men and women. She has been in this business for two years and was inspired by the desire to be self reliant and the ready market in her village. She is looked at as a responsible business lady in her business, a mother and a wife.

She faces challenges of customers delaying to pay her and high transport costs to the big markets. Besides that, Joyce has a dream of becoming a wholesaler in her business and educating all her children. She has asked for a loan in a group of Kyamasongi Twemanyiire to buy more shoes for sell. The child that appears in the photo is a baby still breast feeding and the mother could not leave him behind at the time of taking the photo.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en: Valentino  is a father of 1 child, aged 24 and lives in Hoima Uganda. He operates a video library whereby he sells films for watching. This is supplemented by farming mostly growing cassava, beans and rice. He hopes to grow and expand his business into a modern cinema hall that shows latest videos only to be limited by insufficient capital to set up such an enterprise. With the determination he has, Valentino sees his business expanding and growing in the nearby future. He intends to use the loan facility to start up a new video library.

loans.use: to start up a new video library.

loans.name: Nakondo

texts.en:
Nakondo is a married mother who has no children. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer from Rumi village. As a Babban Gona member, Gambo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Gambo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Gambo can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gambo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Gambo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is 43 years old, married, and has six children. He is a farmer residing in Battambang province. He makes a living raising rice and cucumbers, playing traditional music at weddings, and raising cows. Through these businesses, he earns about $12 per day and he saves about $2 per day for future needs. Drought and pests are obstacles to his farming business.

Khoeurn used his previous loans wisely and his living conditions have improved. He is requesting another loan from VisionFund, which he will use to use to buy cows to raise. He hopes that he can generate more income to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Tungteeya - Nlala Fong Group

texts.en:
Adishetu is 48, married and has 5 children. She lives in Karaga in the Northern region of Ghana. Adishetu is the woman seated first at the left with the hand raised in salute. Adishetu is a member of a group called ‘Tunteeya - Nlala Fong ’ which means, our net has widened. She is engaged in petty trading of assorted provisions at the local market for 5 years now.

Adishetu dreams to grow her business into a big store to meet the demand of her community. She is working towards achieving this dream through loan request from Grameen Ghana to support her business. Adishetu and her group have therefore asked for a loan of GHC 11,100.00. Her share of the loan is GHC1000.00 which would be used to buy stock of provisions (bread, sugar, tea,soap etc) for resale.
Adishetu wants to get good income from her trade to support her family with the basic needs such as food and clothing. Adishetu knows she is in business because of Grameen Ghana and Kiva partnership, so she thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy stock of provisions bread, sugar, tea,soap etc for resale.

loans.name: Navaen's Group

texts.en: Navaen’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Navaen does work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Avazbek

texts.en:
Avazbek lives with his family in a rural area of Tajikistan, located between the Tajik mountains. He lives with his wife and his 2 children. Avazbek loves his family and tries his best for their well-being.

Two years ago he started his own business deal with a bakery. Avazbek has a workshop which is located in his house. He bakes flatbread and sells to local people. Avazbek’s workind day usually early morning and he works 10-11 hours in a day because he manages the business alone.

Avazbek is going to increase working capital and in this way to bake more flatbread. Avazbek is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to buy flour and coal. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal for increasing working capital at his bakery

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 43-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Imad took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha sincerely thanks for his first Kiva deal and hopes for the second one. With his first Kiva loan he bought nice living-room furniture making it very smart place to have a rest and meet guests. He lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. He has two sons; both of them are married already and the smallest son with his family in his parents’ house.

Seryozha now works at the local electrical networks’ station. He is also farmer and he has some cattle in his farm and a pretty vegetable garden. Seryozha asks one more Kiva loan in an amount of 500.000 Armenian drams. This time to buy bed-room furniture which will include elegant wardrobe, comfortable, big bed and nice commode in it.

loans.use: to buy bed-room furniture which will include elegant wardrobe, comfortable, big bed and nice commode in it

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Emma successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 42 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 66 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 42 a hardworking married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 5 children of ages ranging from 1 to 12 and 3 attend school. Alex is always looking for way to improve his position in society and serve his customers with due diligence given the challenge of competition inadequate capital and weather fluctuation.He deals in produce mainly buying and selling of maize and beans alongside operating a retail shop. He hopes to expand and develop his business into a re-known produce store in his area. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize for sell.

religious.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sell.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 61, is a resident of Kandal province. She is married and has seven children, two of whom rely on her. To make a living, Vorn grows rice and sells some snacks in her community. She has operated her farming business for 41 years already. Vorn's main challenge in rice farming is lack of water to supply the rice field.

This is Vorn's first loan cycle with VisionFund. She leads a group of two members to apply for a loan to save her rice farming business. Vorn will use her portion of the loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes that she will get more yields than before so that she can improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Sanjeeda

texts.en: Sanjeeda is 53 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of nine. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home.Her son provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard her son needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron's accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income for financial support of his family. Sanjeeda is applying for a loan from the Kiva field partner for her son's work.

loans.use: to invest it in her son's shuttering business.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 42-year-old married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married with four children and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She operates a store in their community to earn a living. She has been in her business for many years and earns well for the family.

She joined GDMPC in 2012, and successfully repaid her previous loan used to purchase additional products to sell, like pork, chicken and beef.

She took a loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer for her banana farm, and it helps more for the family. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as their farm, and she plans for the expansion of her farm.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer for her banana farm

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anita works hard to support her family. She has a bakeshop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as flour, margarine, sugar, etc.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as flour, margarine, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ave

texts.en:
Ave, 53 years old, is married and has ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past two years, Ave has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Ave has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc. to sell. Ave has previously borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married aged 44 living in Hoima-Uganda. He operates a retail shop mostly selling of cooking oil, salt, soap, general merchandise among other items on retail basis. In order to supplement his incomes he ventured into farming of beans and maize so as to raise more incomes for his family and to have more of food security in his village and areas surrounding him.

Samuel ventured into business in 2000 on realizing a need to supplement his incomes. His dream is to develop and expand his business so as to improve the standards of living of his family. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy more soap, salt cooking oil for sell. However, high rental fees and stiff competition affect his business.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt cooking oil for selling

loans.name: Miembe Saba A Group

texts.en:
Zainabu who is in her early 30's is a single and has no kid. She has been running several business,such as clothes selling,chips selling and snacks selling for three years now. She works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to earn a good month's profit.

This will be Zainabu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on Irish potatoes, to buy cooking oil for making chips, to buy baking flour, sugar for making bites and to increase on fabrics. She dreams of owning a car as well as a house.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group Miembe Saba A which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on Irish potatoes, to buy cooking oil for making chips, to buy baking flour, sugar for making bites and to increase on fabrics.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en: Miraluna is widow and is from Tipolo, Plaridel. She has three grown children who have helped her in taking care of their farm. They have been raising bananas for many years and well for the living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilization of her farm. Aside from this, she also plants trees on her farm for additional income in the near future. With this, she took another loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase organic fertilizer and materials needed  for her nursery farm. She hopes for a better living with her family in the future and she wants to see her children's success.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and materials needed  for her nursery farm

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Joanna works hard to support her family. She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from meat processing.

Joanna is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Joanna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nelibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nelibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nelibeth is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy spices, rice, vegetables, etc. for her food-vending business.

Nelibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her one past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spices, rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lornita

texts.en:
Lornita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a coffee maker business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy a machine and spare parts for the maintenance of her coffee grinder.

Lornita has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a machine and spare parts for the maintenance of her coffee grinder

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 60 years old and married and has five children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for the harvest of her sugarcane farm.

Luvisminda has been farming sugarcane for 30 years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for the harvest of her sugarcane farm.

loans.name: Adera

texts.en: Adera is a 51-year-old mother of three children living Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes, and she got her initial capital after selling cocoa, which she grows. Inadequate capital to purchase stock is one main hardship she faces. She has a personal goal of educating her children to higher institutions, and moving her business to a more permanent location is her business goal. She used the first loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell. She is now requesting for a another loan to add capital in her cocoa business through buying more cocoa to sell ahead of the peak season.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds to sell ahead of the peak season.

loans.name: Erina Bright School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jennifer. She is the Director of Erina Bright Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Makindye in Kampala with 480 students. Erina Bright School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Erina School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jennifer ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne opened her cosmetics salon from her home originally. After gaining customers, ‎improving her business management and growing she decided to move her salon. ‎Suzanne reopened her business in the main boulevard of her city, a popular destination ‎for locals and tourists. She offers ongoing cosmetic care and walk-ins for manicures and ‎other treatments. Suzanne’s customers are loyal and she gains new ones through word ‎of mouth.‎

Suzanne needed this loan to help with renovations, painting the salon, shelving, purchasing hair ‎washing station & treatment bed, nail supplies and other cosmetics.‎

Suzanne wants to ensure her children gain a strong education and is dedicated to their ‎future. She is determined to see her business thrive.‎

loans.use: to help with renovations, painting the salon, shelving, purchasing hair ‎washing station & treatment bed, nail supplies and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is married and has four children all of whom do  not attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 15 years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Namsang Group

texts.en:
Chankham understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Chankham knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Chankham purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, if it is available.

Chankham is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kuysin

texts.en:
Kuysin is married parent of 4 children. Her husband is Ismat. He is a master of repairing houses. Kuysin has been busy with feeding cows. She buys calves, feeds them for some months and sells in a local market. Kuysin works in this field more than 6 years. She manages her business alone and she works hard every day.

Kuysin now needs financial support because she is ill. She must go to doctor as soon as possible. Kuysin is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael is a 26-year-old man and owns a motorcycle. He was driving this every day for two years to earn a living. Rafael is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo and a father of a one-year-old baby boy. In spite of being young to have a family, Rafael is determined to work hard for them to have a comfortable living. With this, he is asking a loan for his motorcycle maintenance and to buy varieties of goods. Additionally, his wife is running a sari-sari (varieties) store business to have an additional income. He wishes in the future to improve his livelihood for his family.

loans.use: for his motorcycle maintenance and to buy varieties of goods

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a 31-year-old single mother of four children. She works in her grocery business, selling goods to her local community members. She wants to provide a financially secure life to her children. She wants to expand her business in order to support the needs of her children by paying school fees and other household bills.

She is asking for financial assistance from Gata Daku MPC, and she recently took a loan to buy additional grocery goods to replenish her inventory and to have a greater income. Rona's plan for the future is to save more money by expanding her business into a big grocery store to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to replenish her inventory.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen lives Vanadzor city of Lori region. He lives here with his beloved wife. Their two sons with their families are in Russian Federation where they live and work. Arsen graduated Yerevan State University the faculty of History.

Arsen already 45 years is busy with creative work. He writes poems, stories, novels and he also does translations of different books of various authors. He managed to publish a lot of books written by him. Some of them you can see in the photo on his table. Now he also works at the private company where he is again engaged in his beloved creative work. Arsen is very poetic person and all of his books started from its’ titles show the style, the feelings, anxiety, the happiness and sadness of the author. Arsen mentions that with each of his book publishing he worries and impatient very much whether the society will accept and get interested in his book or not.

Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Arsen asks for the purchase of a computer, which is very important in his creative work, and also he needs some money for his new book’s publishing which includes not small expenses.

loans.use: to buy a computer which is very important in his creative work, and also he needs some money for his new book’s publishing which includes not small expenses

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farm.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 33-year-old small businessman in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. In the profile picture, he is seen standing in his very own shop.

Tariq is married and has a child. He makes a living by staying at his shop and sells the jewelry and cosmetics which are the main source of income.

The major challenge is that Tariq is facing is too little space at his shop for catering to the customers. Tariq is seeking a loan to invest it in his store and making it more spacious and accommodating for the customers. This loan amount will help Tariq to maintain the condition of his shop and make more profit than before and get him settled in life with a family.

Your loan investment will enable Tariq to participate in formal markets where he will get better prices for his product and grow interdependent relationships and explore new opportunities.

loans.use: to invest it in his jewelry and cosmetics store.

loans.name: Na Group

texts.en:
Deang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

Deang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Deang and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. Deang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Deang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so her family can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Shupikai

texts.en:
Shupikai is 37 years old, married with three children. She lives in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe where she has operated a successful clothing shop for the past two years. Shupikai used her first Kiva loan to buy clothing in bulk to reduce costs. Using the profits from her business, Shupikai donates academic exercise books to students on the verge of dropping out of school.

Shupikai seeks a second Kiva loan to expand her clothing shop into a boutique and plans to contribute some the profits to care for her parents. She intends to build a house for her mother. Shupikai volunteers at local schools as a Camfed Learner Guide and Community Health Trainer, and will continue to devote her volunteer work as interest on her “social-interest” loan.

loans.use: To expand her clothing business into a boutique.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: Nary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nary does work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Abagambakamu Kyakajaka Group

texts.en:
Margret a member of Abagambakamu Kyakajaka Group is 43 years of age, a married mother of 5 children and all attend school in Hoima Uganda. She deals in farming mostly growing of maize and beans and rice among other items. She also owns a market stall in order to supplement her incomes.

She expects to grow and fulfill the increasing demands of her customers only to be limited by inadequacy of capital and unfavorable weather conditions that affect her returns. She will use the loan facility to set up a new cassava plantation. She is a member of Abagambakamu Kyakajaka Group where there is group guarantorship to obtain a loan instead of offering security.

loans.use: to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a receptionist at a hotel for six months. Her husband is retired from the military and now runs his private business selling clothes. Their son serves in the military and their daughter teaches at a high school.

Sarantuya is requesting a loan of $2,000 USD to buy building materials such as planks, bricks, fiberglass and shingles for house renovation. By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollution into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Arslanbaatar

texts.en:
Arslanbaatar, 47 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Erdenet, the third-largest city of Mongolia. He has been teaching mathematics at a high school for 25 years. His wife teaches music at a kindergarten.

Their two older children study at university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and their youngest daughter goes to high school. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to pay the tuition fee for his son. By doing so, he will enable his son to study hard without worrying about the tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for his son

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa, age 48, is an accountant with a private firm. She has been engaged in this work for four years. Her husband is an electrician at a power plant. They live in Erdenet, which is the third-largest city in Mongolia.

Their only son studies at a university in the Philippines, and she is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 1,500 in order to pay tuition fees for her son.

She is grateful that this loan will enable her son to receive a strong higher education to further his career.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 32 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her businesst.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 31-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Cecilia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and suppliesfor her food-vending business such as, hot dogs, bamboo sticks, and meat..

Cecilia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her food-vending business such as, hot dogs, bamboo sticks, and meat.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is a 38-year-old married woman with six children; five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analisa has a firewood "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Analisa has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Andressa

texts.en:
Andressa is 37 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Andressa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Andressa has been in this business for 18 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Angeline is 24 years old and has two children who are in school.

Angeline has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Angeline requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like pants and shoes.

Angeline has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like pants and shoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
The person in the photo is John, sixty eight years old, married and blessed with six children. He joined hand in hand eastern Africa in the year 2015 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management. His economic activity is dairy farming.  He is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feeds and repair cattle shed which will increase his milk production thus increase his income. He will thus be in a position to cater for family needs.
John is grateful to kiva and their lenders and promise to repay promptly

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds and repair cattle shed that will boost production.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a single mother of one child,  who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gabino Eleuterio

texts.es: Gabino es un hombre trabajador de 49 años que vive junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos en la localidad rural de Pampacocha, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; además, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de queso. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar tres vacas orgánicas, con la leche orgánica que produzcan espera elaborar quesos de mejor calidad que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Gabino is a 49 years old working man. He lives together with his partner and their two children in the rural village of Pampacocha, which is located in Arequipa. He makes a living as a labourer and he also keeps organic beef cattle. He always devotes a lot of attention in the care and food that he gives them, which is made up by the organic alfalfa he grows. Moreover, he produces and sells cheese.

He is requesting the loan to buy three organic cows. He wants to make better quality cheeses with the organic milk that they will produce, so that they can be sold at a better price. In the future, he would like to give his family a better quality of life and to keep enjoying good health. This is the reason why he focus on organics.

loans.use: to buy three organic cows. He will use their milk to produce better quality cheeses to sell them with a higher price and increase his earnings.

loans.name: Abbé  Faustine

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Abbé est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Abbé est une coiffeuse qui vend aussi du charbon de bois puis s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché des mèches et tissages et les revendent dans son salon de coiffure. Abbé nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches, tissages et des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre  puis de gagner des bénéfices afin d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge de leur enfant et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Abbé is a 28-year-old, married mother of one child who lives in Adidogomé. Abbé is a hairdresser who also sells charcoal. She purchases hair extensions and weaves two times a month at the market and then resells them in her salon. Abbé needs this loan to order packages of hair extensions, weaves, and bags of charcoal. Her goal is to have profitable sales in order to help her husband take care of their child and meet their family's food and health needs.

loans.use: to buy 43 packages of hair extensions, 38 packages of weaves, and 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a internet cafe business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ann is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy supplies for her internet cafe business, like mouses and keyboards.

Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, like mouses and keyboards.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John lives in Hoima Uganda.He is aged 30, a married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children and all attend school. He operates a retail shop mainly buying and selling of general merchandise like sugar, soap, bread among other items. In order to supplement his incomes he rides a motorcycle for transport. He hopes to expand his business into new markets and trade in wholesale which will enable him to Maximilien his profits. He will use the loan to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap for sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap for sell.

loans.name: Maudy Veronica

texts.es: Maudy es una mujer trabajadora de 32 años de edad que vive en la localidad rural de Cambrune, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica a cultivar productos orgánicos, actualmente gusta de cultivar orégano orgánico; así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de orégano y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno donde planea sembrar dicho cultivo. En el futuro Maudy desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maury is a hardworking 32 year old woman who lives in the rural area of Cambrune, which is located in Moquegua. She works as a field hand and also grows organic products. Currently she is growing organic oregano.

For this reason she seeks a micro loan to be able to buy organic oregano seed and organic fertilizers to be able to prepare the land where she plans to grow this crop. In the future, Maudy hopes to improve the conditions of her life.

loans.use: to buy organic oregano seed and organic fertilizers to plant oregano.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Serah, 35 years old and blessed with one kid.
She does potato farming to earn a living. She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide that will help boost farming.

She looks forward to more income that will enable her cater for family needs such as food. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli con 33 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú,en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Eli se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia desde hace 10 años en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Eli es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Eli is 33 years old and lives with his parents in a rural zone in the district of Calleyuc, in the province of Cutervo, in the department of Catamarca, in Perú. He has very good personal and business references from the inhabitants of that zone. The residents of that area work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

Eli works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee. He has 10 years experience in this field. He seeks a loan to buy fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm. In this manner he will obtain increased output.

Eli is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. He has had loans which he has paid off punctually,

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro con 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Aramango,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Lázaro se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor. Solicita préstamo para invertir en mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Lázaro es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Lázaro is 56 years old and in a common law marriage. He lives in a house he owns, made of rustic material, together with his wife and their three children, in the district of Aramango, in the province of Bagua, in the department of Amazonas, in Perú. He has very good business and personal references from the inhabitants of the zone. The residents of that area work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

Lázaro works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, of the Catimor variety. He seeks a loan to invest in the maintenance of his coffee crop. This investment will lead to earnings to improve his economic condition, and thus is an investment in better living conditions.

Lázaro is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Charitte

texts.en:
Charitte, age 35, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for three years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

She and her husband have four children, two of whom are in school.

Charitte requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies with which to raise her livestock.

In the future, Charitte would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies with which to raise her livestock

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos está motivado para seguir trabajando en la agricultura, pues ha notado que después de haber utilizado el crédito anterior en su negocio sus cosechas son mejores, con ello sus ingresos han aumentado, su núcleo familiar se mantiene, pero en la actualidad sus condiciones de vida son más dignas, hasta el momento no ha presentado dificultades para realizar sus actividades.
Con la finalidad de tener siempre el sustento diario de su familia requiere de un nuevo crédito, con el que podrá comprar materiales como: insecticidas, herbicidas, abono y semilla mejorada, para sembrar granos básicos, tiene muchísima fe en que sus cosechas serán abundantes.
texts.en:
Carlos is motivated to keep working in agriculture. He noticed that after having used the previous loan on his business, his harvests were better. With that, his income has increased. He was able to support his nuclear family, and currently, they have a more dignified standard of living. He hasn't had any difficulty in carrying out his work.

With the objective of always providing his family with their daily bread, Carlos is requesting a new loan. With the loan, he will be able to purchase materials, such as insecticides, herbicides, compost and improved seed. The purchase will allow him to plant staple grains. Carlos has quite a lot of faith that his harvests will be abundant.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as: insecticides, herbicides, compost and improved seed so he can plant staple grains.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda, age 56, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have six children.

Daylinda requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies with which to raise her livestock.

In the future, Daylinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies with which to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, dice que su negocio mantiene estabilidad y la frecuencia de sus clientes  es muy fluida en la tortillería, al haber invertido anteriormente en materia prima, la productividad ha sido mayor y aunque sus ingresos son de subsistencia tiene un estilo de vida con menos carencias y además puede cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Para seguir en el mercado solicita un nuevo financiamiento que utilizara en la compra de harina, maíz, leña, etc., contará con todo lo necesario para seguir vendiendo tortillas, su objetivo es tener clientes satisfechos y una fuente de ingresos permanente.
texts.en:
Rosa says that her business has stayed stable and that she has had a nice flow of customers in her "tortillería" (tortilla shop). Since investing her previous loan in raw materials, she has had greater production and, even though she is at a subsistence income, she has suffered fewer scarcities in her lifestyle. In addition, she is able to meet her obligations.

So that she can stay in the market, Rosa is requesting a new loan. She will use the loan to purchase flour, corn, firewood etc. Then she will have everything she needs to keep selling her tortillas.

Rosa's goal is to have satisfied customers and a permanent source of income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, corn, firewood etc. so she will having everything she needs to keep selling tortillas.

loans.name: Juan Cancio

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador de 58 años que vive en la localidad rural de Madrigal, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y además se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva, Juan además se dedica al cultivo de papa orgánica, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar abonos orgánicos para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de papa orgánica. En el futuro Juan desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working, 58-year-old man who lives in the rural area of Madrigal, located in Arequipa. He works as an agricultural labourer and he also earns a living through breeding organic beef cattle. He always pays close attention to the care and feed that he gives to the animals, which is made up of organic alfalfa that he grows himself.

Juan also grows organic potatoes, which is why he is asking for a micro loan so he can buy organic fertilisers so that he can maintain his organic potato crop.

In the future, Juan hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilisers to maintain his organic potato crop.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena de 35 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 20, 12, 8 y 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida comercializando carnes y embutidos en un local que se encuentra cerca de su vivienda, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindando todo lo necesario para su desarrollo, además de proveer lo necesario para su hogar. Lorena desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos adquiriendo una mayor cantidad de productos alimenticios, diversificar su negocio comprando mayor variedad de productos los cuales le permitan generar una mayor fuente de ingresos así como brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jamón, salchichas, mortadelas, chorizos, etc. para aumentar las ganancias de su negocio y de esta manera mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Lorena is 35 years old and lives in a home she owns with her husband and their 4 children, ages 20, 12, 8 and 1. She is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling meats and cold cuts in a locale close to her home. In this way she generates economic income with which she has moved her children forward, providing them everything necessary for their development, and providing what is needed in the home.

Lorena wants to increase her economic earnings, by acquiring a larger quantity of food products, and diversifying her business by buying a greater variety of products. This will allow her to generate a larger source of income, as well as to provide better service to her customers. For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in ham, hot dogs, bologna, sausages, etc. in order to increase the earnings from her business, and in this manner to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in ham, hotdogs, bologna, sausages, etc., to increase the earnings from her business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre de 46 años de edad, es casado vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad del Cantón Maza.
Ángel para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 4 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes con este ingreso a su familia ha sacado adelante. Ángel con el afán de contar con otra fuente de ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno con cultivo. Su gran sueño es comprar este terreno y mejorar la calidad de vida  de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel is a 46-year-old man, married and living with his wife in a region of Cantón Maza.

To earn a living and provide for his family, he has worked as a bricklayer for the last 4 years. However, to increase his income he also buys and sells groceries. With the desire to have another stream of income to depend on, Ángel has taken the decision to ask for a loan to buy a plot of land with crops. His greatest wish is to buy this land and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land with crops.

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es: Rosa tiene 67 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, es una persona responsable y muy dedicada con su trabajo, a pesar de su avanzada edad la señora Rosa cuida de su nieta, de dos meses de nacida, ella ha dedicado 30 años a  la crianza de chanchos, ya que esta actividad es su único ingreso  económico para poder sustentar su humilde hogar, el crédito  va a invertir en la compra de, mas crías, para  poder crecer en su negocio y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old and a widow. She is a responsible person, very committed to her work despite her age. She looks after her 2-month old granddaughter and has 30 years' experience raising pigs, her sole source of income to support her simple household.

Rosa will use the loan to buy more young pigs to raise so she can grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: buy more pigs

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive María de 19 años de edad, es humilde pero acogedora, y en ella vive muy feliz con su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad. Sus deseos de superación le han permitido a María contar con una pequeña granja, en la que cuida de animales como pollos, gallinas y cerdos, los cuales luego comercializa, con lo cual se gana la vida. Ella desea reparar una parte del techo de su vivienda, ya que en estas épocas de lluvia el agua se filtra, causando deterioro en sus pertenencias y enfermedades en su hija, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, pines y mano de obra para cambiar una parte del techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old and the house in which she lives is sheltering, allowing her to live very happily with her life's companion and her small daughter who is two years old. Her desire to get ahead has permitted Maria to count on a small farm in which she cares for animals, including chickens, hens, and pigs, which she later sells. In this manner she earns her living.

Maria wishes to repair a part of the roof of her residence, since in the current rainy season the water leaks through, causing deterioration of her belongings and illness for her daughter. For this reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in laminated metal sheets, pins, and laborers to replace a part of the roof on her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: invest in laminated metal sheeting, pins, and laborers to replace a part of the roof on her house.

loans.name: Benedicto De Jesus

texts.es:
Benedicto, se acerca a Padecomsm para solicitar un nuevo crédito que le servirá para pagar la reparación del coche que utiliza para recolectar la basura y así desempeñar con responsabilidad sus obligaciones, pues aunque sea un empleado el equipo de trabajo es de su propiedad, otra parte lo invertirá en láminas y madera para hacer reparaciones necesarias en su vivienda y así vivir en mejores condiciones.
El efecto de haber utilizado el crédito anterior para mejorar su entorno ha sido positivo, aún conserva su trabajo, sus ingresos son estables, él desea seguir luchando para construir su casa propia y cuando llegue el momento de jubilarse piensa dedicarse a dar sus servicios de jornalero.
texts.en:
Benedicto comes to Padecomsm to seek a new loan that will allow him to pay for the repair of the cart he uses to collect trash and thus responsibly comply with his obligations. Although he's an employee, he owns his work equipment. Another part of the loan will be invested in laminated sheeting and wood to make necessary repairs on his home, so he can live in better conditions.

The effect of having used the prior loan to improve his environment has been positive. He still has his job, and his income is stable. He wants to continue fighting to construct his own house, and when the time comes to retire, he's thinking about providing his services as a day laborer.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the cart he uses to pick up trash, and thus responsibly carry out his obligations.

loans.name: Hamufari

texts.en:
Hamufari is a single mother of two boys, and lives in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe. Hamufari and her young sisters operate a grocery shop, in which they sell groceries, soap, and other home essentials. Hamufari used her first Kiva loan to increase stock. Hamufari is able to be self-reliant through the success of her business. She has been able to afford not only her sons’ school fees, but also the tutoring and examination fees she needed to complete her own secondary education.

Hamufari seeks a second Kiva loan so that she may further expand her grocery business. Hamufari serves as a Camfed Seed Money Scheme Trainer, empowering young women in the community to be economically independent. She also coordinates the movement for HIV/AIDS awareness in her community, and will continue to repay the interest of her “social-interest” loan through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Health Activist.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business and purchase more stock like sugar, cooking,salt, etc.

loans.name: Chinna Group

texts.en:
Chinna is a 51-year-old married mother of two children in her care. She resides in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 29 years. Her husband is 38 years old and earns some income from rice cultivation as well. Together, Chinna and her husband can make an income of USD $3 daily.

Chinna is a group leader and would like to request a loan as part of a group of five members. She will use her portion to buy piglets to fatten and thus to earn additional income to improve her living standards. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy piglets to fatten. In the future, she is going to expand her farming business and support her children to earn high diplomas.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten

loans.name: Yessica María

texts.es: Yessica, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está soltera,  vive con sus hijos, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
27-year old Yessica is single and lives with her children who are her main priority in life.

With the loan money she plans to buy fertilizer and other products to put on her coffee plants so they develop properly. She also plans to hire laborers to help with the application and with the harvest once the plants are grown. Then she can be assured of a fine harvest.

Yessica expects to take advantage of the good climate and soil for growing coffee in the area, and also put into practice her several years' experience. As well she will be able to buy the best quality products so that her coffee plantation develops well and healthily ensuring a good harvest and high production.

She plans to use the money she earns to support her family, fulfill various family goals, and continue investing in her plantation. This is Yessica's first loan with FUDECOSUR and she has not had any previous loans with other state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering her the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: Buy products to apply to her coffee plants

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad que con mucho esfuerzo compro su vivienda hace 7 años y en ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijo de 18 y 16 años de edad. En el cantón donde vive Silvia es muy conocida como una persona emprendedora, ya que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de forma ambulante, lo cual le permite salir adelante con su familia. Ella desea mejorar el cuarto de la cocina, que como se observa en la fotografía está construido con láminas deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar el cuarto de la cocina y tener un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a hardworking, 38 year old woman, who through great effort bought her home 7 years ago. She lives with her life partner and their two children ages 18 and 16. In the village where Silvia lives, she is well known as an enterprising person, as she works selling clothing items as a street vendor, which allows her to move her family forward.

She wants to improve her kitchen, which as can be seen in the photograph, is made of deteriorating laminated sheeting. For this reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and wire to improve the kitchen and have an adequate place to prepare food.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and wire to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif and his family live in a Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He manufactures surgical instruments for medical purposes, so it is their livelihood and source of income. He sells his manufactured products at a local market near his warehouse. Most of the income he generates goes to family related expenses and business required expenses.

Asif is seeking a loan to complete the latest order he has been booked for . The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials to get the project done.
Your loan investment will help Asif and his family elevate their livelihoods and lead a more comfortable life, raising their living standards.

loans.use: to invest in surgical tools business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a maize farmer from Sabon Garin Kuzuntu village. As a Babban Gona member, Maria is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. Maria will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay its sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Maria no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Maria hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to move to the city with her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Grupo Las Mariposas De Paculam Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una joven de 21 años de edad, esta simple mente unido de hecho, con una linda familia de 2 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 3 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Chuachinup.
Manuela con el afán de generar sus ingresos  y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo realiza ella desde hace un año, gracias a su amabilidad y carisma con las personas, ha logrado que la gente lo reconociera luego. Manuela desde hace algún tiempo había decidido ampliar su negocio, pues con los productos que cuenta ya no se da abasto, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías de ropa tales como: cortes, fajas, güipiles y delantales. Con esta inversión ella espera poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes. Su gran sueño es poder contar con su propio local para tener un lugar más adecuado y exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 21 year old young lady. She is in a common law marriage, and has a beautiful family with two children between the ages of 1 and 3. They live in a community in the Chuachinup village. With the desire to generate income and move her family forward, she works buying and selling traditional clothing. She's worked at this business for one year. Thanks to her congeniality and charisma with people, people now know her.

Some time ago, Manuela decided to expand her business, since with the products she has she can't get by. Due to this necessity, she seeks a loan to buy clothing items such as skirts, sashes, tunics and aprons. With this investment she hopes to be able to better satisfy the needs of her customers. Her big dream is to be able to have her own shop in order to have a more adequate space to better display her products.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing items such as skirts, sashes, tunics and aprons.

loans.name: Tatiana Lucía

texts.es: Tatiana Lucía, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de equipo y materiales requeridos para realizar trabajos de belleza y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de estilos de corte de cabello y tratamientos de uñas y otros servicios adicionales y con productos y técnicas de alta calidad y seguridad, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso humano y todos y todos con garantía. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Tatiana Lucia is 22 years old, married, and lives with her husband who is her main priority in life. With the loan money she plans to buy equipment and materials as required for her beauty salon business. Then she will be able to offer her clients a greater variety of hair styles, nail treatments, and other services with high quality products and techniques suitable for human beings, all with a guarantee.

With these purchases Tatiana expects to earn more money to invest in her business and fulfill several goals that will result in a future better quality of life for herself and her family.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any previous loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering her the best terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a divorced woman with four children, one of whom attends school. She lives in her own house, which has both electricity and piped water.

Rosemary has operated a retail-shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of buyers taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit.

Rosemary wants to use the loan she is requesting to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Amar

texts.en: Amar is a young man living in Rafah in the Gaza strip. He works in the public sector where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea is to transport goods and inventory between traders using his rickshaw. Now Amar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay for a rickshaw. By taking this loan,  Amar can work more efficiently and increase his his profit. Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk) Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade.  Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: him to pay for a rickshaw.

loans.name: Juan Ovidio

texts.es:
Juan, necesita de más capital que le permita invertir en insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y en la compra de cerdos, de esta manera tendrá un inventario abastecido para que su negocio siga con vida, se esfuerza mucho por administrar bien los créditos y sus ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Él considera que los créditos le han sido de mucha ayuda para mejorar su negocio y estabilizarse económicamente, en la actualidad cuenta con un mejor inventario y ofrece a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan needs more capital which will allow him to invest in agricultural supplies to grow corn and buy pigs. This way, he will have a fully stocked inventory so his business will continue to be lively. He works hard to manage his credits and earnings to meet his obligations.

He believes that loans have helped him a lot to improve his business and financially stabilise it. At the moment he has a great inventory and is giving his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies to grow corn and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers gather. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married mother of two children, neither of whom attends school because they are grown-ups. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For more than a year, Mwanalima has operated an open-air food-sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge in her place of business.

With the loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), Mwanalima wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ron began his career in 1992 working for the Unites States Navy as a Damage Controlman. He retired from the Navy in 1997 and began working for NASSCO, a manufacturer of military equipment for ships.

Throughout his career, Ron has been passionate about drawing and graphic design. He began drawing in the sixth grade, mostly as a hobby. Over the past year, demand for the drawings and the complexity of the requests had increased, so Ron decided to officially establish the business.

His graphic arts and design business involves the sale and commission of unique drawings created by Ron using both markers and digital technology. Ron designs original characters with ethnic diversity focusing on the empowering of minority females.

Currently, Ron is volunteering full time with the American Red Cross as a Disaster Services Volunteer, working as a first responder and providing aid to those affected by local disasters.

Ron will use his Kiva loan to purchase art supplies, print marketing materials and upgrade his graphics design software.

loans.use: to purchase art supplies, print marketing materials and upgrade his graphics design software.

loans.name: Evidence Group

texts.en:
The tantalizing aroma of meat sizzling on the grill beckons customers forward. The woman behind the grill is clad in her smart crisp apron and her head is covered with appropriate head gear for hygiene purposes. She knows the best time to prepare her mouthwatering dishes. She specifically targets the morning breakfast rush and the lunch hour rush. As she knowledgeably mixes different ingredients in her pot, the enticing aroma enters the nearby clinic, attracting the nurses and patients alike. Tummies grumble in response, pushing the owners to go outside and buy from Sekai’s gateside food canteen.

Sekai leaves her customers yearning for more of her special meals. At the age of 41, she has proved that, like wine that gets better with age, so has her cooking evolved as she has grown older. Widowed with three children to look after, Sekai would have otherwise faced tough challenges in meeting the needs of her family. Fortunately, the good returns from her business have enabled her to adequately look after her children. She pays their fees and provides nutrition and clothing.
