Her family always feasts on wholesome meals because she is a good cook and knows what’s best for the family.

Sekai operates her canteen in a strategically set-up location at the gate of the maternity ward in one of the oldest suburbs in the capital of Harare. Her target customers are the new mothers who will be yearning for the taste of a home cooked meal. Hospital food is usually bland and that makes the patient prefer to source meals from elsewhere. Sekai knows this and uses it to her advantage. She also targets all the hospital personnel, from the midwives and nurses to the general hands. Her menu mainly consists of sadza (cooked cornmeal) and beef, rice and chicken, chips with chicken, fish or Russian sausages.

Sekai is in a group of “golden oldies “called Evidence. They attended Thrive trainings and had a lot of revelations that inspired them to be better businesswomen. The other women in the group have businesses that include market gardening, selling baby wear at the clinic and keeping layer chickens for eggs. Sekai requires a loan of $400 to restock more potatoes directly from Nyanga to resell in Harare. She also wants to add a tent-like cover to her canteen so that the rainy season does not affect her business.

loans.use: to restock more potatoes directly from Nyanga to resell in Harare, and to add a cover to her canteen so that the rainy season does not affect her business.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Aliyu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adjo  Ewui

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Adjo est une veuve femme  qui vit à Adidogomé. Agée de 48 ans, Adjo est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille activement pour gagner sa vie en vue de subvenir à ses besoins. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois; ce qui lui permettra de vite libéré le stock et d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et payer les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès ce début de la rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
The mother of five children, Adjo is a widowed woman living in Adidogomé. At 48 years old, Adjo is a charcoal reseller who works diligently to earn a living so that she can provide for her needs.

Adjo gets her supplies twice per month at the market and is requesting this loan to order bags of charcoal. This will allow her to quickly turnover her stock and make more income, so that she can face the family's expenses and pay her children's school fees from the start of this school year.

loans.use: to buy 43 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en: Sovann’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sovann does work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Munkhbayar

texts.en:
Munkhbayar, 43, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capitol city of Mongolia. He has been working as a bus driver at a high school for two years. His wife just began working at a filling station. Their children all go to high school.

Munkhbayar has applied for a 2,400 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Credit Mongol to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, wood and fiberglass in order to build a barn next to his Mongolian traditional ger, or yurt. By doing so his home will lose less heat, burn less coal for heating, and release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct a barn next to his home.

loans.name: Jemiralda

texts.pt:
De 52 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 2 filhos maiores, cuida de 1 neto, ela vive na base de negocio de venda de diversos produtos alimentares numa barraca em sua casa e conta com ajuda do esposo que trabalha como policia.Esta a repetir o credito pela terceira vez, com os anteriores conseguiu investir no negocio e construir um estabelecimento melhorado para o seu negocio em sua casa
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: bacias plásticas, panelas, jarras, bolachas, ovos, maçãs, refrescos, etc, para reforçar o seu negócio.
Sua maior esperança é desenvolver mais o seu negocio  e construir uma casa de alvenaria.
A falta de fundos é o seu entrave para realizar seus sonhos, contudo, espera um dia poder alcançar todos os seus objectivos
texts.en:
Jemiralda is 52 years old and in a common law marriage. She has two adult children and takes care of a grandson. She earns a living through her business selling various foodstuffs at her home. She gets help from her husband who works as a police officer. This is her third loan. With her previous loans she was able to invest in her business and build an improved store for her home business.

With the loan she intends to purchase plastic bowls, pans, pitchers, crackers, eggs, apples, refreshments, etc., so that she can boost her business.

Her biggest hope is to further develop her business and build a brick house.

The lack of funds is the obstacle in the way of her reaching her dreams. However, she hopes to one day achieve all her goals.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, pans, pitchers, crackers, eggs, apples, refreshments, etc., so she can boost her business.

loans.name: Sreyneat

texts.en:
Sreyneat, 19, was an outstanding student when she was in high school. Currently, she is studying at university to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Khmer Literature. Her mother is a widowed grocer and does not have funds. She is from Siem Reap Province of Cambodia.

Sreyneat would like to request a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a Bachelor’s degree successfully. As for her future dreams, she hopes to have a good job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: pay her university fees from first to fourth year, for a BA in Khmer Literature. Her mother is a widow and has no funds.

loans.name: Oubritenga Group

texts.fr:
Mme PASCALINE est la représentante du groupe OUBRITENGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charges.
Mme pratique le maraîchage depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 03 sacs d’engrais et 04 boîtes d’herbicides.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour soutenir sa famille et subvenir à  leurs besoins. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité en produisant plus et  améliorer le bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Mrs Pascaline is the representative of the Oubritenga group. She is married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 12 and the youngest is 2 years old. Three of the children go to school and she has four persons in her care.

Mrs has been growing vegetables for seven years. She gets her supplies in surrounding markets. With the disbursed money, she intends to buy three bags of fertiliser and four boxes of herbicides. She wants to use the loan profits to support her family and fulfil their needs. Her ambition is to expand her activity by producing more and improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertiliser and four boxes of herbicides.

loans.name: Dogomnogo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHANTAL  est la représentante du groupe DOGOMNOGO 2. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charges.
Mme pratique le maraîchage depuis 16 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 03 sacs d’engrais et 05 boîtes d’herbicides.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour soutenir sa famille en améliorant leurs conditions de vie  et scolariser ses enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité sur de grands périmètres  et  améliorer le bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Mrs Chantal is the representative for the Dogomnogo 2 group. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 9 and the youngest is 2 years old. Two of the children go to school and she has six persons in her care.

Mrs has been growing vegetables for 16 years. She gets her supplies in surrounding markets. With the disbursed funds, she intends to buy three bags of fertiliser and five boxes of herbicides. She wants to use the loan profits to support her family by improving their living conditions and sending her children to school. Her ambition is to expand her activity on larger plots and to improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertiliser and five boxes of herbicides.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aminu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Aminu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Aminu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Aminu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Asabe is maize farmer from Shamaki village. As a member of Babban Gona, Asabe is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Asabe would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Asabe can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Asabe is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: G.s San Casitas Montes Group

texts.es:
El señor Aquileo tiene 40 años, vive con sus esposa y dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de madera, desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta actividad, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos.

Don Aquileo con el préstamo está solicitando quiere comprar una maquina para aserrar madera y madera, con esta inversión espera mejorar su producción en su aserradero, para poder obtener mejores ingresos y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su sueño  es ampliar el negocio y poder tener su propia bodega.  está solicitando el préstamo en forma grupal sus integrantes son:
Doña  Belkis se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Don Jose  se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.          
Doña Sarai tiene una tienda de abarrotería.      
         
	
Choluteca, Honduras –  Septiembre  del 2015
texts.en:
Señor Aquileo is 40-years old and lives with his wife and two children. His business is selling wood. He has done this job for 20 years and his clients are friends and neighbors. 

With the loan, Aquileo wants to buy a machine to saw wood and stock of wood to saw with his new machine. With this investment he hopes to improve his sawmill production to be able to have a better income and give his family a better quality of life. His dream is to expand his business and be able to have his own store in Choluteca. He is asking for a loan in group form. 

The other members are: 

Señora Belkis, who works making and selling tamales
Señor Justino, works buying and selling cattle
Señora Sarai, who has a grocery store. 

Choluteca, Honduras –  September 2015

loans.use: to buy wood and a sawing machine.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ángel de 57 años de edad es casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación en San Lorenzo, Honduras se dedica  al negocio de transporte, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, cuenta con dos motos taxi en el cual transporta personas diariamente a su aldea.

Don Ángel esta  Solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pistones, cilindros, valvulas, etca. para hacerle  reparaciones  a su  moto taxi, es una persona muy luchadora y espera que con la ayuda de prestamo poder salir adelante y poder tener su moto taxi, en buen estado para poder seguir trabajando.

Su sueño es poder comprar otra moto taxi y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre 2015.
texts.en:
Ángel is a 57-year-old gentleman. He is married and lives with his wife in his home in San Lorenzo, Honduras. He earns a living in the transportation business, which he has dedicated himself to for many years. He has two motorcycle taxis witch which he transports people from his village daily.

Angel is requesting a loan in order to buy pistons, cylinders, valves, etc., to make repairs to his motorcycle taxi. 

He is a very persistent person and he hopes that with the help of the loan he is asking for, he will be able to get ahead and to have his motorcycle taxi in good condition to continue working.

His dream is to be able to buy another motorcycle taxi and thus be able to have a better quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre 2015.

loans.use: to purchase pistons, cylinders, valves, for his business.

loans.name: Chea Group

texts.en:
Pictured first from the left in this photo, Chea is 50 years old, her husband is 46 and the couple has three children who all work in factories. They live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia.

Both Chea and her husband farm rice, Chea since 1985. She also fattens up and sells pigs to earn extra income. Together, the couple earns approximately 7 USD a day.

Chea is the leader of this five-member group. She has applied for a 7,100,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner KREDIT to be apportioned among the members of her group. She will use her share to buy additional piglets to fatten. With her extra profits she will be able to improve her living standards.

In the future Chea wants to buy some cows and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to fatten up and sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married. For the past thirty years she has made and sold frozen treats such as popsicles in the Philippines.

Anita has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, fruit, etc. for her business. She is working to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, fruit, etc. to make and sell her frozen treats such as popsicles.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona's help, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 20 years, selling a variety of items such as soft drinks, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Veronica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt: O Sr. Celestino é casado, vive com sua esposa e 3 filhos , sendo 2 maiores e 1 menor. É militar. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção tal como cimento, arreia, ferros, portas. Tem sonho de progredir na carreira profissional e construir uma casa dos sonhos. Tem como maior desafio trabalhar cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Celestino is married and lives with his wife and his three children; two of them are adults and one is still a minor. He works for the military.

With this loan, he is planning to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, and doors. His dream is to grow as a professional and build the house of his dreams. His main challenge is to work harder every day.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and doors.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Isidra works very hard to provide for them.

Isidra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Isidra has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Isidra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jojo Kimberly

texts.en:
Jojo Kimberly is 26 years old and has two children, who are in school.

Jojo Kimberly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jojo Kimberly requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jojo Kimberly has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jojo Kimberly would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liezl is 32 years old and has one child in school.

Liezl has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Liezl requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

Liezl has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Liezl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margarita is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Margarita has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a 21,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene has been operating a general store in the Philippines for one year, selling a variety of items such as cereals, chocolate drinks, toothpaste, bath soap, salt, etc. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 51 years old and married with six children.  

Marita is in the agricultural business, specifically pig fattening, in the Philippines. Marita requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

Marita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt: A Sra. Felismina é mãe de 5 filhas, todas elas a estudarem, onde 3 estão a fazer o nível médio. É Instrutora numa escola de condução e é comerciante. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar portas, vidros, redes para janelas. Tem sonho de concluir a casa que vai servir de colégio e escola de culinária. Tem como maior desafio trabalhar cada vez mais e ter mais investimentos.
texts.en:
Felismina is the mother of five daughters who study. Three of them are in middle school. She is a driving instructor and a businesswoman.

With this loan, she is planning to buy doors, glasses, and window screens. Her dream is to finish building her house, which will also be a school and a cooking school. Her biggest challenge is to work harder every day and invest more.

loans.use: to buy doors, glasses, and window screens.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 31 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child in school. Maritess is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maritess has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a married woman with three children. She is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Candelaria has a general store business in the Philippines.

Candelaria requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years. Candelaria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Rady is a 20-year-old single freshman, and he is from the Kampot province of Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in electrical engineering, at a university in the city. His parents are rice farmers and they depend on farming as revenue.

Now Rady is short of finances to cover his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, so he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

His dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save enough money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 38 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school. Mercedita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her cattle.

She has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Paulita is 57 years old now.

Paulita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Paulita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Paz

texts.en:
Ma. Paz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bread vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Paz requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like four, sugar, butter, etc. for her bread production business.

Ma. Paz has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Ma. Paz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like four, sugar, butter, etc. for her  bread production business

loans.name: Proserpina

texts.en:
Proserpina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Proserpina is 55 years old now.

Proserpina has a abacca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies.

Proserpina has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su hijo y esposa, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: 38-year-old Leonel lives with his common law spouse and his son, who are his main priority. With this loan, he intends to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle, which is very important to him for carrying materials around his farm. This purchase will allow him to repair his vehicle successfully and to be able to have the materials on time at his farm, which will help his crops. This is the first loan he receives through FUDECOSUR. He had not received loans from state banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with easy terms and a low interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

Victoria has a buy-and-sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, etc..

Victoria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie is 47 years old, and she is married with four children.

Nerie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Nerie has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Nerie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dina Betsabe

texts.es: La vivienda de Dina es reconocida por los productos que ella vende frente a la misma, ya que son muy solicitados entre ellos están: bebidas frías, chicharras, tostadas y licuados, lo cual le permite salir adelante con su familia. Dina tiene 28 años de edad, ella hace 10 años logro comprar su vivienda y en ella habita con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad al que cuida mucho. Dina no logra dar abasto a los pedidos que sus clientes realizan de sus productos, por la falta de materiales necesarios, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frutas, leche, aceite, plátano, y prendas de vestir para aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Dina's home is known for the products that she sells in front of it, since they are asked for a lot. Among them are: cold drinks, crickets, tostadas and smoothies, which permits her to get ahead with her family. Dana is 28 years old; 10 years ago she achieved buying her house and she lives in it with her life partner and her 1 year old child, whom she cares for a lot.

Dina doesn't achieve having stock for the orders that her customers do for her products because of a lack of necessary materials. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: fruits, milk, oil, bananas, and clothing to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to invest in: fruits, milk, oil, bananas and clothing to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Flory Haydee

texts.es: Flory Haydee, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Flory Haydee is 57 years old. She is single and lives with her son, who is her main priority. With this loan, she is planning to buy fertilizers and other products for her coffee plantation. This will help her plantation to develop. She will also pay for the labor needed to spread the fertilizer and perform maintenance on the plantations, once they are developed. In this way, she will make sure she does a good job.

She wants to take advantage of the beneficial weather and soil conditions in the area for this crop, and also to put into practice what she has learned over the years growing coffee. She also wants to buy the best products for her plantation in order to guarantee a good development, a healthy and high-quality harvest, and a significant production in the short term.

With the income she will receive from the harvest, she wants to improve her family's well-being, achieve some goals she has set, and continue investing in her plantation. This is the first loan she receives from FUDECOSUR. She had not received loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with simpler terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 58 years old and has six children. She is married and three of her children are still in school.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmelita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Carmelita has been raising pigs for the past 13 years and she has borrowed 8 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florida is 41 years old and five of her children are in school.

Florida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell. Florida has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Florida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es: Blanca tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera de un niño de dos años de edad Jeremy permanece junto a su madre mientras ella fabrica pantalones de tela para luego salir a vender en los mercados de la ciudad hace cuatro años atrás este negocio le ha permitido cubrir los gastos de alimentación, el lugar donde viven ella y su hijo. Blanca necesita el dinero para comprar tela al por mayor abaratando sus costos obtendría más ganancias, a futuro desea que su pequeño negocio crezca para  seguir mejorando la  calidad de vida y dar oportunidades de trabajo a madres solteras.
texts.en:
Blanca is 22 years old, a single mother of a two year old boy Jeremy. He stays with his mother while she makes pants from cloth to later go out and sell them in the markets of the city. Since four years ago, this business has allowed her to cover the expenses of feeding and the place where she and her son live.

Blanca needs the money to buy fabric in bulk; lowering her costs she will obtain more profit. In the future, she hopes that her small business grows to continue improving the quality of life and to give work opportunities to single mothers.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado y está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a cuidar unas haciendas particulares, tienen un hijo y vive con ellos el cual estudia primaria.

Marta tiene una venta de tortillas, ya lleva 15 años vendiendo, su mamá le enseñó el negocio el cual tiene en su casa, ella comienza la venta desde las 10.00 A.M. hasta la 1.00 P.M.

Marta necesita este crédito para comprar maíz y otros productos para incrementar la venta de tortillas y así su familia tenga lo necesario.

Su sueño es tener su propia casa y seguir adelante trabajando para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Marta, 49, studied up to the sixth grade. She is married, and her husband works as farm caretaker. They have a son who lives with them and goes to primary school.

Maria has been selling tortillas for fifteen years. Her mother taught her this business. She works at home, from 10:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

Marta needs this loan to buy corn and other products to increase her tortillas sales, so that her family can have what they need.

Her dream is to have her own house and continue working to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn and other products to increase her tortilla sales.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carlota de 55 años de edad, no pudo asistir a la escuela ya que no tenían recursos económicos y además tenía que ir a trabajar en el campo, ahora está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, solo el hijo menor vive con ella y estudia en la escuela.
Carlota se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y además tiene ganado de repasto, realiza esta actividad desde hace aproximadamente 35 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres quienes le heredaron el conocimiento a ella y le ha servido para darle el sustento a su familia,  las parcelas donde trabaja están a 10 minuto de su casa y se va a pie, a estas labores se suman su esposo y también su hijo cuando no asiste a clases.
Carlota solicita este crédito para comprar 3 terneros para repasto.
El sueño de Carlota es poder darle el estudio a su hijo para que logre ser profesional.
texts.en:
Carlota, 55 years old, couldn't go to school since they didn't have economic resources and additionally, she had to go to work in the field. Now she is married and her husband works in agriculture, only the youngest son lives with her and studies in the school. Carlota works growing corn, and addition she has grazing cattle. She has been doing this activity for approximately 35 years. She learned this work from her parents, who passed down the knowledge to her and it has served her to give sustenance to her family.

The plots where she works are 10 minutes from her house and she goes by foot. Her husband adds himself to these tasks and also her son when he is not attending classes. Carlota is applying for this loan to buy three calves for grazing.

Carlota's dream is to be able to provide education to her son so that he can achieve becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy three calves for grazing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre y su padrastro, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The youth who has the pixelated face is 21 years old. She lives in a high risk zone.

She has been working selling clothing for several years and has been able to pay some of the household expenses with the profits she makes. She lives at home with her mother and her father.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more clothing at wholesale so she can continue with her sales and thus have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing to sell

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, entre quienes se destaca la Sra. Rosa, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella va mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas y de estación, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is in the poverty-elimination program. Each of them is trying hard to improve her living conditions. One of them, Rosa, who sells fruit, is featured here. She is a very busy woman, who through her efforts, continuous work, and the application of the essential behaviour of a successful woman, is going to improve her condition of poverty.

She is requesting this loan to buy fresh and seasonal fruit and thus be able to go on selling fruit as she already does. She is grateful for the oppotunity she is given to go on growing and improving as she already does.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 40 years old and has four children. Wilma is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Wilma has been raising livestock for the past 10 years and she has borrowed 8 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Iroda

texts.ru: Ирода молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 20 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного сына. Она очень трудолюбивая  женщина. Она швея. Ирода дома занимается шитьём разных национальных женских платьев. Её муж занимается строительством. Молодая семья живут со своими родителями и у них очень дружная счастливая семья. Чтобы развивать свою деятельность Ирода хочет купитm компьютерную швейную машину, но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Iroda is a young woman with a positive attitude towards life.  She is 20, married, and the mother of one son.  She is also a very hardworking seamstress.  Iroda works from home and sews various traditional Tajik outfits for women.  Her husband works in construction.  The young family live with their parents and they all get along very well and live happily together.  

Iroda wants to buy an electronic sewing machine in order to develop her activity.  However, she doesn't have enough money for this purchase, so she has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru:
Дилноза благодарит за поддержку и понимания. С кредитом она смогла начать животноводческую деятельность. 
  Дилнозу можно назвать настоящим трудоголиком. Она ни минуты не сидит без дела. Дилноза занимается животноводством и земледелием и к тому же устроилась работать швеей в ателье своего района. Она учится шить и теперь ей нужно купить свою машинку и приступить к работе. Она надеется, во второй раз ее поддержат, и заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en: Dilnoza thanks you for your support and understanding.  Thanks to her (previous) loan, she was able to start her own animal husbandry business. Dilnoza is a true workaholic.  She never stops working, not even for a minute.  She is now involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, and she has also started to work as a seamstress in a local workshop.  She is still learning how to sew and she now needs to buy her own sewing machine to start working in this field.  She really hopes to get some support again and she thanks you in advance for your help!

loans.use: to start her own sewing business and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
la socia Dionicia se sigue dedicándose a sus negocio de venta de chicha y cerveza.Ella sigue adelante junto con su familia y su deseo es seguir ampliando su negocio.
Dionicia solicito el préstamo para comprar azúcar y maíz.
Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y darle el préstamo. ella se compromete a cumplir puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas para saldar su deuda.
texts.en:
The partner Dionicia continues with her business selling chicha and beer. She moves forward together with her family and her wish is to continue growing her business.

Dionicia requests the loan to buy sugar and corn.

She is very happy and appreciative of the investors of Kiva for continuing to trust in her and give her the loan. She promises to make her agreed payments punctually to pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy sugar and corn.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira was born in Tajikistan in 1983. Her parents were poor people and she has experienced a lot of difficulties throughout her life. Nodira learned to sew when she was young and during the past 4 years, she has started her own business. Nodira sews local and European-style dresses for women. She has a workshop located near her house and many of her clients are her neighbors. Nodira always tries to offer high-quality products.

Nodira is going to increase her working capital as a way to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy fabric and thread and increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia Gladis se sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de cuyes y pollos y a su trabajo en una empresa privada. Con estas dos actividades sustenta su hogar, la socia en esta ocasión solicito el préstamo para comprar pasto, alfalfa, y maíz.
La socia es muy trabajadora y responsable  y se  siente  contenta con el préstamo y con los inversionistas de KIVA, ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Gladis, the borrower, continues dedicating herself to the business of selling guinea pigs and chickens and to her work for a private company. With these two activities she supports her household.

On this occasion the borrower is asking for a loan to buy fodder, alfalfa, and corn.

She is very hardworking and responsible. She feels happy about the loan and the Kiva investors. She promises to pay punctually according to the agreed plan.

loans.use: to pay fodder, alfalfa, and corn

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old and married with three children. Lorna has two children in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, home care products, and other groceries. Lorna has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marlene Cecilia

texts.es: Marlene tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ella posee una pequeña tienda, con la venta de productos le deja un poco de ganancias para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su humilde hogar, solicita el crédito para adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, así aumentara más su clientela y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlene is 54 years old. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture.

She owns a little store and the product sales leave her a small profit that helps her husband with the expenses of their humble household.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more products to satisfy the needs of her customers and thus have more clients resulting in more earnings.

loans.use: to buy prime staples in order to increase the inventory of her store.

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.ru: Фозилчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет 2-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Фозилчон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Фозилчон также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Фозилчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Фозилчон подрабатывает мастером. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Фозилчону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Фозилчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Фозилчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Foziljon is a hardworking young man with a positive attitude towards life.  He is 30, married, and the father of two children.  He contacted Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, as soon as he heard about the possibility of receiving some financial support.  Foziljon and his family live in the countryside.  Because of his family's difficult financial circumstances, he never got the opportunity to go to university and get a higher education.  His wife did not get an education either; she is now a homemaker who takes care of the household chores and the children.

Foziljon has his own business, which allows him to feed his family.  He fattens and resells cattle for a living.  In addition to this activity, he also works as a handyman.  Thanks to his work, he makes a decent income.  His wife also helps him with the farming business and sells the milk they get from their cows.

Foziljon now wants to increase his cattle headcount and expand his business.  For this reason, he has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan to buy cattle.  He truly looks forward to a positive outcome and he thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Karen Iveth

texts.es: Karen de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una mini libreria ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años y posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, y es gracias a ese trabajo como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de utiles escolares, lapiceros, papel bond, entre otras cosas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Karen is 37 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and her two children. She owns a small bookstore, located in her house. She has had it for ten years and has many customers because of the wide variety of products she sells. She manages to cover some of the home expenses thanks to this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy school supplies, pens, bond paper, and other products, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, pens, bond paper, among other products.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 40 years old and married with three children. Lorna has three children currently in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent, coffee, cereals, biscuits, and other items to sell. Lorna has been in this business for 15 years and she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, cereals, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, detergent, coffee, cereals, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 56 years old and is married with 13 children. With 3 children currently in school, Felomina works very hard to provide for them.

Felomina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Felomina has been in this business for 19 years where she sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 36 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Shirley is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Shirley has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Shirley has been in this business for the past 6 years. She has borrowed 1 previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. Dolores works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Prior to this loan, Dolores has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 10 years and she also earns income from food vending.

Dolores aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual es un gran hombre, es casado con una linda familia por la cual se esfuerza día con día, Pascual gracias a sus grandes aspiraciones los créditos a los que ha tenido acceso lo han beneficiado mucho, pues él logro comprar medicamentos y su farmacia pudo surtir mejor, gracias a la amabilidad que posee sus clientes han incrementado, con esta avance él está contento mas no conforme, pues la farmacia necesita abastecerlo de más productos para que la gente de su comunidad no tenga que salir del pueblo para conseguir sus medicamentos, por esa razón solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de medicamentos farmacéuticos. Su gran sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pascual is a great man. He is married with a beautiful family which is why he puts forth effort every day. Thanks to his high aspirations the loans Pascual has had access to have benefited him greatly as he was able to buy medicine and his pharmacy could be better supplied.

Because of his kind nature his customers have increased. He is happy with this progress but not satisfied. The pharmacy needs to be supplied with more products so that the people in his community do not have to leave town to get their medications. For this reason he is asking for a new loan to buy pharmaceutical drugs.

His big dream is to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical drugs to supply his pharmacy

loans.name: William Giovanny

texts.es:
William comparte su vida con su esposa y un hijo, ambos dependen económicamente de él, comenta no tener familiares en el extranjero, como persona responsable de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar se dedica a trabajar en la venta de mariscos, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 5 años y la aprendió gracias a sus parientes.
Necesita un crédito para poder comprar variedad de mariscos frescos cada vez que sea necesario, con ello tendrá un negoció más competitivo capaz de atender las necesidades de sus clientes y generarle mayores utilidades con las que respaldara el pago de la deuda.
Para William el sueño más grande que tiene es finalizar la construcción de su vivienda para disfrutarla junto a su familia.
texts.en:
William shares his life with his wife and son, who both depend on him economically. He says he doesn't have family members abroad, so as the person responsible to cover the household necessities, he makes a living selling seafood, something he has been doing for five years and which he learned from his relatives.

He needs a loan to be able to buy a variety od seafood each time it is necessary. With it, he will have a more competitive business able to keep up with the requirements of his customers and generate for him greater income with which he can shoulder the payment of the debt.

The biggest dream that William has is to finish the construction of his residence so as to enjoy it together with his family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of seafood each time it is necessary.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BAKARY est le monsieur qui tient le bélier sur la photo.
BAKARY est un cultivateur malien, âgés de 47 ans, marié à une ménagère et père de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 14 ans tous non scolarisés.
N’ayant pas été à l’école, BAKARY exerce l’activité d’élevage ovine et bovine il y a 13 ans. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes marchés. BAKARY fait recourt au RMCR pour développer son activité. Le profit qu’il trouve lui permet de satisfaire certains besoins de sa famille.
Il est souvent confronté au problème de mévente. Il se sent à l’aise d’exercer cette activité car il se voit de participer au développement économique de sa communauté.
texts.en: Bakary is a farmer from Mali and the man holding the sheep in the photo.  He is 47 years old, married to a homemaker, and the father of four children.  His children are between the ages of 6 and 14 and they all go to school.  Bakary himself never went to school.  For the past 13 years he has been raising sheep and cows.  He buys his livestock at local markets and resells at the same markets.   He has turned to Kiva's partner, the RMCR, to expand his activity.  Thanks to his profits, he is able to meet some of his family's needs.  However he often faces a slump in sales.  He still feels happy being involved in this activity as he believes that he is taking part in the economic development of his community.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Yawa Rose

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Yawa  s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu en revendant les produits alimentaires. Pour s’approvisionner Yawa se rend trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des plateaux d’œufs, Yawa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Yawa va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser une bonne éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is 39, married, and she lives in Adidogomé.  Since she has four children in her care, she tries hard to get an income and to make a living reselling food products.  She stocks up at the market three times per month.  She is taking this loan to buy some trays of eggs.  Thanks to the profit margin that she will make after increasing her sales, she will be able to help her husband to take care of the daily expenses of the family.  She will also be able to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 45 egg trays.

loans.name: Johnah

texts.en:
Johnah is a married mother of 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Johnah has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 35,000 PHP loan through Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Johnah has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en:
The Mawar group is made up of 5 women and is led by Rita, shown standing in the middle. Rita is a 30-year-old married mother of 4 children, their ages ranging from 2 to 11 years old. Three of Rita's children go to school. In her spare time, Rita runs a business selling different kinds of vegetables in the market. She started the business 1 year ago.

Rita runs her business in order to support her husband Hardian, a 40-year-old fisherman, in covering their daily living expenses. Rita also dreams of saving money for her children's education fees. Therefore, she plans to increase the quantity of vegetables she sells, such as water spinach, cabbage, chili, tomatoes, etc. Rita believes that the more vegetables she sells, the more income she can earn to save.

Rita was interested when she heard that TLM provides loans to business owners. Along with 4 women from her village, Rita formed the Mawar group and applied for a loan of 12,500,000 IDR. The other group members will use their loan portions to improve their businesses and for other necessary things. Rita hopes the loan provided by Kiva and TLM will benefit their businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, water spinach, cabbage, chilis, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 52 years old, and she is married with 5 children. With one child in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for all of them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Lydia has been in this business for 30 years selling a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elicio Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil casado su esposa realiza quehaceres domésticos, tiene  3 hijos Paola de 14 años, Vanesa de 12 años, y Mateo de 6 años ellos estudian en escuelas gratuitas, desde los doce años por la difícil situación económica en su familia tuvo que trabajar engrasando partes del vehículo hace diez años atrás decidió emprender su propio y pequeño negocio con sus ahorros hoy Demetrio con este dinero comprara herramientas de trabajo, grasa, incrementara sus ganancias para continuar satisfaciendo la alimentación, educación de sus hijos el aspira que continúen superándose.
texts.en:
Demetrio is 33 years old and is in a civil marriage. His wife does housework and he has 3 children: 14-year-old Paola, 12-year-old Vanesa, and 6-year-old Mateo. They study in free schools.

For the the past 12 years, due to the difficult economic situation in his family, he had to work on greased car parts. Ten years ago, he decided to launch his own small business with his savings.

Today with this money, Demetrio will buy work tools and grease. He will increase his profits in order to continue fulfilling his children's food and education. He dreams that they may continue improving themselves.

loans.use: to buy work tools and wholesale grease.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee de 51 años de edad, estudio solo segundo grado, decidió mejor dedicarse a trabajar en vez de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos pero ya no viven con él.
Renee desde hace 18 años se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos también tiene un destazo, fue  la necesidad de sacar a delante a su familia la que lo llevó a aprender el negocio, antes se dedicaba a trabajo de jornal pero no le alcanzaba para sus gastos del hogar, fue así que juntos con su esposa decidieron comenzar a destazar cerdos y así poder negociar dentro de la misma comunidad.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos, para venderlos y sacarles ganancias en un futuro.
Su sueño es poder construir su propia casa de ladrillo y comprar un carro para llevar a vender sus animales.
texts.en:
Renee, 51, studied only to second grade. He decided it was better to make a living working than to study. He has five children who no longer live with him.

For 18 years, Renee has been making a living buying and selling pigs. He also has a butchery. It was the necessity to get ahead with his family that brought him to learn the business. Previously, he made a living working as a day-laborer, but it wasn't enough to cover the household expenses. It was because of this that, together with his wife, they decided to begin to butcher pigs and thus be able to do business in the same community.
.
His dream is to be able to construct his own house from brick and purchase a vehicle in order to sell his animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs in order to sell them and get earnings in the future.

loans.name: Zarafshon

texts.en:
Zarafshon was born in 1989. She is a young and hardworking woman. Zarafshon is married and has 3 small children. Her husband is a migrant worker.

Zarafshon has her own business working as a sewer. She sews national dresses for women, and she has regular customers.

Zarafshon is requesting a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy medicine for her treatment. She is seriously ill and must see the doctor as soon as possible.

Zarafshon awaits and hopes for your financial support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her treatment.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 51 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Salome is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Salome has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Salome has been raising livestock for the past 3 years and she has borrowed 7 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Salome would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa con 52 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Teresa se dedica a la venta de gelatinas, chupetes, marcianos y refrescos, con más de 03 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de infraestructura de vivienda, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mejores condiciones de trabajo en lo que respecta a su negocio, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los habitantes de la zona.

Teresa es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha tenido tres créditos de S/.500,00; 1000,00 y 1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Teresa, 52, is married and lives with her husband and her children in the district of Oyotun, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in a rural zone of Peru. The inhabitants of this area mostly make their livings from agriculture, commerce and ranching.

Teresa makes a living selling gelatins, lollipops, frozen popsicles, and soft drinks with more than three years of experience in the business. Her business is located in her residence.

She is requesting a loan to repair the infrastructure of the residence. This investment will permit her to have better work conditions with respect to her business. With great influence in the business, this client thinks to improve productivity in order to be able to serve the diverse needs and tastes of the inhabitants of the region.

Teresa is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had three loans for 500, 1000, and 1000 soles which she has paid off in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to repair the infrastructure of the residence.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vicenta is 33 years old and all of her children are in school.

Vicenta has a buy-and-sell business in the Philippines, dealing in dried fish. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of dried fish to sell. Vicenta has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is an energetic young lady and is well-trained in cloth stitching. She wants to help contribute to her family's income which is the main reason why she has been running a small sewing business.

Her family also supports and encourages her profession because Samina is able to stitch cloth into unique and attractive dresses. Ladies of the society like her dress collections a lot. This is why her business is developing day by day.

Now, Samina needs to purchase more cloth and stitching materials so she can increase her sewing business. For this reason she has requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: to invest into her sewing business.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is a 47-year-old entrepreneur from Guimbal, Iloilo. He runs a “sari-sari” (variety store) in front of his house and he also sells fish at a nearby market.

Like other businesses, Jerson's income goes up and down as his business is affected by the weather and local competition. When it’s raining and fish and seafoods are expensive, he focuses on manning his store. Jerson has long-standing debts to some of his neighbors that also threaten the stability of his store.

Jerson wants to make his store more secure with additional capital amounting to 20,000 PHP that he can use to buy more dry goods, grocery items, soft drinks, and other beverages to resell. With a wide selection of merchandise, he can earn sufficient money despite many debtors. The additional capital will also strengthen his buying power when fish are scarce and expensive. He’s hoping that your kind generosity will help him to improve his business.

Jerson is married to Maricel, a 33-year-old housekeeper, and they are blessed with 1 child who attends elementary school. The couple wants to ensure the future of their child through a higher education. In addition to his responsibilities as a family man, Jerson also wishes to extend financial help to his siblings as long as he can. Family is very important to Filipinos.

Jerson’s busy schedule does’t stop him from attending his weekly fellowship meetings with CCT. The fellowship group consists of 10-15 individuals, and meetings are a place where he can gain strength spiritually and hear testimonies from other CCT partners. He is able to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods, grocery items, soft drinks, and other beverages to resell.

loans.name: Melagrosa

texts.en:
Melagrosa is 43 years old and is married with 6 children. With 3 of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Melagrosa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as candies, rice, home care products, and other groceries.

Melagrosa has been in this business for 11 years, selling a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as candies, rice, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel  se sigue dedicándose al transporte de cargas, gracias a esta actividad continua sacando adelante a su familia, el socio necesita viajar seguro, para ello necesita su vehículo en perfectas condiciones para seguir laborando, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su vehículo pesado.
El está muy agradecido y contento con los inversionistas de KIVA porque gracias al préstamo el mejorar su servicio de transporte brindándole seguridad.
texts.en:
Miguel continues making a living from transporting cargoes. Thanks to this activity, he continues to provide for his family. He needs to travel safely. For this, he needs his vehicle in perfect condition to continue working. It is because of this that he is requesting the loan to purchase spare parts for his heavy vehicle.

He is very thankful and happy with the Kiva lenders because thanks to the loan he improved his transportation service, providing him security.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his broken-down heavy vehicle.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mely is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Mely has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a larger variety of fish to sell at her fish stall. Mely has been in this business for 21 years.

In the future, Mely would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of fish to sell at her fish stall.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 56-year-old married woman with eight children. Angelina works very hard to provide for her family.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, personal care products, and other groceries. Angelina has been in this business for 6 years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish pond business in the Philippines.

Mitchel has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed and other supplies for the maintenance of her business. Mitchel has been in this business for the past 20 years.

In the future, Mitchel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed and other supplies for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 28 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school.

Hazel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Hazel has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Hazel has been in this business for the past 2 years, and she has borrowed 1 previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Hazel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Del Lago Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una joven de 21 años de edad, es casada vive junto  a su esposo en la comunidad de la aldea Jaibalito. 
Antonia (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) es una mujer que prioriza el bienestar de su familia, por esa razón tiene 10 años de realizar la elaboración de ropa típica, gracias  a su entusiasmo de vender a mucha gente ha logrado satisfacer con sus productos. Antonia con el afán de prestar un mejor servicio a los clientes se ha propuesto a solicitar un préstamo que le permite adquirir un poco más de materia prima como hilos de diferentes colores y estilos. Con esta inversión ella espera mejorar sus tejidos y así obtener más clientes. Sus aspiraciones en la vida son tener su propio local, fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 21 years old. She is a young woman who lives with her husband in the community of aldea Jaibalito.

Antonia (the first one from left to right) is a woman who puts her family's well-being first. This is why she has been making traditional clothes for ten years. She wants to sell her products to a lot of people, which is why she has managed to fulfill her customers' expectations.

Antonia, thinking of improving her service, has decided to apply for a loan to buy more materials, such as threads of different colors and styles.

With this investment, she hopes to improve her weaves, and in this way attract more customers. She would like to have her own establishment, strengthen her business, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different colors and styles of threads to make traditional clothes.

loans.name: Silvia Marisela

texts.es: Silvia de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de fruta pelada en bolsita desde hace mas de 2 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por esa razon tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Silvia, at the age of 30, lives in her own house with her three children. She has been selling peeled fruits in individual bags for more than two years. Her business is located near her house in a zone with a lot of traffic. For this reason she has many customers.

She is applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of more fruits and vegetables in order to be able to continue with her sales and thus have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 51 years old and married with four children. She has one child in school and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Emelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, sugar, and other groceries. Emelita has been in this business for 10 years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Emelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 49-year-old married woman. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Carolina has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has raised livestock for the past 6 years, and she has borrowed 7 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loans and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: José Adan

texts.es:
