José de 44 años de edad estudió hasta 7º grado, por el  conflicto armado que vivió el país ya no pudo seguir con sus estudios pues el lugar donde él vivía la guerra estuvo más fuerte,  actualmente está acompañado y tiene un hijo pero este ya no vive con ellos porque está casado.

José se dedica a la reparación de televisores y bicicletas desde hace ya 19 años, este oficio lo aprendió con un amigo. Anteriormente José se dedicaba a la agricultura  y a la compra de ganado en repasto, pero cuando aprendió la electrónica le puso mucho empeño a este oficio y fue así como inicio su negocio en la comodidad de su hogar, ahora ya tiene mucha experiencia y además cuenta con una buena clientela, él inicia su trabajo a las 7:00 A.M. y culmina su día a las 5:00 de la tarde.

  
El crédito será invertido para comprar todo lo necesario para reparación de televisores, llantas y bicicletas.

Su sueño es hacer más grande su negocio y poder tenerlo en un lugar más al céntrico.
texts.en:
José, at the age of 44, went to school through seventh grade. Because of the armed conflict that the country experienced, he was not able to continue with his schooling, since the war was more violent in the place where he lived. Now he is married and has a son who no longer lives with them because he is married.

José has been repairing televisions and bicycles for 19 years. He learned this trade from a friend. In the past, José worked in agriculture and in the purchase of grazing cattle, but when he learned electronics, he put a lot of effort into this work, and this is how he began his business in the comfort of his home. Now he already has a lot of experience, and furthermore, he has a good customer base. He begins his work at 7:00 am and finishes his day at 5:00 in the afternoon.

The loan will be invested in buying everything necessary for the repair of televisions, tires, and bicycles.

His dream is to make his business larger and to be able to have it in a more central location.

loans.use: to buy everything necessary for the repair of televisions, tires, and bicycles.

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Eutiquia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 30 years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Eutiquia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ahouefa

texts.fr: Ahouefa est une femme âgée de 38 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Mariée, Ahouefa vit avec un seul enfant. Ahouefa est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Ahouefa demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des cartons de chaussures en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leur enfant dans son éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Ahouefa is a 38-year-old woman residing in Adidogomé. She is married and lives with one child. A retailer of shoes, she gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells at her home and by circulating through nearby neighborhoods. Ahouefa is asking for this loan to realize her purchase of boxes of shoes with the aim of better sales and earning a profit for helping out her husband, so that he can do well in covering their child’s education costs, plus certain day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 boxes of shoes

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en Décembre 2009, les femmes du B.V sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué. Elles ont comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 40 ans, célibataire et mère d’une fille. Elle a comme activité principale le cafétéria (vente de petit déjeuné).
 
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 02 sacs de sucre de 50 kg, 10 tablettes d’œufs, 01 sac de 50 kg de petit pois, 01 bouteille de 20 litres d’huile raffinée 01 seau de 60 sachets d’huile de ¼ de litre et d’autres condiments pour les préparatifs du petit déjeuné.

Les bénéfices lui ont permis d’acheter un terrain d’acheter un lit de construire sa chambre payer les soins médicaux et la scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en:
Created in December 2009, the women of the 'banc villageois' have a lot of solidarity among themselves. They knew how to work together to develop solidarity and an appreciated esprit de corps. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Aissatou (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is 40 years old, unmarried, and the mother of a girl. Her main work is in food service (cafeteria) selling breakfasts.

This new loan will enable her to purchase two 50-kg sacks of sugar, 10 trays of eggs, a 50-kg sack of peas, a 20-liter bottle of quality oil, a bucket of 60 pouches of oil (¼ liters each pouch), and other condiments for making breakfasts.

The profits have enabled her to purchase a plot of land and a bed, to build out his bedroom, and pay for her daughter’s medical care and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, eggs, peas, and quality oil

loans.name: Christine Joyce

texts.en:
Christine Joyce is a 19 year old now. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Christine Joyce has a buy-and-sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy lotion, lipstick, soap, etc.

Christine Joyce has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy lotion, lipstick, soap, etc.

loans.name: Hernesia

texts.en:
Hernesia is 51 years old and married with two children. She has one child still in school and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Hernesia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Hernesia has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, cooking oil, sanitary pads, detergent, vinegar, etc.

Hernesia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba es una mujer trabajadora de 42 años de edad que se dedica  a la preparación y venta de comida, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 10 años y un varón de 6 años de edad. Alba desea invertir en su negocio de venta de comida, con lo cual logra sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arroz, carne, pescado, pollo, verduras, legumbres, entre otros productos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Alba is a hard-working woman of 42 years of age who prepares and sells food, an activity that she has been doing for 10 years, and for this reason she has many customers.

She lives with her life companion and their two children, a girl, age 10, and a boy, age 6.

Alba wants to invest in her business of selling food, with which she manages to raise her family. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in rice, meat, fish, chicken, greens, and vegetables, among other necessary products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in rice, meat, fish, chicken, greens, and  vegetables, among other products necessary for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca es muy reconocida en su cantón por el delicioso sabor de sus panes rellenos y diferentes platos típicos, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con este negocio. Blanca vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 16 años, lo cual le permite vivir tranquila, además de tener un lugar adecuado para preparar sus productos. Blanca desea invertir en productos para su negocio, por lo cual está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: panes, pollo, lechuga, tomates, maíz, pepino entre otros productos para su venta de panes y platos típicos.
texts.en: Blanca is very well known in her canton for the delicious flavor of her stuffed bread and different traditional foods. Being able to have this business makes her very happy. Blanca has lived in a house she owns for 16 years. This allows her to live in peace and also gives her a place that is suitable for preparing her products. Blanca wants to invest in products for her business, for which she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in bread, chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, corn, cucumbers and more products to sell her breads and traditional dishes.

loans.use: to invest in bread, chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, corn, cucumbers and other products to sell bread and traditional foods.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy continua dedicándose a su trabajo en una empresa estatal, con esta actividad saca adelante a su hijo, y ella desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, leche y arroz para su hogar.
La socia es muy trabajadora y responsable  y se  siente  contenta con el préstamo y agrediese a los inversionistas de KIVA, ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Nancy continues to work at a state company, which is how she supports her son. She wishes to have a better quality of life.

This borrower is requesting a loan to buy sugar, milk, and rice for her home.

She is very hardworking and responsible and she feels happy about the loan. She appreciates the Kiva investors and pledges to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and rice for her home.

loans.name: Ma. Felisa

texts.en:
Ma. Felisa is 43 years old and has 3 children. She is married and 2 of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Felisa is in the agriculture business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Ma. Felisa has been in the pig fattening business for 6 years now, and she has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Felisa would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Walter Edenilson

texts.es:
Walter, es un joven soltero, sin hijos su única responsabilidad es ayudar a su madre económicamente; él se dedica a la venta de ropa, su jornada laboral la inicia a las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., Walter inicio en este negocio al ver la necesidad de tener que llevar el sustento diario a su familia; en este caso a su mamá.
Solicita crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de blusas, pantalones y camisas; con esto el pretende poder incrementar su inventario y de esa manera atraer más clientes que le ayudaran a generar más ingresos para poderle dar una vida de calidad a su mamá. 
A Walter le gustaría en un futuro poder ampliar su negocio para tener más ingresos y así poder hacerle unas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Walter is a young single man with no children. His only responsibility is helping his mother financially. He sells clothes. His daily work schedule starts at 6:00 a.m. and goes until 4:00 p.m. Walter started this business when he saw the need to support his family, in this case his mother.

He is asking for the loan to invest it in buying blouses, pants and shirts. With this, he intends to increase his inventory and attract more customers, which will help generate more income to give his mother a better quality of life.

In the future, Walter would like to be able to expand his business in order to have more income and do some improvements on his home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Nohemi Ana

texts.es: Nohemi vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuantro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de joyeria de enchape y acero desde hace varios años, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso y colocando el techo pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios y asi tener una mejor casa donde puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Nohemi lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. She has been selling plated and steel jewelry for a number of years.

She wants to improve her home by cementing the floor and putting on the roof, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital she is applying for a loan for the purchase of the necessary construction materials to thus have a better house where they can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy materials necessary for construction.

loans.name: Franck Edwin

texts.es:
Franck Edwin con 23 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Franck Edwin se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte de mototaxi, en las zonas de Ucupe,Mocupe tradicional y Mocupe Nuevo, con una experiencia en el negocio desde hace 01 año. Solicita préstamo para invertir en repuestos para su moto.

Franck Edwin es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Franck Edwin is 23 years old. He is in a common law marriage. He lives with his spouse and their son in the district of Lagunas, province of Chiclayo,department of Lambayeque, in Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the area residents. The resident of this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce and in ranching.

Franck Edwin works driving a motorcycle taxi in the areas of Ucupe, Mocupe Tradicional and Mocupe Nuevo. He has had the business for 1 year. He is asking for this loan to invest in replacement parts for his motorcycle.

Franck Edwin is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in replacement parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ilma Amparo

texts.es: Ilma tiene 45 años de edad  de estado civil casada tienen una hija Tatiana de 18 años de edad estudia en una unidad educativa del sector, Conjuntamente con su esposo desde la mañana arreglan bicicletas este pequeño negocio les permite estar juntos, a la vez generan ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Ilma una persona trabajadora necesita el dinero para poder comprar repuestos, integrando al servicio de mantenimiento de bicicletas sin permitir que sus clientes se vayan a otro lugar a comprar  por la falta de los mismos, obtendría mayores ganancias podría  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Ilma is 45 years old and in a civil marriage. They have a daughter, 18-year-old Tatiana, who studies in the area's school.

Together with her husband, every morning they repair bicycles. This small business allows them to be together while generating income to cover their basic household expenses at the same time.

Ilma is a hard working person. She needs money in order to buy spare parts and integrate them into the bicycle maintenance service. This will prevent her clients from going to another store to buy when she lacks these things. She would gain larger profits and be able to continue fulfilling her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 57 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado, por la situación económica ya no pudo seguir estudiando, está casado y su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar y aves, tiene 5 hijos pero ya todos están acompañados solo dos nietos viven en casa.


Juan, desde la edad de 12 años se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de su abuelo, es así que ha podido sacar adelante todos sus hijos, él siembra de maíz y yuca su trabajo está a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa, el recorrido lo realiza en una bicicleta, su día de trabajo comienza a la 6:00 AM y regresa por la tarde a convivir con su familia.

El crédito será invertido para comprar dos vacas para repasto.

Juan sueña con  construir un pozo para regadillo y comprar ganado lechero y pagar su crédito de manera muy puntual para poder seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Juan is 57. He was only able to go to school until the 6th grade, and then he had to drop out due to the financial situation. He is married, and his wife works in the home and raises poultry. He has five children, but they all have partners. Only two grandchildren live in the home.

Juan has been working in agriculture since the age of twelve. He learned this occupation from his grandfather. This is how he has been able to provide for all his children. He grows corn and yucca 3 kilometers from his house, and he travels back and forth by bicycle. His work day begins at 6:00 AM and he returns in the afternoon to spend time with his family.

The loan will be invested to buy two beef cows.

Juan dreams of building a well for irrigation, buying dairy cows, and paying off his loan on time in order to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy two beef cows.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina es una  mujer de 41 años de edad, ella vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 18 años de edad y la compañera de vida de él. Ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este negocio, ya que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos. Reina desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda, el cual le brinde mayor seguridad, ya que como se observa en la fotografía ella ha protegido su vivienda con láminas deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y grava para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda que le permita mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, her 18 year old son and his wife. She has been selling seafood for 10 years. She is happy to have this business because she has more customers requesting her products every day.

Reina wants to build a perimeter wall for her home. It will provide greater security because, as seen in the photograph, she currently has damaged sheets. Reina requests a loan to buy cement, sand, brick, iron and gravel to build a perimeter wall for greater security for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron and gravel to build a perimeter wall for the greater security.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicita continua trabajando vendiendo chicha, negocio que le ayuda a seguir yendo  por su meta, que es abrir un restaurante. 
la socia Felicitas quiere producir más en su negocio y solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, indispensable para realizar esta bebida tradicional.
La socia es muy trabajadora y responsable  y se  siente  contenta con el préstamo y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA, ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Felicita continues to work selling chicha [a traditional corn-based beverage], a business which helps her to continue moving towards her goal, which is to open a restaurant.  The communal bank member wants to make more in her business and is asking for a loan to buy corn, essential for making this traditional beverage.  

She is very hard working and responsible.  She is happy with the loan and thanks Kiva investors.  She promises to make her instalment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 25 years old and has one child. Ma. Fe is a married woman.

Ma. Fe is in the agricultural rice farming business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es: Paola es una empresaria independiente que reside en compañía de sus dos hijos en Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca, y que en su rol de madre soltera necesitaba buscar alternativas que le generaran incrementos en su ingreso, fue entonces que encontró su oportunidad de negocio tras haber laborado en papelerías y misceláneas, negocios en los que pudo observar que el margen de utilidad en los productos de su oferta era bastante sustancioso, así que rentó un local en un centro comercial y lo surtió con productos de piñatería.  En la actualidad lleva un año de funcionamiento en su almacén con muy buenos resultados y como aprovecha las temporadas del año para comprar artículos alusivos a las fechas especiales, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital que invertirá en globos, serpentinas, decoración de Halloween, decoración navideña y demás producto novedosos. Esta inversión es muy importante para su negocio puesto que debe consecutivamente renovar su mercancía, por aquello de que las fiestas y decoraciones dependen mucho de la moda y nuevas tendencias, en el caso de las fiestas infantiles debe estar al tanto de los personajes infantiles del momento. Su meta de negocio es poder engrandecer su negocio y rentar un local más grande donde se puedan exhibir mejor el surtido.  En lo personal desea continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Paula is an independent entrepreneur who lives in the company of her two children in Madrid, a township of Cundinamarca. In her role as a single mother, she needed to look for alternatives that would generate increases in her income. It was then that she found her business opportunity through having worked in stationery and corner stores, businesses in which she could observe that the profit margin of the products offered for sale was quite substantial. Thus she rented a location in a commercial center and stocked it with party supplies.

At this time, her store has been functioning for a year, with very good results. As she is taking advantage of the seasons of the year to buy related articles for special dates, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, capital that she will invest in balloons, streamers, Halloween decorations, Christmas decorations, and other novelty products.

This investment is very important for her business, since she needs to refresh her merchandise consecutively, since the parties and decorations depend a lot on the fashion and the new trends. In the case of children's parties, she needs to be up to date on the children's characters of the moment.

Her business goal is to be able to enlarge her business and rent a bigger space where she can display her stock better. Her personal goal is to continue offering well-being to her family.

loans.use: to invest in balloons, streamers, Halloween decorations, Christmas decorations, and other novelty products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 48 years old and has five children. Remedios is married and has three children who are in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Remedios has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 32 years old and in the agricultural pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marivic has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of eight children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar primer grado, dejó la escuela muy pronto ya que su situación económica era muy difícil y no podía seguir estudiando, actualmente está acompañado y su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo uno vive en casa.


Desde los 10 años, José  se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, oficio  que le enseñó su padre, su jornada laboral comienza  a las 4:30 de la mañana ya que se levanta a ordeñar una vaca y luego la lleva al potrero y a la vez aprovecha de quedarse trabajando en su cultivo unas 6 horas, luego regresa a su casa para almorzar y a las 3:30 de la tarde regresa al campo a traer su ganado.
  
El crédito lo necesita para comprar una novilla para engorde y algunos insumos agrícolas. 


Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo ya que la que tiene es de adobe, además espera ayudar a su hijo a se prepare con una profesión  para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old. He was only able to study until first grade. He left school very quickly because his economic situation was very difficult and he could not continue studying. Nowadays he is married. His wife is a housewife and helps him with agriculture. He has two children, of which only one lives at home.

For the past 10 years, José has earned a living in agriculture and livestock, a trade his father taught him. His work day begins at 4:30 in the morning since he wakes up to milk the cow and then takes it to the pasture. At the same time, he takes advantage of staying and working on his crops for some 6 hours. Then he returns to his house to eat lunch. At 3:30 in the afternoon, he returns to the field to bring in his cattle.

He needs this loan in order to buy a heifer to fatten and some agricultural products.

His dream is to build a brick house since the one he has is of adobe. In addition, he hopes to help his son prepare himself for a profession so that he may have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to fatten and some agricultural products.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucresia has received several loans from CCT in the past, which contributed a lot in maintaining her transportation business and providing for her daily household and personal needs. 

She feels a sense of fulfillment for being productive by earning a living despite her old age and status as a widow. Not only this, but she can also help her children, grandchildren, and most especially the drivers who rent her jeepneys for income. She thanks God for Kiva and CCT for using them as instruments to assist hardworking entrepreneurs like her. 

This time she trusts that she would be granted another 20,000 PHP loan worth to buy the necessary spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepneys. She will use part of the loan to procure additional piglets and feed, because she has also started a hog fattening business just recently to augment her income and savings.

Every week, Lucresia meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepneys, and buy additional piglets and feed for her hog fattening venture.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: Con 49 años de edad Dora ha logrado comprar una vivienda en la que vive con su esposo desde hace 1 año, por lo que se siente feliz, pero su vivienda no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan dulce especial, el cual cuenta con una gran demanda por parte de sus clientes. Dora desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda, ya que ha llegado un proyecto que facilitara la instalación de la misma, por lo que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: toma corriente, caja térmica, alambre eléctrico, entre otros materiales para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
49 year old Dora has managed to buy a house and has lived there with her husband for 1 year. For this she feels very happy, but her home does not have electricity. She has made a living making special sweet bread, for which she has high demand from her customers.

Dora wants to install electricity in her home and for this reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in outlets, circuit breaker, electrical wire, and other materials to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to invest in outlets, circuit breaker, electrical wire, and other materials to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Kelly Martha

texts.es:
Kelly es una socia muy trabajora ya que se dedica todo el día a su negocio .ella se  sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros.
la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar focos y parabrisas.
La socia está muy contenta y agrádese por el préstamo adquirido, como toda persona responsable ella cumplirá con pagar sus cuotas acordadas en la fechas indicadas.
texts.en: Kelly is a very hardworking client. She spends all day working at her business. She continues running her used car parts business. Kelly needs the loan to purchase headlights and windshields. She is very happy and grateful for the loan she has received. Always a responsible person, she will comply by making her loan repayments on the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to purchase headlights and windshields.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a divorced woman and she has two children. Her former husband doesn’t help her feed or care for the children. So, Tahmina is only caregiver for her children.

Tahmina has her own business: she is a sewer. Tahmina sews a variety of women's clothes in her workshop which is situated in the central unit of her region. She has worked in this field for more than 6 years and little by little, with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge.

Tahmina is going to buy fabrics and a sewing machine with her loan. From her profits she will get her children better quality education. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Jebelyn

texts.en:
Jebelyn is 31 years old and married.

Jebelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jebelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jebelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 59 years old and has six children. Catalina is widowed and has three children who are in school.

Catalina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Catalina has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. Leonila is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonila has been in this business for 14 years now.

Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice selling business, which she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of competition in her business.
With the 30,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and has three children. Evelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evelyn has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Regina Amalia

texts.es:
Regina, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, su negocio es la venta de comida, bebidas y otros productos comestibles, ella comenta que aprendió este oficio gracias a unas amistades, que le daban empleo como ayudante, luego de un tiempo decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de comida y lo comenzó  con capital propio, ahora ya tiene 5 años de ofrecer variedad de platillos de comida.
Ella solicita crédito para poder abastecerse de artículos que necesita a diario para la elaboración de la comida que ofrece a sus clientes, comprara pollo, arroz, frijoles, maíz, carnes, aceites, bebidas refrescantes etc., con esto ella pretende fortalecer su negocio y así mismo poder aumentar las ventas y generar más ingresos que le permitirán darle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
Como toda persona Regina tiene sueños y metas por cumplir, uno de sus sueños es poder construir su propia vivienda y convertirse en una microempresaria reconocida en su municipio.
texts.en:
Regina is married and has two children that are financially dependent on her. Her business sells food, drinks and other grocery products. She mentions that she learned this occupation thanks to some friends that gave her a job as a helper. After some time she decided to start her own business selling food. She started it with her own capital and she has been offering a variety of food dishes for five years now.

She is requesting a loan in order to stock up on the items that she needs daily to make the food that she offers her customers. She will buy chicken, rice, beans, corn, meats. oils, refreshing drinks, etc. With this she intends to strengthen her business and at the same time increase her sales and generate more income that will allow her to give her family group a better quality of life.

Like all people, Regina has dreams and goals to reach. One of her dreams is to build her own home and become a recognized small business in her town.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, corn, meats. oils, refreshing drinks, etc. With this she intends to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un joven muy emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, Diego cuenta que gracias al crédito él pudo comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes, a  Dios gracias obtuvo una buena cosecha y en su mercado regional lo pudo vender. Diego es un joven que se esmera para ganar el pan de cada día, él tiene la necesidad de solicitar otro préstamo para seguir cultivando, con el crédito el comprara semillas de zanahoria, pues la época de verano se acerca y esta verdura es adecuada para cultivar en esta temporada.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida, es tener su propia casa, mejorar los ingresos económicos para ofrecerle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Diego is a very entrepreneurial young man.  He is 20 years old, and he is single.  Diego says that thanks to the loan, he was able to buy his seeds and fertilizers.  Thanks to God, he had a good crop, and he was able to sell it in his regional market.  Diego is a young man who strives to earn the daily bread.  

He needs to request another loan to continue cultivating.  With the loan he will buy carrot seeds, since the summer time is coming and this vegetable is suitable to grow in this season.

His aspirations in life are to have his own house and to improve his economic income to offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: To buy carrot seeds.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past four years. She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Shazia is a responsible mother of four children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of her husband. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: To invest in her palor.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 21 years old, single and resides in Calmaba, Misamis Occidental. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store for 2 years to earn her living. Through this business, she was able to provide for her family's basic needs and give some of her income to her mother.  She was also able to help her siblings by paying for some of their tuition fees. She borrowed this loan in order to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store so she could increase her income and expand her business.  She wants to make sure that if she decides to get married in the near future, she will be able to support her husband financially and provide for the needs of her parents.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Natali Pamela

texts.es:
Natali Pamela con 29 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Natali Pamela cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y tubérculos el público en general, en su bodega ubicada en Pomalca. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de cerdos y cuyes. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería papa,verduras y otros, así mismo para realizar trabajos en acabados en el baño de su casa.

Natali Pamela cuenta con experiencia crediticia en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Natali Pamela is 29 years old.  She has a common law marriage.   She lives with her spouse and her youngest son in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, Peru.  Natali Pamela has very good references, as many personal as work related through the inhabitants of the area.  The majority of people in this town work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

She works selling vegetables and roots in general in her grocery store located in Pomalca.  Additionally, she works raising pigs and Guinea pigs.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as potatoes, vegetables, and others, and also work on finishing the bathroom in her house.

Natali Pamela has loan experience with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as potatoes, vegetables, and others, and also work on finishing the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marisa works very hard to provide for them.

Marisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Marisa has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 34-year-old woman living with her family in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a dairy farm for about a year and generates income for his family. He sells milk to retailers and to the people of his community. He gets milk two times in a day, and his wife and daughters produce cheese, yogurt and butter from the milk. With the addition of these productions, he earns sufficient income to run a house.
This time, he wants to build a new cowshed for cattle because the old cowshed is in very poor condition. He does not have enough cash on hand to maintain the cowshed and buy fodder to feed his cattle.
Therefore, Nabeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can build up the cowshed and easily continue his business. He has to maximize his savings so that he can fulfill his responsibilities. He thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's milk shop.

loans.name: Jaide David

texts.es:
El socio Jaide es muy responsable y se sigue dedicándose a su labor de mecánico, este trabajo es muy difícil pero él sigue adelante junto con su familia para tener mejor calidad de vida.
El socio solicito el préstamo para tener más herramientas de trabajo que le facilite su labor. El préstamo será para comprar guantes, gata mecánica y aceite de carros.
El está muy agradecido y contento con los inversionistas de KIVA porque gracias al préstamo adquirirá herramientas útiles para mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Jaide is very responsible and he continues working in his job as a mechanic.  This job is very difficult but he keeps going together with his family to have a better quality of life.
 
Jaide is requesting the loan to have more working tools that will make is work easier.  The loan will be to buy gloves, a mechanical jack, and motor oil.  

He is very grateful and happy with the Kiva investors because thanks to the loan, he has acquired useful tools to improve his service.

loans.use: To buy gloves, a mechanical jack, and motor oil.

loans.name: Santos Ernesto

texts.es:
Santos de 52 años, estudió hasta segundo grado, actualmente está casado, su esposa se dedica trabajar como ama de casa, tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian, los otros han terminado su educación media.


Desde los 15 años, Santos trabajaba como jornalero en las haciendas donde se cultiva café, ahí realizaba labores como podar, ahoyar, abonar y cortar el producto. A la edad de 20 aprendió el oficio de aserrar madera, ya que su padre realizaba esa actividad. Actualmente Santos es aserrador de madera, y cultiva dos hectáreas de terreno, en donde produce maíz y frijol. Desde el año pasado ha iniciado a trabajar en la crianza de ganado. En estas actividades recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes reconocen el trabajo que su padre realiza, para que en su hogar no falte la alimentación diaria. El lugar donde cultiva está aproximadamente a un kilómetro de su casa, y lo recorre a pie todos los días, y trabaja de 6:00 AM a 12:00 PM.



El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una novilla, de esta forma podrá seguir creciendo en la nueva actividad que ha iniciado.

Santos continua con el sueño de comprar un terreno donde realizar la siembra de granos básicos y desea que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios de bachiller.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old.  He studied until 2nd grade.  Now he is married.  His wife works taking care of the house.  They have four children, of which two go to school.  The others have finished their secondary education.

Since he was 15, Santos worked as a laborer on the farms where they cultivate coffee.  There, he did jobs such as pruning, digging holes, fertilizing, and harvesting.  At the age of 20, he learned the trade of sawing lumber since his dad did this job.  Now Santos is a wood sawyer and he cultivates two hectares of land in which he produces corn and beans.  Since last year, he has started a business in raising cattle.  In these jobs, he receives help from his children who know the job that their father does, so that in their home they do not lack daily food.  The place where he cultivates is approximately a kilometer from his house, and he walks it by foot everyday, and he works from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm. 

The loan will be used to buy a heifer and in this way be able to continue growing the new business that he has started.

Santos still has a dream to buy land where he can plant basic grain and wants that his children can finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a heifer and in this way to able to continue growing in the new job that he has started.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, es una mujer viuda que vive únicamente con su hija, por su situación ella es la cabeza del hogar, se dedica a la venta de pan variado por las mañanas y por las tardes vende tamales y otro tipo de merienda, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su madrastra, ya que le ayudaba en el negocio que ella tenía, cuando Blanca estableció su hogar decidió poner su propio negocio y ser una vendedora independiente para poder generar sus propios ingresos, hoy en día ella ya tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este oficio. 
Está solicitando un crédito para poder fortalecer su negocio, lo invertirá en materia prima como: verduras, maíz, aceite, carnes, pollo, especias, entre otros, para la elaboración de tamales y la venta de comida, con el objetivo de poder ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y percibir más ingresos económicos que le permitirán poder tener una vida más digna junto a su hija.
Uno de los sueños de Blanca es poder remodelar su vivienda, ampliar su negocio agregar más productos de consumo, poder crecer  como microempresaria y darle es sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is a widow who only lives with her daughter. Due to her situation, she is the head of her household. She works selling a variety of bread by morning, and tamales and other snacks in the afternoon. She learned this trade thanks to her stepmother, because she helped her with the business she used to have. When Blanca established her home, she decided to start her own business and be an independent vendor in order to generate her own income. Now, she has 7 years of experience in this line of work.

Blanca is requesting a loan to be able to strengthen her business. She will invest it in basic staples, like vegetables, corn, oil, meat, chicken, spices, and other things, for the production of tamales and for food sales, the goal being to be able to offer more products to her clients, and to have more economic gains. This will allow her to have a more dignified life together with her daughter.

One of Blanca's dreams is to be able to remodel her home, grow her business, and add more consumer goods to be able to grow as a micro-enterprise, and give support to her family.

loans.use: to invest in staple items such as: vegetables, corn, oil, meat, chicken, spices, among other things, for the production of tamales and food sales.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre y sus hermanas.

	 Edwin es agricultor de toda su vida, ya que desde los 7 años empezó a trabajar junto con su padre, ahora cultiva 7,000 mts cuadrados  de       cultivo de maíz y frijol, el cual esta a 1 km de su casa. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm también se ha dedicado a crianza de ganado y trabajar como jornalero.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto.

Edwin tiene el sueño de tener una casa propia, para el momento cuando decida formar su hogar pueda darles una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin is 34 years old.  He studied until the 3rd grade.  He is single and he does not have children.  He lives with his mother and his sisters.

Edwin has been a farmer his whole life since, at 7 years of age, he began working together with his father.  Now he cultivates 7,000 meters squared of corn and beans, which is 1 kilometer from his house.  He works from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm.  Also, he works raising cattle and working as a laborer.

The loan will be used to buy pasture cattle.

Edwin has a dream of having his own house, so that when the time comes to have a family, he can give them a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy pasture cattle.

loans.name: Olmedo

texts.es:
Olmedo con 40 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Olmedo se dedica al comercio,cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes en general, su tienda está ubicada en su propio domicilio, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente cuenta con un horno artesanal en el cuál elabora pan. Solicita préstamo para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes, arreglo de su local y en la compra de mercadería para surtir más su negocio.De esta manera adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Olmedo es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa, es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Olmedo is 40 years old, in a domestic partnership and living with his partner and their children. They live in the San Felipe district in the Jaén province in the department of Cajamarca in the country of Perú. The residents of this area work primarily in agriculture, commerce and ranching.
Olmedo is a salesman. He has a store from which he sells general groceries. He has run this store out of his home for the past ten years. Olmedo also has an artisan oven in which he makes bread. He requests this loan to invest in his grocery store, to fix up the area and to purchase merchandise to stock the store. In this way, he will be able to earn enough income to improve his quality of life. 
Olmedo is a returning client with Edpyme Alternativa, this is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Basiliso

texts.en:
Basiliso is 59 years old and has two children. Basiliso is a married woman.

Basiliso is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Basiliso requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Basiliso has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Basiliso would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 41 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, Marianita works very hard to provide for them.

Marianita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, candies, etc., to sell.

Marianita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, candies, etc.

In the future, Marianita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, candies, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 68 years old and has five children. Caridad is married, and three of her children are in school.

Caridad is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Caridad requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Caridad has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Caridad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Debashis

texts.en:
Debashis is 20 years old, studious and an intelligent boy from Jajpur district of Odisha, India. His parents' most cherished dream has been for Debashis to get a good education and build a successful career. Debashis belongs to a middle-class family, and his parents have not left any stone unturned in order to provide the best educational facilities to Debashis.

Debasis wants to pursue his technical course, but due to his financial constraints he is facing numerous difficulties in order to undertake the course. He wants a loan of 50,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a Certified Professional Accountant (CPA). He is interested to pursue this course as this is a growing field with a huge range of job opportunities. A competent professional accountant is an invaluable asset to the company.

Your loan amount can help Debashis complete his course successfully and get a job with a handsome package. Debashis is eagerly awaiting for your kind hearts to help him achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a Certified Professional Accountant (CPA).

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Nelly has been in this business for four years. Nelly earns additional income from a general store.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia, a beverage seller from Tigbauan, Iloilo. She buys cases of soft drinks, beer, and other bottled drinks then she retails it by the bottle in her stall located in the town’s public market. She has been doing this for ten years and it has provided well for her family's everyday needs. However, her storage container has been robbed thrice. This is the reason why she wants to repair her stall and stock room so as to make it more secured from robbers and also from harsh weather or other calamities. 

Herminia is married to Rogelio, a retiree, and they both dream to improve their business. They aspire to become wholesalers of beverages and build a bigger stock room someday. But for now, Herminia is requesting PHP 40,000 of supplementary capital to buy more cases of soft drinks, beer, and other beverages. She will set aside some amount for stock room renovation. She hopes you can extend your heartfelt generosity to her. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks, beer, and other beverages to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 47 years old and married with two children. Estela works very hard to provide for them.

Estela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries to sell.

Estela has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Estela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over eleven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 44 years old and has seven children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Fatima is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Fatima has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Diosdada has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photo is  Grace, thirty eight  years old, married and a mother  of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015 to gain skills on  enterprise management.
She runs a cereal shop to earn a living. She is borrowing Kiva to buy more stock of maize and beans for her cereals shop. She looks forward to more sales thus more income. She hopes this will help her cater for her family’s basic needs and also pay school fees for her children.
Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and beans for her cereals shop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with four children.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 31 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, cereals, milk, juice, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, cereals, milk, juice, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, cereals, milk, juice, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Curita

texts.en:
Curita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Curita is 49 years old and both of her children are in school.

Curita has a yakult vending business in the Philippines. Curita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of yakult to sell to her customers.

Curita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Curita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of yakult (a probiotic drink) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evadesi

texts.en:
Evadesi a 48-year-old mother of 4 children who living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Evadesi has operated a retail shop for 10 years which is gradually growing and also has a cocoa garden from where she gets additional income by selling cocoa to cocoa traders. She is a determined lady and has plans of expanding her business into a wholesale shop.

She faces a challenge of limited capital to buy enough stock for trading. She used the previous loan to add capital to her business ans is quit impressed by the increase in sales volume. She is asking for a second loan to buy more merchandise like soap, sugar, tea leaves and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like soap, sugar, tea leaves and salt to sell.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the age of 53; she is mother of a son and living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general shop in which he sells detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own shop as well. Some relative like to purchase from him also.

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Kalsoom thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.
Kalsom hopes that her son will utilize the loan in positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand of the family. she thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her son's general shop.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Battambang province, Vann is 35 years old and she is a married mother of two school-aged children. She has been growing rice and cassava for ten years to earn main source of income. Additionally, she works for others for a fee to make more income. About USD12 is earned every single day while she can manage to save about USD5 each day. Drought is the obstacle to farming business. 
She decided to form a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer. The rest of money will be spend on plowing fee and to pay for farmland rental fee. She hopes she can get more income from her business so that she can expand her business bigger and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield so that she can expand her business

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzameis married with six school going children. They live at their own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Asongtaaba - Nyariga Doonie Gs Group

texts.en:
Hana is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of 4. She lives in Nyariga-Doonie, a community neighboring Bolga in the upper east region of Ghana. Hana is the woman seated at the left with the hand raised in the group photo. Hana belongs to a group called ‘Asontaba - Nyariga Doonie GS’.

Hana is very actively engaged in the small scale trading of food stuff at the local market. She has been a trader over the past 10 years .She is also engaged in small scale farming to supplement her income. Hana and her group have requested for a loan of GHC 7150.00. Her share of the loan is GHC 600.00 which she would use to buy food stuff for retail at home market. She hopes to expand her business into a major supplier store with several employees.
Hana wants to get more income from her business to provide her children with the motherly support. She thanks Kiva lenders for the opportunity to be a good mother to her children.

loans.use: to buy food stuff for resale at the home market. .

loans.name: Somsaard Group

texts.en: Souk understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Souk knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Souk purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Souk is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 24 years old. He is a single freshmen who is from Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. His father is a Khmer traditional musician and his mother is a homemaker. His major at the university in the city is business administration. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan.

With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, Ry dreams of saving money to run his own business, build a fence around his parents' house and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor's or master's degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year
